Vende mais recargas para celulares e consegue um rendimento diário no valor de 1.500,00MT e poupa cerca de 7.000,00MT mensalmente.

Já teve empréstimos com outras instituições e quando ouviu falar das condições oferecidas pela Hluvuku-Adsema, através das amigas, pagou a divida que tinha e correu para solicitar este primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de diversos refrigerantes e recargas para celulares.

Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a novos empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de melhorar o seu negocio aumentando o volume do mesmo.
texts.en:
Veronica Zefanias M. was born in the district of Manhica (72km north of Maputo), she is 44 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them are adults and are studying at Maputo's schools. Veronica studied until the 5th grade having to stop because her parents lacked the financial resources to keep her in school. She grew up in Manhica and when she was 20, she moved with her husband to the city of Maputo, after their marriage. They were able to buy land and built a house with regular materials where they live with their children and two grand children who are their responsibility. Their business is to sell snacks, drinks, re-chargeable cards for cell phones and other groceries for the last 8 years. She learned the business with her husband's help. She sells more cell phone cards and obtains a daily income of 1.500,00MT and saves close to 7.000,00MT monthly. Veronica already had credit with other institutions and when she heard about the conditions offered by Hluvuku-Adsema, from some friends, she paid out the balance and run to request her first loan for 20.000,00MT to buy diverse snacks and cards for cell phones. She expects to pay without any problem and be able to get new loans and fulfill her dream to improve her business, by increasing its size.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks and cards for cell phones

loans.name: Joha

texts.en:
Joha is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 12 and 3 years.she also cares for other  1 dependent.

Joha started her own business selling cooking oil 2 years ago,she works 2  hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more cooking oil for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Joha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah N. is aged 41 years and is a married mother of two children, Newton and Susan. She is married to Duncan Kivida who is aged fifty years. 

Monicah runs a restaurant in Changamwe,Mombasa and she mainly sells roast meat. She has been in the business for 13 years, and her customers have been the residents of Changamwe and business people of the town. This will her first time borrowing from KADET and she plans to purchase more chairs, to repair the hotel floor (in Kenya- hotel is a small restaurant) and to purchase a new meat roasting jiko (stove).

She delights in satisfying her customers and in the future plans to open a similar restaurant in the same or another town to maximize her income.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, to repair the hotel floor and to purchase a new meat roasting jiko.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne K. is 48 years old and is married with five children aged between 20 and 11. He lives in the Gasabo District of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Etienne owns a small shop where he has sold different kinds of products such as sugar, salt, rice, juice and soap since 2001. He operates his business everyday from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Before this loan he is requesting from Vision Finance Company, his business could not give him enough profit and he was not able to afford health care for his children or pay their school fees. With this new loan he hopes to generate extra profits which will help him to change the life of his family. It will also help him to expand the business so that he earns more profits in future.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is a taho vendor in her village. Taho is a snack in the Philippines made of fresh soft/silken tofu with arnibal (brown sugar and vanilla syrup) and pearl sago. She usually carries two large aluminum buckets that hang from each end of a yoke. The bigger bucket carries the tofu base while the smaller one holds the arnibal and sago "pearls". She keeps working hard so that she can continue to send her children to school, since they are only at the elementary level. Jenny is 29 years old and blessed with two children. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Their income is just enough for their daily needs. With a dream to improve her business, Jenny wants a loan of 6,000 pesos from the Kiva lenders. This money will help make her business productive.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Antonia Gladys

texts.es: La señora Antonia F. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive en casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores. Ella es natural del Caserío de Córdova – Huancavelica, actualmente vive en Caserío San Antonio perteneciente al distrito de Santiago – ICA. Es una persona muy trabajadora que ha comprado su propio terreno y brinda educación a sus hijos tratando de mejorar su forma de vida. Se dedica al negocio de venta de abarrotes en general habiendo implementado una pequeña bodega desde hace 1 año aproximadamente. Además se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos teniendo una pequeña granja en su propio domicilio. Empezó con un capital propio producto de la venta de cerdos. Requiere financiamiento para comprar mercadería y aumentar sus ventas en estos meses de Fiestas Navideñas. Su sueño es construir su casa de material  noble y hacer crecer su negocio para bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia F. is 44 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her two youngest children. She is from Caserío de Córdova, Huancavelica. She currently lives in Caserío San Antonio, in the district of Santiago, Ica. She is a very hardworking person who has bought her own land and who is providing an education to her children to improve their lives. She sells groceries and has had a small grocery store for approximately 1 year. She also raises and sells pigs since she has a small farm where she lives. She started her business with her own capital that she got from selling pigs. She needs a loan to buy merchandise and increase her sales during the Christmas holidays. Her dream is to build a house with good materials and to grow her business for the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the Christmas shopping season

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el sector Las Dunas, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 24 años se dedica al comercio de pescado fresco y salado en el mercado central de la ciudad. El nos cuenta que antes trabajaba como estibador en Bayóvar (Piura) y observando la intensa actividad de los comerciantes pesqueros de la zona aprendió lo que necesitaba y empezó a trabajar en este negocio.

El adquiere su mercadería de lunes a viernes en el terminal pesquero de la región (ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa), los sábados la compra en el terminal de Piura. El pescado que compra los días sábado lo procesa en el mismo mercado para venderlo como pescado seco – salado los domingos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

Carmen está solicitanto por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para mantener su negocio durante esta época en que el pescado se pone escaso y sube de precio.

El es un padre honrado y trabajador. Es muy conocido y estimado por sus compañeros de trabajo. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando y comprarse una movilidad propia para poder transportar su mercancía con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 49 year old father who lives with his wife and three children in the Las Dunas district, located in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 24 years, Carmen has been selling both fresh and salted fish from the central city market. Prior to being a fish vendor, he worked as a longshoreman in Bayóvar (Piura). While at that job, he noticed the intense activity of the local fish traders. He was determined to learn about the business, which led to where he is today.

Carmen acquires his inventory Monday through Friday at the local fishing terminals in the district of Santa Rosa. On Saturday, he buys additional inventory at the terminal in Piura. He then returns to his market stall to process the fish from Piura for drying. The dried fish is salted the following day. Carmen's vending business is the only source of income for his family.

He is requesting his first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles. The money will be used to buy more fish because the available supply during this time of the year is lower, so prices are more expensive.

Carmen is an honest and hardworking father. He is well-known and respected among his colleagues. He hopes to continue working as well as purchase a vehicle so that he can transport his goods more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish for processing & selling

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née le 30 Juin 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Emilienne est mariée à ATCHEOU Rodolph et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Emilienne vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint depuis une dizaine d’année à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Emilienne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Emilienne vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de la sauce aux légumes et du poisson, et du riz). Emilienne  s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Emilienne a déjà acquis 20 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ; mais elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Afin de développer son activité et de l’agrandir davantage, Emilienne sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Emilienne was born on June 30, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ATCHEOU Rodolph and is the mother of four children who are all in school.  For 12 years, Emilienne has been living with her children and husband in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou.  She comes to her husband's aid to meet family expenses.  Emilienne sells food (cornmeal mash served with a sauce made with vegetables and fish; and rice).  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She already has 20 years of experience in this business;  but she has never had an ALIDé loan.  To develop her business and to enlarge it still, she's requesting her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and rice

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
la sra. Opal Amparo Almendares se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, compra fardos de ropa que viene de estados unidos, este tipo de mercaderia es muy bien vendida en esta zona, siempre la ropa que viene en los fardos es ropa de marca que dura mucho.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que tiene muy buenos precios de venta, a veces las personas no tienen mucho dinero para comprar ropa nueva y optan por comprar ropa de segunda que les sirve igual como si fuera ropa nueva.
esta empezando con su negocio, pero cada dia que pasa esta vendiendo mas y las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes, desea comprar mas fardos de ropa y poder abastecerse de ropa para la epoca de navidad ya que para esos dias las personas compran mucho.
texts.en:
Sra. Opal Amparo Almendares sells used clothing. She buys clothes that come from the United States by the bundle. This type of merchandise sells very well in the area. The clothes always come in bundles and consist of name-brand products that are very durable.

Her customers prefer to buy from her because she offers very good prices. Sometimes people do not have enough money to buy new clothes, so they choose to buy secondhand clothing and treat it as if it were new.

Sra. Opal is just starting her business, but with each passing day, she sells more merchandise and customer demand keeps growing. She wants to acquire more bundles of clothing and take advantage of the Christmas season because people are buying more during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Nuestro socio CARLOS tiene 23 años es casado y tiene una hija. El socio es chofer, tiene su propio automóvil para hacer el servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco. EL socio hace el servicio por los distritos del Cusco como; San Jerónimo, Santiago y San Sebastián. Ya son varios años que hace el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. El socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento al carro y desea adquirir repuestos como llantas nuevas y suspensores pues son muy importantes para su mejor funcionamiento. El socio nos cuenta que el carro es el principal medio de ingreso para su económico familiar pues tiene que estar operativo todos los días.
      
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. En la foto el socio aparece acompañado de su esposa y su hija.
texts.en:
Carlos is 23 years old, married and has a daughter. He makes a living as a taxi driver and provides service out of his own car to the different districts in the city of Cusco, such as San Jerónimo, Santiago y San Sebastián. He has several years of experience in the profession and things have gone very well thanks to all the hard work he puts into his job. Carlos is a hard-working and enterprising father who continues to make headway for his family despite life's difficulties. He is requesting the loan to make repairs on his car and to purchase parts such as new tires and suspension since they are very important to the vehicle's improvement. Carlos tells us that his car is the main source of income for his family, so he needs to operate it every day. He is a member of the “HUAYNA CCAPAC” Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa in the province of Cusco, Peru. Carlos is grateful for the opportunities from this service and promises to fulfill his payment obligations on time. He is accompanied by his wife and daughter in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his taxi and purchase parts such as new tires and suspension

loans.name: Ihingiro Development Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
Denis B. is the leader of his lending group in Rukungiri. He is 40 years old and married, and has four children, ages 8 - 13 years old. They also care for an orphan. All of the children are in primary school. 

Denis has a bar and a butcher shop, where he sells pork, in Katojo Cell Buyanja Trading Centre. He has run his business for 15 years and he is able to make 70,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profit every week. He attributes his success to having confidence in himself and his business, in addition to the trust from his customers.

He would like to buy a car to help with the transportation for his business and to hire out as a taxi. He also hopes to educate his children to higher standards. Denis would like to restock his businesses by buying more beer, soda, a pig, and other meat to open new markets in other areas in the future. He is such a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy meat and pork to sell in his butcher shop, and to buy more beer for his bar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer que ve las adversidades como retos, tiene 35 años y está casada con Nildo, de 37 años. Esta pareja tienen dos hijos; Mayli de 4 y Gabriela de 3 años.

Desde hace 14 años se dedica a  sembrar papa, arveja y flor de gladiolo con la ayuda de su esposo y de su hija mayor. De sus labores agrícolas lo que más le gusta es ver florecer sus cultivos de papa porque el tamaño del tallo le avisa que tan fructífera será su cosecha e incluso el tamaño del tubérculo. Es así que muestra orgullosa sus cultivos en la foto: “la agricultura es bastante rentable porque aparte de cubrir todos los gastos para vivir, deja ganancias considerables que se pueden ahorrar”, manifiesta contenta Esther.
Para el futuro, está pensando sembrar en mayor cantidad porque está segura de poder cuidar adecuadamente sus tierras.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y confía en que podrá pagarlo puntualmente, ya que para ella el crédito significa una oportunidad para salir adelante. Además está feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal pues está conformado por personas organizadas y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja y un saco de abono.
texts.en:
Esther is a woman that sees difficulties as challenges. She is 35 years old and is married to Nildo, who is 37 years old. The couple has two childen: Mayli is 4 and Gabriela is 3 years old.

For the past 14 years, she has planted potatoes, peas, and gladiolus flowers with the help of her husband and their older daughter. What she likes most about farming is seeing her potatoes thrive because the size of the stem tells her how fruit-bearing her crop will be, including the size of the tuber. She shows her pride in her crops in the foto: “farming is rather profitable because aside from covering all of the living expenses, it leaves considerable earnings that can be saved”, Esther says happily. In the future, she is planning to plant greater quantities because she is sure that she will be able to adequately take care of her lands.

This is her second loan with MFP and she trusts that she will be able to make her payments on time, since the loan is an opportunity to succeed for her. In addition, she is happy to work in her communal bank because it consists of organized and hardworking people. With this loan she will purchase 3 bags of pea seeds and a sack of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 60 años de edad, es separado y vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se gana la vida realizando reparaciones y mantenimiento de artefactos eléctricos y electrónicos. Posee un taller en su vivienda donde trabaja todos los días, la calidad y responsablidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que su negocio sea conocido y que siempre tenga clientes que lleguen a solicitar sus servicios.

La continua demanda por su negocio ha hecho que tenga que viajar continuamente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirir repuestos, lo que supone un gasto excesivo para su economía. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de circuitos integrados, condensadores, parlantes y otros repuestos con los que pueda tener un sotck permanente en su negocio.

Julio es una persona bastante honrada y que gusta mucho de lo que hace. Sus vecinos y clientes lo estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Julio is 60 years old, separated and lives in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He repairs and maintains electrical appliances for a living. Julio owns a workshop in his home from where he works on a daily basis. The quality of his work and his sense of responsibility mean he is highly regarded and sought after. The continual demand for his services means that he has to travel regularly to Chiclayo to procure spare parts, something which creates considerable financial strain. Therefore, Julio has felt compelled for the first time to request a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. The money is to go towards the purchase of circuits, condensers, speakers and other spare parts in order to ensure a permanent stock of supplies. Julio is a very honest person who loves his job. Both his neighbours and clients value him highly.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to increase his business supplies.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 53 years old and lives with her three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Since Tsetsegmaa hurt her leg last December, her oldest daughter has been running her business. Her youngest daughter goes to secondary school in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since they started their second-hand products trading business, their quality of life has improved. Because of their hard work and determination, they have been able to buy a plot of land with a house and yard. They also bought a car in December.  She would like to ensure that her family is financially secure and able to pay the expenses of her youngest daughter until she graduates secondary school and finds a job. During the day, Tsetsegmaa has been operating her second hand products trading business at the central market since 2008.  Previously, she had worked as a shoemaker for 23 years, and Tsetsegmaa is a professional shoemaker.  She has been planning to continue stabilizing her business and to rent a counter for a food trading business at the new trading center. Her oldest daughter will run the second hand products business separately. Tsetsegmaa is an open person and says, “First, I would like to heal my leg and be healthy.” She is requesting a 2,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase six packages of inventory for her business. One package of inventory has an average cost of 200,000 – 400,000 tugrugs.

loans.use: To purchase six packages of inventory for her business

loans.name: Trust Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
B. Vincent (pictured inset top left as well as in the group photo) is the leader of his lending group in Mukono, a group that meets in a church. He is 33 years old and married with four children, the eldest of whom is eight years old. He also takes care of four siblings.
Vincent is from Terere village. For the past six years, he has worked as a boda-boda (bicycle taxi) driver and a builder. His main business challenge is the scarcity of clients for both businesses, but despite this, he is able to make 70,000 UGX profits every week. He works very hard to ensure that he earns enough to pay school fees for his children so that they can have a better future. Vincent is requesting a loan to buy more equipment for his building business so that he can provide better services. He hopes to buy, among other things, a wheelbarrow and a ladder.

loans.use: To buy a wheelbarrow and a ladder, plus other items

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., aged 37, is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business producing Cambodian noodles at home, earning gross income of USD 15 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Keo S. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a stock of rice from which to produce the noodles. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to produce Cambodian noodles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 28-year-old married lady who has one child.  She has been running a salon for three years.  She is a member of Faulu Kenya under the group 'Turbo Investor' who support her in case she takes a loan.  She wants to buy hair products to add to the inventory in her salon.  Therefore, she has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to open up other salons in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair products

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has been a farmer in Naivasha for the last four years. She generally sells her products at the Naivasha market. She plants maize, beans, kale and other vegetables, which she harvests and sells. 

She is 23 years old and married to Samuel Ndungu. They have two children in school.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy pesticides and fertilizers to help increase her yield.

She plans to start large-scale farming in the future so that she can supply products to the main market in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her crops

loans.name: Carmentina Lilii

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmentina S. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva, lociones, carteras, relojes y otras variedades,  actividad a la cual se a dedicado desde hace 17 años y lo hace de manera ambulante, es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.- sus clientes potenciales son los empleados de las empresas gubernamentales (Maestros, secretarias, aseadoras, promotores etc.) y tambien de la empresa privada, a todos les da el producto con facilidades de pago.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por las facilidades de pago que les da y los productos que son de muy buena calidad y de marcas reconocidas.
Doña Carmentina es casada y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo al cual le cubre a un 100% los gastos; su esposo trabaja de tramitador de documentos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar carteras, cremas, zapatos y otros productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
Carmentina S. sells new clothes, lotions, purses, watches and other merchandise. She has been in this line of work for 17 years and does it in an itinerant manner. It’s notable that during this time she has known how to administer it well. Her potential customers are employees of governmental agencies (teachers, secretaries, cleaning staff, spokespersons, etc.) and people in the private sector; she provides them all with easy payment plans. She has won over her customers with the easy payment plans she offers them and with the high quality of the well-known brand-name products she offers. Carmentina is married but only has one child that still depends 100% on her; her husband works as a document expediter. She will use the funds to buy purses, creams, shoes and other personal use items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, purses, creams, shampoo, hair conditioner.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Née en 1973, H. Emilienne est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Emilienne est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants depuis un an à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Seule Emilienne assure les différentes charges familiales. Emilienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Emilienne vend des tissus et des fournitures scolaires à son domicile, ce qui l'aide à subvenir aux différents besoins de sa famille. Emilienne exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de sept prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La demande de la clientèle de Emilienne devient de plus en plus forte. Afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de parvenir à satisfaire tous ses clients, Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Emilienne H. is the mother of four children, of whom some attend (or have attended) school. She is a widow who for the past year has been living with her children in Lokokoukoumè, in the Sèmè-Podji commune. She is alone to deal with the various family expenses. Emilienne has not attended school herself. For the past ten years she has retailed clothing fabric and school supplies from her home, which helps her meet her family’s needs. She is a former client of ALIDé, having already been granted seven loans, all repaid in full. Emilienne’s customers are steadily increasing. She is requesting another loan to increase her stock of supplies and manage to satisfy all her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing fabric and school supplies

loans.name: Diego Ramon

texts.es:
El sr.  Diego Ramon I. C. tiene 33 años y esta casado con la señora Roberta Benitez Cáceres de  29 años, tienen 4 hijos , 3 varones de 10 , 9 , y 8 años respectivamente y una nena de 7 años que están cursando sus estudios primarios.
El señor Diego se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y repuestos para motocicleta desde hace 10 años. 
 El negocio funciona en su domicilio que se encuentra en una zona estratégica en la ciuda. 
El mismo desea invertir en la compra lubricantes y repuestos para motos  en forma mayorista, de esa manera obtendría un menor precio de costo sobre los mismos  por lo que tendría mayor ganancia por la venta de sus mercaderias cantidad.
texts.en:
Diego Ramon I. C. is 33 years old and is married to Señora Roberta Benitez Cáceres, who is 29. They have 4 children: 3 sons who are 10, 9, and 8, respectively, and one daughter who is 7 years old. Their children are studying in primary school. Diego has sold lubricants and spare parts for motorcycles for 10 years. He operates his business from his home, which is located in a busy area of the city. He wants to invest in the purchase of lubricants and motorcycle spare parts at wholesale. This way, he would be able to get a better price for these items and can have better profits on the sale of his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spart parts for motorcycles, as well as engine oil and lubricants in bulk

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en: Ludy R. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari sari (general store) and a fish vending business. She lives in Sitio Canibol, Brgy. Okiot, Bais City, Negros Oriental. Ludy has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari sari store and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Ludy is borrowing 19,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari sari store. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP ( which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Ludy hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 41 years old and married with five children who are between 5 and 15 years old.  Jerome is commonly known for his business of sewing different styles of clothes and this is the 20th successful year of his business.  Jerome runs his business from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Jerome needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Jerome will purchase additional sewing machines including an over-sewing machine (serger) which hopefully will allow him to increase the profits in his business.  With these profits, Jerome will start creating some other sources of income so that he can keep building a secure future for his children.

loans.use: To buy additional sewing machines

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon A. is 45 years old and a husband and father of two children. His wife Linet is also a business person. They have a son who is in secondary school and they live in the Shinyalu area of Kakamega town.

Simon runs a carpentry business in an open-air market within the Shinyalu area. His clientele are mostly house and business owners from the neighboring estates who mostly come for household items. He was introduced to Kadet Limited by an existing client, whereby he took a first loan and paid successfully without default. He is now taking his second loan, which he plans to use to buy timber and carpentry tools.

He intends to use his profits to boost the business and his dream is to open a hardware store within Kakamega town.

loans.use: To buy timber and carpentry tools

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng K., 43, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She produces fishing nets to sell for an income of $2 (USD) per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $3 per day. K. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a mechanical plow for their rice field

loans.name: Hermilyn

texts.en:
Hermilyn B. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Hermilyn is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Hermilyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Hermilyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hermilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hermilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Hermilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers and shoes to sell

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “Chasquis” iniciará su  octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, es decir que tiene cerca de cuatro años formando parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por   ocho  integrantes que se reúnen cada 28 días, lo que les permite disponer de tiempo para trabajar con el dinero.

 Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: joyería, trenzado de mantas, pizzería, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de espejos.

La señora Benigna presidenta de la asociación,  indica que  su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio, desde hace más de diez años.  Recuerda que su primer crédito fue de Bs 800.- y sirvió para la compra de mercadería para la tienda, actualmente está solicitando Bs. 4000.- con la finalidad de comprar una cabina de teléfono y ubicarla en su tienda, aprovechando que esta abierta de 7 de la mañana a 11 de la noche.  Ella puede atender la tienda en este horario gracias al apoyo de sus hijos.  Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, responde el apoyo para el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
The community group "Chasquis" will begin their eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, which means they have formed part of the Focal Point of Collpani for almost four years.  The group has eight members, who meet every 28 days, which gives them time to work with the money.

They work at a variety of businesses: a jewelry store, braided rugs, a pizzeria, a neighborhood store, selling cosmetics, and selling mirrors.

Benigna is the president of the group.  She has a neighborhood store, where she has worked for more than ten years.  She remembers her first loan was for Bs. 800 and allowed her to purchase merchandise for the store.  Now, she is asking for a loan of Bs. 4000 to purchase a telephone booth and put it in her store.  It will be available from 7:00am until 11:00pm.  She is able to keep the store open these hours thanks to the support of her children.  

She says she likes Pro Mujer because of the support it provides for the growth of businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of a telephone booth

loans.name: Svay

texts.en: Svay S., 28, is married and lives with her husband and one young child in Phnom Penh. She and her husband grow and sell morning glory (water spinach). They usually earn a combined income of $16 US each day. This couple has been in this business since 2000. Svay S. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to purchase fertilizer and seed and to rent more land to grow morning glory. She hopes it will bring her family more income. Svay S.'s husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed and rent more land to grow morning glory

loans.name: Mr. Yuos Song Village Bank Group

texts.en: The twenty-one people who make up this bank loan group live in Boeng Krum Kraom village in Kandal province. All of the members will use their portion of the loan to improve their businesses. Mr. Yuos S., 60, is the group's president.  He is a fisherman while his wife, Mrs. Yan Sorm, owns a general store where she sells groceries to earn money to support her family. They have two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Mr. Yuos S. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets as his old ones are worn out.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 28 year-old married man. He is blessed with two children, aged seven and four. He joined the Lion Head group in Faulu Kenya in order to access financial resources easily. So far, he has expanded his quarrying business through the support of Faulu Kenya, and is able to provide for his family in a better way. He hopes to provide his children with quality education in the future. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy a motorbike, because he wants to start a motorbike transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situado en la región Piura, esta región se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo. Trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes son sus vecinos y conocidos, siempre está a la búsqueda de nuevos clientes ya que mientras más pedidos coloque, más ganancias obtiene por parte de la compañía que le abastece de productos. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sustento diario.

Raquel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda contar con un inventario estable que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes cuando ellos lo necesiten sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Raquel is 26 years old, single and lives with her family in the rural part of the farming district of Tambogrande, located in the region of Piura. This region is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She sells cosmetics from a catalog and works by request. Her customers are her neighbors and acquaintances but she is always in search of new clients since the more orders she has, the more she earns from the company that provides her with the products. She uses the money she earns from this business to cover her personal expenses and to help her family with the daily sustenance.

Raquel wants to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that she can have a stable inventory to meet the demand of her customers instead of having to wait until the end of the month when the order arrives. This is why she thought it would be good to request a loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a calm and responsible woman. Her biggest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman to be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to expand her sales business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Mrs. Delia S. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with 3 children of whom two are still at school and the other one is now at work. To make a living, she is presently engaged in dried fish vending business. She’s been engaged in this kind of retailing business for 2 years already. This time she is earning an amount of not less than Php 2,500 from the sales of this business. 

In the year 2008, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Delia has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 7,000. She is now requesting a loan of Php 7,000 as her 3rd loan which will be used as additional capital for her existing dried fish vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments, children’s education expenses, and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing dried fish vending business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, pepper, sardines, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Deang

texts.en: Deang C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 9 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 10 on the children’s education, and USD 57 on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cows to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children. She works as a female hairdresser at her domicile and she also serves her clients in their houses. She cooperates with her husband who works as a dairy products distributor to provide better living conditions for the family. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she was a very good client.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools and products to offer her clients better beauty services.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and products

loans.name: Eou

texts.en:
Eou H., 47, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. H. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.7 per day. Her husband is a construction farmer, earning an income of USD 6.4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 43 years old and lives in the district of Sèmè-Podji in Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She shares her home with her husband Dèhoumon, a teacher, and together they look after four children, two of whom are their own.

Chantal has been selling sewing equipment for 12 years, and has been developing her own tailoring business. With this loan from ALIDE she hopes to buy her own sewing machine and supplies to drive her business.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine and various materials

loans.name: Datuni

texts.en:
Datuni I. is 57 years old. He lives in the village of Tsereteli, Marneuli District with his family – wife and son. Datuni works in local poultry factory. Datuni’s wife works as a cook and his 22-year-old son is a wrestler. Besides their main jobs, all family members are involved in family agricultural activities: They have two milch cows and dairy products are sold to local retailers. Also the family owns a plot of land where Lucerne (alfalfa) is grown, which is used for feeding their own cows. Total average monthly income of the family is up to GEL 850. 

With the requested amount Datuni plans to renovate/launch a traditional Georgian bread bakery, which is located in the building of his house. The bakery isn’t functional at the moment. After the bakery is renovated and launched, Datuni will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it in the nearby villages. It will increase the income of the family. 

Datuni hopes that he will reinvest part of the bakery’s profit in the same business, to expand it. With the other part of the profit he wants to buy a car for family use.

loans.use: to renovate a bread bakery.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena T. is a 34 years old and married. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. She is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice. Lorena sells her harvest to the market. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells items like biscuits and chips. Lorena is requesting a loan, which will be used for her farm to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Lorena hopes for her businesses to prosper in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gumersida

texts.en:
Gumersida A. is from the city of Kinuman Norte Ozamiz City. She is 52 years old. Gumersida is married with ten school-aged children. She plants and harvests gabi for sale. Gumersida has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gumersida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Gumersida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units of offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Juana Irma

texts.es:
Juana tiene  59 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en una zona urbana marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza a sus vecinos y personas que visitan la zona, los fines de semana la venta de cerveza aumenta. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerveza, y realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda con la finalidad de construir un ambiente donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old, is married and lives with her family in an underdeveloped urban area of the city of Chiclayo. This is a very commercial area located in northern Peru.

She sells beer to her neighbors and to people who visit the area; beer sales increase on the weekends. The business is very helpful to her family since through it Juana takes on the responsibility of helping to support the family daily.

Juana wants to expand her business by purchasing more beer and making some improvements to her home. Her goal is to build an area where she can sell her products. For this reason she thought it was a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles which she will use to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita L. is from the village of Alang-alang Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 62 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells food and drinks to passengers at the local bus terminal. Nonita has had her business for over four years and earns about 2,400 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2011, Nonita joined Kiva field partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonita is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which she plans to use to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell at her stall.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  Two of her children are currently at university, one has completed college, one is in high school, and the youngest one is in primary school.  

Alice currently earns 16,000 KES a month from the milling business she has been running for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more  maize for her milling business. This is her 2nd loan with KADET. She plans to use the proceeds to pay for her children’s education. Alice hopes to start a large business in the maize flour milling and packing industry.

loans.use: buy more maize for her milling business

loans.name: Tapuitea

texts.en:
Tapuitea is 34 years of age and married with one child. Tapuitea owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Tapuitea needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 193 talas or US $80 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tapuitea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tapuitea's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Skeeter

texts.en:
Skeeter is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a food vending business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to build a business structure by purchasing timber and iron sheets and by paying for labor. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to build a business structure by purchasing timber and iron sheets and by paying for labor.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en: Lizel is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.  Lizel has a retail shop that sells noodles, canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy beverages and snacks to sell. Lizel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages and snacks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has five children between the ages of 13 months and 10 years. All are in school but the youngest. For the past four years, Mary and her husband have been running a business selling secondhand shoes. This business has helped them meet the needs of their family. Mary needs this loan to buy more shoes to make more profit. With the profit, she will pay for her children’s school fees. This loan will help Mary expand her business in the future and continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand shoes.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María Gloria tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

María se dedica al comercio de legumbres, Compra sus productos y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, incrementar su negocio y mejoramiento de sus actividades agrícolas. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su sueño es adquirir un terreno. 

Le gusta escuchar música y ver televisión.
texts.en:
María Gloria is 25 years old, single, and lives with her mother in the canton of Guaranda, in the Bolívar Province.

The members of V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY are located in the Tolapungo community, in the sector Veintimilla, which is part of Guaranda.  The members of this group work in agriculture, raising animals, the cattle industry, the produce industry and others.

María works in the vegetable business.  She buys her produce and resells it at the wholesale market in Guaranda.
 
She requests this loan to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities.  The loan will enable her to supply her financial needs and improve her quality of life. Her dream is to purchase land.

She enjoys listening to music and watching television.

loans.use: to increase her business and improve her agricultural activities

loans.name: Beatriz Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Beatriz es socia del banco comunal Family, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, es la tercera ciudad de más importante  del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad gracias a su belleza arquitectónica, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y cordial como nuestra socia.

Doña Beatriz tiene 37 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19. 17 y 15 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente y su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como latonero (Arreglo de latas de los vehículos) en su propio taller, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Beatriz labora como empleada domestica hace 8 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados con horarios rotativos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como: masilla, pinturas, lijas, etc. para el taller de su esposo.
 
Su meta es tener su vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the communal bank "Family." She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is a city with a cold climate. It is the third largest city in the country. In December of 1999 it was named as a UNESCO World Heritage site of outstanding cultural importance to the heritage of humanity, thanks to its architectural beauty. The city also has a great variety in its cuisine, and cordial and friendly people like Beatriz. 

Beatriz is 37 years old and is married.  Her marriage has produced 3 daughters aged 19, 17 and 15.  Her two oldest daughters work and help her financially, and her youngest daughter studies in a school in the city.  Her husband does auto body repairs in his own workshop.  The family does not own their own home, so they live in a rented dwelling.

Beatriz has been working as a domestic for 8 years.  She works Mondays through Saturdays with a rotating schedule.

Beatriz has been in her communal bank for a year, and she will invest this new loan in purchasing materials such as putty, paints, sandpaper, etc. for her husband's workshop.  

Her goal is to have her own vehicle.

loans.use: to buy putty, paints, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Fondation Plus Group

texts.en:
"Fondation Plus" is a community bank made up of nine members whose chairwoman is Marceline. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Marceline makes and sells doughnuts. She began her business in 2003. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. 

Marceline is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of the inputs with her next loan by buying wheat flour, yeast and vegetable oil for making doughnuts and reselling them at profit. Marceline is 44 years old, married and the mother of three children, whose ages vary between 17 and 23 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, yeast and vegetable oil for making doughnuts to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor, tiene la edad 29 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa e hija que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el credito comprar los insumos para la asistencia del almacigo y darle una buena asistencia para asi obtener mejores resultados. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotacion de buena forma de este cultivo y ademas con la experiencia necesaria para darle un buen manejo a este. El quiere generar un almacigo de buena calidad para así satisfacer a sus compradores. El quiere darle a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida y generar los ingresos para así cumplir varios proyectos de vida establecidos por ambos.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Victor, 29 years old, is married and lives with his wife and daughter. They are his biggest priority. With this loan, he intends to buy supplies to take care of the seedbeds for his coffee plants. He has a plot of land that's perfect for this kind of growing, and he has the experience necessary for it to be a success. He wants to grow high-quality coffee to satisfy his buyers. He wants to give his family a better quality of life and bring in profits to help them fulfill some of their goals. This is the first loan he's received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't received any prior loans from state banks, and FUDECOSUR is offering him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials for planting a coffee crop.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, realizó estudios de educación superior.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes.  Nos cuenta que también tiene un salón de belleza.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su salón de belleza, comprará líquidos, cuadros y otros accesorios para innovar el local, trabaja sola en el negocio su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad de Puno (Bolivia).
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio y abrir otro local para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión, la comunicación y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the “Medallitas de Oro II” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  She completed her higher education.

Eliana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her grocery store.  She tells us that she also has a beauty salon.

Eliana is now requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which she will invest in her beauty salon, buying liquids, pictures and other accessories with which to improve her premises.  She works alone in her business.  Her husband works outside of the city of Puno (in Bolivia).  

Eliana's dream is to expand her business and open other premises so that she can improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank is the unity, the communication and the responsibility amongst the members.

loans.use: to buy liquids, pictures and other accessories

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her water bills and electricity bills. 

She has operated a tailoring shop for the past one year. In addition, she offers a dressmaking school. Her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where demand is high during the end of the month. She dreams of owning a big boutique in town in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase fabrics for her tailoring shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 36 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Jerry is married to a loving housewife named Marites. This couple did not have the opportunity to enter college level of education because their parents had no capacity to send them to school. Thus, Jerry and his wife are working hard together to provide the best opportunity for their children.

Jerry runs a hog raising business. He started this business 10 years ago. He started with just two piglets and raised them. Now, Jerry has eight pigs to grow. He loves this business because, as he says, this serves as source of income of the family aside from farming.

Most of Jerry's profits in the hog raising business has been invested in agricultural land that they are now planting with rice. Jerry still wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of PHP40,000 to buy two additional piglets and feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to gain higher income again for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy two additional piglets and feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32 year old married woman who has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fried fish in Kator, South Sudan.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 35  años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria (incompleta).
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de chifleria (venta al menudeo de artículos diversos), también la señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía como bordados en bayeta (telares).
Con este nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería como candados, chapas, colino, jabón, betún, shamphoo, cuchillos, etc., en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en transporte (taxista).
La señora desea agrandar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del  préstamo y la ganancia de los ahorros.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank, located in the Juli district in the Chucuito province in the Puno department. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She studied secondary education but did not graduate.

She has been working with the Manuel Ramos Movement for the past year. She invested her first loan from them in her chifleria (sale of miscellaneous items) business. She also sells crafts such as embroidered cloths and weaved items.

With this new loan she will buy merchandise such as locks, B-vitamins, soap, shoe polish, shampoo, knives, etc. Her children help her with her business and her husband works as a taxi driver. Rosalia hopes to grow her business and improve her earnings. What she likes about the community bank is the ease in which she can obtain a loan and increase her savings

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as locks, soap, shoe polish, shampoo, and knives.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es una persona de carácter muy jovial, ella está casada hace ya 18 años, vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, tiene dos hijos, el mayor tiene 17 años, y una nena de 11 años. Su esposo es propietario de un taller metalúrgico, quien ayuda a pagar los gastos de la casa.
Carmen comenta que siempre se dedicó a pequeñas ventas  que lo hacia a través de catálogos entre sus amigas, vecinas, y parientes, después poco a poco llegaba a las distintas oficinas de algunas empresas, y vendía por sobre todo lencerías para damas, más adelante y haciendo un esfuerzo decidió habilitar un local de ventas para lo cual alquiló un salón dentro de un gimnasio, y allí realiza sus ventas como: conjuntos de ciclistas, remeras, top, calzas, lencerías finas para damas y demás. Dice tener una muy buena clientela formada y que no se queja de la venta pues gracias a sus precios y por sobre todo la calidad de sus productos vende muy bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas deportivas para la posterior venta, ya que siempre tiene muchos pedidos con los cuales le gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very jovial person and lives in the city of Villa Elis. She has been married for 18 years and has two children - the oldest is 17, and the youngest is a girl of 11 years. Her husband owns a metal workshop, and he helps to pay the household expenses.

Carmen explains that she always used to work with small sales, using catalogs to sell products initially among her friends, neighbors, and relatives. Gradually, she started selling to various offices of several companies where she sold mainly women's lingerie. Much later and with great effort, she decided to find a sales premises and rented a room inside a gym. Here, she has been able to sell garments such as cycling shorts, t-shirts, tops, stockings, fine lingerie, and more. 

Carmen says that she has good clientele who never complain about her products, as the good prices and overall quality of her products have meant that they sell very well. She has requested this loan to purchase more apparel for subsequent sale in her store, as she always has a lot of orders that she would like to be able to fulfil.

loans.use: to buy sports garments for subsequent sale in her store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 34, is married and has four children. She lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Maricel owns a sari2x store to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock to sell.

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Maricel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell/buy groceries to sell/retail

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. Two of them are in school. For two years, she has had a business selling food from her stall in Bor, South Sudan. 

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like shoes, women's dresses, and many other items.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with five children between 14 and 22 years old. Lorna lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Her husband works as a farmer.

Lorna is a farmer too. She and her husband work together to till their land. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. Each month, they earn 8,000 PHP doing this farming. Lorna plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Lorna hopes to continue earning from their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Angela quien tiene una  pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 6 años. Inicia su pulpería anteriormente vendía frijoles cocidos, hielo, bolis y gaseosa, durante un tiempo con sus pocas ganancias fue ahorrando, y fue comprando productos menores de pulpería hasta que logro funcionar su nuevo negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, productos del mor, medicamentos populares, carne de pollo, carne de res etc. María Teresa tiene 28 años y vende platanitos y enchiladas y Carlos tiene 42 años de edad se dedica a comercializar venta de calzados.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Angela, who has had a grocery store in her home for 6 years.  When she started her grocery store, she had previously sold cooked beans, pens, and soda water for a time.  With her earnings saving up, she bought minor products for her store until her new store was able to function.  

The loan will be invested in buying basic grains like rice and beans as well as sugar, oil, dairy products, popular medications, chicken and beef.  

María Teresa is 28 years old and sells bananas and enchiladas and Carlos is 42 years old and works in selling footwear.

loans.use: buy basic products like rice, beans, sugar, beef, chicken, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
John Rey is 18 years old and is youngest of three children in the family. His mother Josephine supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.


John Rey is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and he is currently in the 1st of this 3-year course.

Josephine is borrowing Php 21,000 to pay for tuition fees of the Second Semester of his son for the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, John Rey plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
My name is Santiago C. and my have been selling popular consumer products in my store for the last five years. This activity allows me to support my family. My customers prefer me because I give them special attention and my prices are very affordable for our economy. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and offer a wider variety of quality products, using the profits to renovate my store and first of all provide a good education for my granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Santiago C. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, actividad que me genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de mi familia, mis clientes me prefieren porque yo les doy una antencion especial y los precios son muy accesibles a nuestra economia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta y una mejor variedad de productos de calidad y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y lo primordial darle un buen estudio a mi nieta.

loans.use: Buy churros, cookies, sodas, bread, beans, rice, oil, salt, condiments, vegetables, butter, cheese, sausage, chicken, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, toothpaste, eggs, soup, soap, pencils, notebooks, jam, juice and milk.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en: My name is Maria Luisa, and I sell secondhand clothing. Because of my age, I have had to find a way to support myself. For two years, I have been buying and selling quality secondhand clothing. With my earnings I have been able to pay my and my household’s expenses. My goal is to be able to finish paying for my house with sales from this business.

loans.use: Purchase of quality used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food cafe business

loans.name: Ochahon

texts.en: Ochahon J. is married and has three minor children. She specializes in selling rice. Rice is the most important Tajiks food product, because it is used to prepare Tajiks plov (pilaf). To buy goods, Ochahon goes to a wholesale market that is held once a week in neighboring Kyrgyzstan. Ochahon then sells rice all the week in the central market. Her husband doesn't work and brings no income to the family, so all family expenses are on her shoulders. A year and a half ago she got her first loan from Microinvest. This helped her to expand her business and she continued to get new loans. She plans to use the money from this new loan for the purchase of rice.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Felicia De Paula

texts.en: Felicia is a 30 year old lady. She’s been married for years and has 4 children. Presently, her husband takes care of the whole family through a small business he owns where he sells a kind of Dominican meal cooked with bananas leaves not far from a public school. To be more helpful in the maintenance of the family she’d like to build her own business so she can provide her kids with what they need. Her plan is to have a grocery store where she’ll sell drinks, rice, sugar…well, a little bit of everything. She already has a fridge that she can use for the drinks and knows some specific places where she can buy the articles she needs for the store. She expects to borrow US$325.00, money that she will repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To start a colmado (grocery store)

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es:
Mr Bismarck Antonio M. was born and lives in the town of Bluefields, he is 41 years old, his life partner is Mrs. Arien Siu, and they have 3 children living with them. Mr. M. has more than 20 years experience as a barber, he has an assistant who also makes haircuts, shaves beards and trims moustaches. His customers are children, men and women of all ages. At the barber shop customers can watch tv programs as well as buy soft drinks or water and therefore it is very popular.

Mr. M. needs to invest in 4 haircutting machines, $48.00 each, (2 machines for cutting and 2 for trimming), 4 boxes of razor blades, $10.00 each, 5 bottles of cologne, $3.00 each, 3 bottles of shaving foam, $2.00 each, 3 boxes of soft drinks, $5.00 each box, 2 boxes of water, $6.00 each box, and 2 gallons of paint, $10.00 per gallon. The paint will be used to improve the image of the barber shop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Bismarck Antonio M. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 41 años de edad, su pareja de vida es la Sra. Arlen Siu, ambos tiene 3 hijos que viven con la pareja. El Sr. M. tiene mas de 20 años de experiencia , tiene un empleado que tambien corta pelo, afeite de barba y recorte de bigote sus clientes son niños, hombres y mujeres de todas las edades, esta barberia los entretiene con programas de television , tambien pueden comprar gaseosas o agua por esta razon son preferidos.

El Sr. M. necesita invertir en 4 maquinas de cortar pelo a $ 48.00 dolares cada maquina (2 maquinas para cortar pelo y las otras 2 para el acabado), 4 cajas de guillet a $10.00 dolares cada caja, 5 colonias de barberia a $3.00 cada colonia, 3 botellas de espuma para afeitar a $2.00 dolares, 3 cajas de gaseosas a $ 5.00 dolares cada caja, 2 cajas de agua a $6.00 dolares cada caja, 2 galones de pintura a $ 10.00 dolares cada galon. La pintura la necesita para mejorar la imagen de la barberia.

loans.use: Purchase haircutting machines, razor blades, cologne, shaving foam, soft drinks, water and paint to improve image and offer better service.

loans.name: Terane

texts.en:
Terane A. is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan Republic. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is the only breadwinner of her family.
