She began her business with $200 in 2002. She is busy with mobile industry goods, retail trade. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.
Terane needs $400 for expanding her business. She wants to increase the assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of the industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 50 year-old Juliana A.. She is widowed with six children, aged between 13 and 30, and has one other dependent, who is her cousin's child. In 1998 Juliana established a farming business. Juliana has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Juliana would like to purchase farming equipment as well as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Odah

texts.en: Odah, 63, sells salty fish every day from her house, earning $7 a day, while her husband, A., sells the fish at the market, and earns $10 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to add to her fish business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa has 2 kids and her husband works as a printer. What he earns is not enough to pay the household bills, and this is why, for 23 years, Maria Luisa has been selling clothes and accesories to factory workers who, little by little, have come to know about her. Now she has many clients who are always asking her for clothes.

However, she does not have enough merchandise to offer to her clients. This is why she is asking for a loan of $375 that she will repay over a period of 6 months, and with this money Maria Luisa will be able to buy this season's clothes to offer a variety to her clients, so that she will not lose them to competition. With your help, Maria Luisa will be able to help her kids move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María Luisa tiene dos hijos y su esposo trabaja como impresor. Y con lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de su familia. Fue por eso que María Luisa comenzó hace 23 años a vender ropa y accesorios a los empleados de fábricas y poco a poco se fue dando a conocer. Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que constantemente le piden ropa.

Sin embargo no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María Luisa podrá comprar mercancía de temporada para así poder ofrecerle variedad a sus clientes y éstos no se vayan con la competencia. Con tu ayuda María Luisa logrará sacar a sus dos hijos adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm N. is 28 years old. She works in a hotel in Siem Reap earning US $4 per day. Run Sophal, her husband (pictured here as she was unavailable), works as a motor taxi driver earning US $4 per day. They have two young children who are not yet old enough for school. She wants to build a well by their home so that she can run a small business pumping and selling water in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To dig a new well

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Mrs Sreytouch V. (pictured), 23, and her husband, Mr Kunthy Heak, were married in 2007. The couple lives with their parents and brothers and sisters. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Sreytouch has been a weaver for seven years. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motorbike repairer. He does his business at the shop in the village.

Mrs Sreytouch is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband's motorbike repair business.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for repair business.

loans.name: Zijada

texts.en: Zijada is requesting 1000 KM to expand her farming business in the small village of Jaruške.  Like many women in this rural village of Bosnia, she supports her family by raising poultry, and selling eggs, milk and milk products.  She is requesting this loan to help repair her tractor, which she will use to plow the nearby field and plant vegetables.  Zijada hopes that this additional business will help grow her family's monthly salary.  She also hopes to grow organic vegetables, so that the produce will be healthier.

loans.use: Repair her tractor.

loans.name: Faleifue

texts.en:
Faleifue L., 40, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also at the local primary school 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Faleifue’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her kids at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is always engaged in operating the business.

loans.use: replace stove, cooking equipment; also pay for overhead cost of business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela lives with her husband and three children, Brandom, Yohan and Jorge Luis. Time has taught her that working is not easy. She buys and sells merchandise that varies with the season, during national day season she sells flags, pins; during Christmas season decoration, lights and others. Now she is selling hardware, locks, knifes, nail clippers, merchandise that she brings from the City of Desaguadero to sell in the City of Cuzco, where she goes twice a week.

Graciela is used to working, she likes it a lot, there are always difficult things to deal with such as keeping the merchandise in good condition, because sometimes because of the trip she loses some of it. Graciela works hard to support herself, pay the bills, but above all, to give her family a good future. With the loan requested Graciela will buy more merchandise to bring to Cuzco, she wants to work hard to buy a small house where she can also have her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Graciela vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos Brandom, Yohan y Jorge Luis. Los años le han enseñado que el trabajo no es fácil, ella tiene un negocio ambulante de compra y venta de mercadería que varia de acuerdo a la época, en fiestas patrias vende banderitas, escarapelas; en navidad, adornos navideños, lucecitas, entre otros. Actualmente está dedicada a la venta de artículos de ferretería, candados, cuchillos, corta uñas, mercadería que trae desde la ciudad de Desaguadero para vender en la ciudad del Cuzco, a la cual viaja dos veces a la semana.

Graciela esta acostumbrada al trabajo, el cual le gusta mucho, habiendo siempre cosas difíciles, como el de mantener su mercadería en buen estado, ya que con el viaje a veces se llega a perder parte de ella. Graciela trabaja duro para poder sostenerse, pagar las cuentas de la casa, pero sobre todo para brindarle a su familia un mejor porvenir. Con el préstamo solicitado Graciela comprara más mercadería para llevar a la ciudad del Cuzco, ella quiere trabajar duro para comprarse una casita donde pueda poner un pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise for her business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is a 41 year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven kids. Through hard work, Abena has supported three children in finishing high school. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grain, which is cooked and then mixed with hot pepper and fried fish. She has lots of customers, because many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her first child entering university. She belongs to the community group called 'Nyame ye odo' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another and provide assistance to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura N., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is a schoolteacher by professional background. In addition, she is married and has 3 children. She first applied for a loan from MicroInvest earlier this year, when she heard about MicroInvest and the process by which loans are disbursed. Fortunately, the prior loan enabled her to improve her and her family's living conditions because it is difficult to support the family merely with the salary she receives from being a schoolteacher.

Accordingly, Masshura is also engaged in a material-selling business and the livestock industry. To illustrate, she proudly states that she has 2 milk cows and a pedigree bull, along with several sheep and rams. Moreover, she notes that she has been involved in the livestock industry for 8 years and, as a result, she has acquired invaluable business skills. With respect to her material-selling business, Mashhura has a wide assortment of goods for sale, all of which she has purchased directly from suppliers, and she explains that she has many loyal customers.

Currently, she is applying for a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2,100 STJ ($625) over 4 months to further diversify her product line by importing new materials. She thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her businesses by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Mrs. Men Sorphorn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Men S., the 31-year-old mother of a three-year-old, is a group leader of five, all living in the Reussei Srok Village in Kandal Province and all planning to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Men S. owns a small shop that sells coffee to villagers in the local village, and since the business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to expand by purchasing more coffee and ingredients for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Soam Thon, is a soya bean seller making a small income that helps support the family.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more coffee and ingredients to make for her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.en:
Horimena C. is a young, single mother of two children. At this point in her life she lives in extreme poverty. She is doing everything she can to survive and to feed her children. It seems as though sending her children to college and having her own house aren't even possible. Her only goal is to make enough to feed her children and herself.

Horimena came to Esperanza International to try and receive a loan so she could start her own business. After many meetings and workshops, Horimena is ready to take out her first loan and start earning a steady income. She plans on starting her own business selling used clothing in her area. Though it is hard to even talk about her dreams for her children, she did say that she is excited to have her own business.

Her first goal is to grow her business so she can earn income to pay for her children's education. She said one day she does want to own a house, but she knows a lot of hard work lays ahead of her. She is ready to take the first step to a better life, and is hoping that this is the start of a better future for her whole family!

loans.use: Buying used clothing to mend and sell

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom S. is the leader of a group of four members who all live in Kngoak Pong village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is 38 years old and the mother of seven children: one is employed in a garment factory and the others attend the local school.

Mrs. Khom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Loeng Tol, sells firewood in the local village. Unfortunately, he is now sick and cannot work to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Khom S. decided to ask for a loan to treat her husband's illness.

This is a group loan. Two members have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To treat her husband's illness

loans.name: Imade

texts.en:
Imade I. is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Imade sells drinks and provisions such as loaves of bread, tinned tomatoes, noodles, etc. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

Imade's husband is a welder, and they both make sure their children are in private school despite the cost, as public schools often go on strikes. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, & foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
Bosco is 35 years old, married, and has two children between aged 3 weeks and 3 years. He also takes care of his younger brother who is a student. Bosco started his business in 1998 selling salted fish, sugar, milk, and charcoal in the Bandundu province in the DR Congo. His beginning capital was $20. From 1998 to 2002, with the profit generated and good management, Bosco increased his working capital to $150 and extended his business by adding smoked fish. The income generated from his business helped him to finish the first three years of higher education in the Bandundu.

In 2004, Bosco left the village for Kinshasa to finish the last two years of his higher education. He then began selling rings in Kinshasa in 2004 to support his studies. After his wife joined him in Kinshasa in 2005, they restarted selling salted fish, sugar, milk and charcoal which was generating $150 of profit per month. The monthly income generated from his business helped Bosco support his family in Kinshasa until October 2007 when he joined one of Hope’s groups called “Vision”. Bosco has been a faithful Hope client since then and his business has prospered. Bosco’s ambition is to open a pharmacy.

loans.use: To reinforce his working capital

loans.name: Enriqueta Juana

texts.es:
Enriqueta  es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Enriqueta es casada, tiene 44 años y 1 hijo, Enriqueta tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, bebidas variadas, tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Enriqueta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y cerveza.
El sueño de Enriqueta es surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a member of the Las Gaviotas ("The Seagulls") Community Bank. Enriqueta is married, is 44 years old and has one child. Enriqueta has a store in a rented space where she sells general groceries, produce, various drinks, phone cards -- an activity that she performs every day. Enriqueta needs a loan of 1,000 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of phone cards and beer. Enriqueta's dream is to stock her business with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of phone cards and beer.

loans.name: Dada

texts.en: H. has a shop where she sells textbooks. She has been in this business for the past three years. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. H. is 35 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил Нурбеков 1980 года рождения, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он разводит коз белых и черных.  Его основной источник дохода , это продажа скота. В год 2 раза он стрижет коз и продает шерсть. Переработка шерсти дополнительный источник дохода, в основном белая пряжа идет реализацию. А также, продает молоко и молочные изделия. В Микроинвест обратился по совету отца. Получив кредит купил скот. Благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Isroil N. was born in 1980. He is married and has four children. He breeds white and black goats, and his main source of income is the sale of livestock. Twice a year he shears the goats and sells the wool. Processing of the wool is an additional source of income, and the white yarn is sold. In addition, he sells milk and milk products. Isroil turned to MicroInvest for a loan on the advice of his father. With the loan he received, he purchased livestock. He is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ahmadali

texts.ru: Ахмадали - мужчина лет 54 лет, женат и отец 7-х детей. У Ахмадали есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 50 овец и 30 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Ахмадали каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Ахмадали пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Ахмадали за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Ахмадали очень рад сотрудничеству с нами.
texts.en:
Ahmadali is 54 year old and is married with seven children. He has about 50 sheep and 30 goats. His wife is a homemaker but in her free time, she processes wool and knits warm clothing, which she sells to neighbors and relatives. Every morning Ahmadali take the cattle to the mountains, where they graze the whole day. Ahmadali has no cows but he is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase two medium-sized bulls. After raising them for 3-4 months, he would be able to sell them at a good price. Ahmadali is happy to cooperate with us.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores II ubicado en Jaillihuaya del  distrito de Chuchito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 29 años de edad, con 2 hijos, de estado civil conviviente, posee estudios de educación superior (educación Técnica en enfermería)  Vive en la Urbanización Ciudad Jardin, Maz W-5 Lte. 25

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, ella inicio su negocio de venta de cereales de la región, con un préstamo de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.
En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de cereales de la región, los mismos que venderá solo en las ferias de ILave los días  domingos. Asi mismo ella invertirá en la crianza de aves de corral, para comercializarlos en las diferentes ferias de Puno.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando y poner una tienda, o en su defecto un tópico, de acuerdo a su carrera profesional.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros deportivos que organiza Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Magdalena belongs to the Banco Comunal “Las Flores II" in Jaillihuaya, located in the Chuchito district in the Puno Province in the Puno Region. She is 29 years old, has two children and lives with her partner. She completed her advanced studies in nursing at a technical school.

Magdalena has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for four years. She started her business selling regional cereals with a loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. At present, she is requesting a loan of S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of additional regional cereals, which she sells at the markets every Sunday. She will also use the money to raise poultry to sell at the Puno markets.

Her biggest dream is to continue working and start a store, or even an infirmary, so that she can use her professional training. Magdalena enjoys both the savings trainings and the sports matches that Manuela Ramos organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley, wheat, quinoa and poultry

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
For more than 8 years, Mavzuna, together with her mother (pictured), has been working in the largest local market of the city. She sells rice and cottonseed oil. Her business is situated in the central market where there are always a lot of people, so that the business is very stable and generates stable income for her family.

Mavzuna has been working with IMON for a year and has proved herself an accurate client. Today she requests 3500 Somoni for purchasing rice and cottonseed oil to sell. Mavzuna thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing rice and cottonseed oil for re-sale

loans.name: Djidéré

texts.fr: Djidéré D., 54 est mère de 07 enfants avec 04 petits fils en charge. Elle s’active dans la restauration et la vente de légumes. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de renforcer ses activités pour améliorer ses revenus et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses  2 filles.
texts.en:
Djidéré D., age 54, is the mother of seven and has four grandsons to support. She is active in the restaurant business and in selling vegetables. The loan she is requesting will enable her to bolster her businesses, so as to improve her revenues and to cover schooling costs for two daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions for a restaurant busines and to sell vegetables

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
This young man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli region, settled in the Fuzuli region at the Ahmadbayli village.

Ramin was born in 1986 and is single. Two years ago he started a welding business. Now he needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his welding business

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 33 years old. He is married, and the father of two children. Currently, the kids are in school. His family is doing very well, and he is so happy for that. He works in the service industry, sewing dresses and other clothing. He has been sewing for eight years now. He is a specialist in both men's and women's wear. His skills and designs are of a special class. He sews various kinds of styles that give his customers new looks, including kids' school uniforms, trousers, shirts, church attire, kaba and slit dresses, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. He wants to use the loan to buy more sewing supplies, like linen, thread, thimbles, etc., to increase his output and efficiency. Due to his dedication and hard work, he has one apprentice whom he is training for the future. He hopes to increase his savings to provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more sewing supplies, like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 33 years old, married, and has four children who are all studying. Her husband is a farmer and is also working as a tricycle driver in their village.

Margarita has worked for ten years in the sari-sari (community based) store business in San Ignacio. The income she earns from her store is carefully budgeted to meet the daily needs of her children and family. She would like to maintain her store's profitability and is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 7,0000.00. This amount will be of great help in providing for the needs of her family. Through patience and hard work, Margarita believes that her store will grow to meet her expectations.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Saem Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy S. is the group leader of a six-member group who all live in Chrouy Slaeng village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Thy S. is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a fruit seller, another three are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Em Somaly, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Thy S. is a fruit middle woman (wholesaler). Aside from this business, she also raises pigs. Since both of her businesses are doing well, she wants to expand them by purchasing more fruits to sell and piglets to raise. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. 


All the members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. Sixty years old and married with six children, she has been in the business for many years. Alice, who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, is requesting the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She thanks you for the loan support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng S. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them for their offspring and for slaughter.  Chheng also helps her husband cultivate rice. The couple was married years ago and has no children.  Chheng lacks money to buy food for her pigs so is asking for a Kiva loan to purchase food to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: Purchase food to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Roxana Yenny

texts.es:
La socia Roxana; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; UBICADOS EN EL DISTRITO DE Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, ella es conviviente, su pareja es agricultor, y tiene 2 hijos,  ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la confección de muñecas de trapo y títeres en el distrito de Andahuaylillas. La socia trabaja para terceros, por lo que el dinero que solicita es para comprar cosas personales para sus menores hijos.

Nuestra socia agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This is Roxana. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and 5 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Roxana is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. Her partner works as a farmer. Roxana divides her time between her household chores and making rag dolls and puppets in the district of Andahuaylillas. She works for a third-party broker, so the money she is requesting will be used to buy personal items for her children.

Roxana appreciates the loan that has been provided to her. She agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use (purchase items for her children)

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La Sra. Gregoria ,es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002, tiene un buen historial, ella se dedica al tejido de mantas de vicuña y alpaca, se provee de materia prima en las Ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, ella tiene 4 hijos pequeños que estudian, el esposo trabaja de albañil en construcciones por la zona sur, ellos viven en domicilio propio. Ella trabaja  en su decima secuencia, es cliente es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias por la zona.
texts.en:
Gregoria has been a client of Emprender since 2002 and has good credit history. She weaves blankets from vicuña and alpaca wool, buying the raw materials from the markets in El Alto city. She has 4 small children who are in school; her husband works as a construction worker in la zona sur (the southern zone of the city). They own their home. Gregoria is on her tenth loan cycle; she is a very responsible client and has good references throughout the area.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vicuña and alpaca wool

loans.name: Rysala

texts.en:
Rysala is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Rysala has been working in sewing since 2002. Rysala is special in her work because she is known for her good and talented work. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Rysala decided on doing her business because of her experience; when she was younger, she used to sew in a shop. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by opening a shop and showing her clothing designs.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es:
La señora MARITZA ELENA B. B., tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. MARITZA se dedica a la confección de zapatos y sandalias para damas y caballeros.  Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró pegamento, cuero, plantillas, hilos, hebillas, etc. para la confección del calzado.
Con su próximo crédito de 100.00 nuevos soles comprará plantillas  al por mayor.
Ella sueña con confeccionar y vender mas calzado para así generar mayores ganancias y  seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. MARITZA ELENA B. B. is 46 years old and lives in the district of Porvenir in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Creative Little Seeds). The business woman completed school through the 5th year of secondary and has 2 children who are economically dependent on her. Maritza makes shoes and sandals for men and women. With her first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought glue, leather, insoles, thread, buckles etc. for the construction of footwear. With her next loan of 100.00 Nuevos Soles she will buy insoles for the most part. She hopes to make and sell more footwear and in this way generate more income and continue to help her children in their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insoles for shoemaking

loans.name: Santos Guillermo

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 50 años que vive junto a su esposa y con uno de sus hijos en el sector Real Saucipe del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de un año trabaja como vigilante en un hotel turístico de Puerto Malabrigo, con el fruto de sus ahorros ha adquirido una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual trabaja en sus momentos libres. Su esposa de dedica a la venta de bebidas en el restaurante de su hermana, con estos ingresos ellos solventan la economía de su hogar.

Su unidad móvil está sufriendo algunas fallas debido al tiempo de uso brindado. Debido a esta situación Santos se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertirlos en la reparación, asi como en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Santos sueña con instalar una granja, ya que gusta mucho de criar animales. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Santos is a 50 year old father who lives with his wife and one of their children in the Real Saucipe sector of the Paiján district in the province of Ascope in the region of La Libertad, which is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over a year he has worked as a security guard in the Puerto Malabrigo tourist hotel. With his savings, he acquired a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport goods and passengers) in which he works in his spare time. His wife sells drinks in her sister’s restaurant. With these incomes they are able to support the household. Because of the amount of use it is getting, the motor unit requires some work. Santos is asking “Edpyme Alternativa” for a loan of 1000 Nuevos soles in order to make the repairs and in this way maintain his vehicle. Santos hopes one day to have a farm as he would very much like to raise animals. He has worked with our institution before and has been shown to be a responsible borrower and punctual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: costs of repairing and maintaining a mototaxi

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 25-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Abass has owned and operated a mobile phone shop since 2006. He sells new and used mobile phones and phone accessories, and he also repairs mobile phones. His shop is very well located on a main street in a popular neighborhood, and has lots of experience in his domain. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

Abass has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new mobile phones. This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan. When Abass first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided to start his business because he wanted to have an independent work life. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase new mobile phones.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 34 años, es una mujer simpática y optimista, está casada con Olo, de 43 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Yessenia de 12 y Jonathan de 4 años. Esta hermosa familia vive en una humilde y acogedora casa que es propia.

Pese a la discapacidad que tiene en las piernas no se amilana, ni se asusta ante los trabajos pesados que desarrolla en la chacra, pues cuando la excluyen se siente “inútil”.
Por eso ayuda de su esposo y de su hija mayor, desde hace 14 años, a la crianza de sus asnos y a la siembra de papa y arveja, productos con bastante demanda en el mercado
Sus ganas de trabajar son envidiables, sólo basta escucharla para sentir que todo es posible; lo que más le gusta de vivir en la sierra y cuidar de las calabazas y cuando están maduras prepara unos deliciosos dulces. Rosa cuenta que sus hijos son bastante estudiosos, por eso le pide fuerzas al Divino para que continué trabajando y puedan seguir pagando sus estudios.
Para el futuro, planea sembrar en mayor cantidad y con las ganancias que obtenga comprar una casa en la ciudad para instalar una tienda de comestibles.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está gustosa de trabajar en su banco comunal porque se siente en familia y aprende nuevas lecciones en cada reunión. Rosa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de algunos sacos de abono y botellas de insecticidas para proteger de las plagas sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and is a kind and optimistic person. She is married to Olo, 43 years old, and together they have two children, Yessenia, who is 12, and Jonathan, who is 4. This beautiful family lives in a humble and cozy home which they own. Rosa has a disability in her legs, but this does not discourage her, nor is she afraid of the hard work that comes with farming. When she can't work she feels useless. So her husband, and her oldest daughter help her with her business raising donkeys and cultivating potatoes and other crops which are in high demand. The income she generates is enviable, and you only have to listen to her to feel that anything is possible.

What she likes most about living in the sierras and cultivating squash is that when they are ripe, she can prepare delicious sweets. Rosa says that her children are good students, so she prays for strength to continue working so that she can pay for their education. In the future, she plans to plant in greater quantity, and with the income she would like buy a house in the city and set up a small general store.

This is the 6th loan with MFP. Rosa likes working with the communal bank because it feels like a family, and she learns new things in every meeting. This loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and bottles of insecticide to protect the potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide to protect her potato crops

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio R. G.  de 24 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres junto con su conviviente, ellos estan en espera de un niño poco a poco han ido comprando sus bienes ya que es una pareja que recien esta empezando.
Su domicilio es en Barrio nuevo – Ocucaje y él se dedica al transporte diario de 7.00am hasta las 8.00 pm realizando colectivo de ica – ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 3 años trabaja en el carro de su hermano quien  congfia mucho en él.
Ellos gozan de buenas referencias desean el financiamiento para poder comprarle cosas al bebe y al mismo tiempo acondicionarle bien su dormitorio, son unas personas con bastante ganas de salir adelante cuentan con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que son  personas responsables.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio R. G. is 24 years old and lives in his parent's house with his common-law wife. They have a baby on the way, so they have been little by little accumulating goods for the baby, especially since they are a new couple. Their house is in Barrio Nuevo – Ocucaje and his job is to drive a micro (a collective van) to and from Ica to Ocucaje every day from 7:00 AM until 8:00 PM. He has had this job for three years. The van belongs to his brother, who has a lot of confidence in him. This couple has received good references and want this loan to be able to buy items for their baby and air conditioning for the baby's room. They are people with a strong desire to prosper and received good references from their neighbors, who stated that they are responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Items for their expected baby and air conditioning for the baby's room

loans.name: Yulya

texts.en:
Yulya is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells women’s clothing in one of the local markets called Yubileinyi. Yulya offers a nice selection of merchandise with different sizes and styles that always attract many customers to her kiosk at the marketplace. She has been in this business for seven years and presently has 100,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory.

Yulya is requesting a loan of 4,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital, continue to grow as an entrepreneur, and possibly open a new vending facility in the nearest future. She has proved to be a reliable and solvent client, having repaid all previous loans without any delinquencies.

Note: In the photo, Yulya is pictured on the left with a customer.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
La señora María Dora V. es casada y vive en el barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Caacupe.

 La  señora María  es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de productos de librería hace 10 años. Comenzó con un pequeño capital y gracias al buen trato con sus clientes  el negocio está en constante crecimiento.   

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de útiles y uniformes  escolares y así poder satisfacer la demanda del mercado en la temporada de inicio de clases y por ende aumentar el ingreso a su unidad familiar.

 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo y brindando sus servicios a la comunidad.
texts.en:
María Dora V. is married and lives in Caacupe's San Miguel neighborhood. She is very hard-working and has sold stationery supplies for 10 years. She started out with a small capital investment and, thanks to her good customer service, her business is constantly growing. She is asking for funds to buy school supplies and school uniforms to meet customer demand during the start of the new school term thereby increasing her family income. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given to her activity; through it, her business is growing and she is offering her services to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for the new school term.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk M., a 50-year-old  married mother of four, resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  Duk is engaged in the business of selling bread-filled ice cream, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses, while her husband is a recycler, earning an income of $9 per day. Their standard of living has mproved since starting these businesses, and Duk is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more recyclable materials for sale. This will her sixth loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy recyclable materials for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, es una mujer muy servicial y laboriosa, tiene 44 años, hace 7 años que enviudó, de aquel matrimonio tuvo 4 hijos, solo dos de ellos viven con ella en su casa propia. Cuando perdió a su esposo, cogió fuerzas para continuar trabajando por sus hijos, siendo la  única persona que debe velar por ellos. Desde hace 24 años se dedica a plantar todos los productos oriundos de la selva peruana, ahora realiza el trabajo con ayuda de sus hijos y vecinos. Ella está acostumbrada a los trabajos agrícolas y gracias a este oficio que tiene una acogedora vivienda, además que puede brindarles a sus hijos un adecuado bienestar y educación. Es por eso que desea extender sus plantaciones con frutas cítricas y paltas, ya que tiene un terreno de 8 hectáreas,  y al que todavía le falta prepararlo. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, manifiesta además que le agrada mucho trabajar en su grupo comunal, por estar integrados por personas que impulsen el respeto y la responsabilidad en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará veinte sacos de fertilizantes, mil plantas de plátanos, de esa manera pueda renovar sus cultivos, asimismo poder contratar operarios para que ayuden con esta labor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and a hard working and helpful woman. She became a widow 7 years ago and has 4 children, but only two of which live with her in her own house. When her husband died, she had to continue working in order to support her children, being the only person that could watch over them. Since she was 24 years old, she has cultivated all types of native plants from the Peruvian jungle. She continues to do the same but with the help of her children and neighbors. She is accustomed to agricultural jobs and is thankful for this profession because it has provided her with cozy housing and the ability to provide her children with a decent livelihood and education. For this reason, she hopes to expand her cultivations with citric fruits and avocados. She currently has a terrain of 8 hectares, which she still doesn't have completely prepared. This is her 7th credit with MFP, and has demonstrated that she appreciates working with her communal group because it is composed of people that promote respect and responsibility in the group. With the loan that she is applying for, she plans to buy twenty sacks of fertilizers and a thousand banana plants, with which she will be able to renovate her cultivations, and also be able to contract workers to help with the process.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a thousand banana plants, twenty sacks of fertilizer, and contract workers.

loans.name: Rathnawathi

texts.en:
Rathnawathi is a 50-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Hikkaduwa, in southern Sri Lanka.  They have three daughters who are married. They range in age from 31 to 25 years old. 

Rathnawathi has her own plant yard where she grinds cinnamon leaves to produce cinnamon oil.  She and her husband run the business together; every day her husband goes to collect cinnamon leaves from their cinnamon garden. She has gained a great deal of experience about this type of affairs.  There is a strong local demand for their products, because Hikkaduwa is located in a tourist area of Sri Lanka. There are always tourists coming to buy their cinnamon oil products.

Rathnawathi is a hard-working woman who is very knowledgeable about her business. She is asking for a 20,000 LKR loan in order to purchase more leaves to increase the capacity of her cinnamon oil production. Eventually in the future, she hopes to purchase a new grinding machine with her profits.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase cinnamon leaves

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
La señora Sara maría G. P., tiene 53 años es madre soltera de 4 hijos, que habitan y sobreviven de sus propios ingresos, hace unos años se divorsio de su pareja quedando en ella todas las deudas y gastos a incurrir en la casa y con su familia, recibe de sus hijos un apoyo para conllevar los gastos mensuales en los que se incurre, labora como conserje desde hace 3 años, siendo una mujer humilde de recursos limitados que le obstaculizan mejorar su forma de habitar.

Razón por la cual, ella solicita de un préstamo para la ampliación de su dormitorio, el lugar en donde se encuentra en la foto es donde se edificara su cuarto, esta construccion le permitirá una independencia y comodidad personal y continuara con las edificaciones que empezó gracias también a los prestamos de Afodenic, la continuidad de este proyecto favorecerá a su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Sara María G. P. is 53 years old and the single mother of 4 children, who are living independently on their own incomes. She was divorced from her husband a few years ago, and all of the debts and expenses of her family fell to her. She receives support from her children to cover her monthly costs, and she has also worked as a custodian for 3 years. She is a woman of humble means with limited resources which hinder her from improving her standard of living. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to expand her bedroom. The place where she is standing in the photo is the site where she will build her room. This construction will give her more personal independence and comfort, continuing with the construction she began thanks to previous loans from Afodenic. Carrying out this project will improve the quality of her daily life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing shoes [for resale]

loans.name: Mollecito De Covadonga Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mollecito D. Covadonga, inicia su cuarto ciclo con 19 socias.
Las socias realizan diversos negocios como L. venta D. verduras, leña, abarrotes en general, animales menores, cereales, entre otros.
Rufina es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, ingreso por invitación D. su hermana y lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Rufina es casada y estudio algunos años D. L. primaria, Rufina viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales y luego se dedica al engorD. D. animales, los que después comercializa en los mercados y restaurantes.
Rufina es muy entusiasta y ya tiene muchas amigas en el Banco Comunal, Rufina ahorra todas las semanas y es muy puntual.
Rufina necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que  invertirá en L. compra D. alimentos para animales.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Mollecito D. Covadonga Communal Bank begins its 4th cycle with 19 members. The members dedicated themselves to the selling of different products, such as vegetables, wood, groceries, small animals, cereals and so on. Rufina is the president of the Communal Bank: she became a member through her sister and what she likes more about her Communal Banks are the trainings and the incentive to saving. Rufina is married and she attended a few years of primary school. Rufina travels to fairs where she buys animals, then she fattens them and she finally sells them in the markets and to restaurants. Rufina is very zealous and she has many friend in the Communal Bank. Rufina saves some money every week and is very punctual. Rufina needs a loan of 600 PEN, money she will use to buy animal food. Her goal is to improve her business and for it to keep on growing.

Translated from Spanish by EmanueL. VilL., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal food.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan, de 29 años de edad, convive con su pareja. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Susan es de las personas a las que les gusta hacer las cosas en equipo, es por ello que junto con su pareja decidieron abrir un negocio de venta de bebidas en general. En un inicio tuvieron problemas económicos, pero poco a poco lograron recuperarse. Actualmente el negocio que posee lo ha complementado con la venta de comida, típica de la selva. De esta manera sus ganancias han aumentado. Su punto de venta lo realiza cerca de la estación de policía, desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su establecimiento con la finalidad de acoger más clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal, debido a que existe un buen clima cordial. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de bebidas, carnes, aceites y algunos ingredientes que requerirá para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Susan is 29 years old and lives with her partner. Together they reside in their own home in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. Susan is the type of person who likes working as part of a team. For this reason, she and her partner decided to open a business selling beverages. At first they encountered financial difficulties, but over time they were able to recover. They currently supplement this business by selling food, specifically traditional jungle cuisine, so that they can increase their earnings. Their vending stall is located near the police station and is open for business from 7am until 10pm. Her future plans include expanding their establishment so that they can accommodate more customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Susan promises to complete her payments on time. She feels happy to be working with her Communal Bank because there is a cordial atmosphere that exists within the group. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of beverages, meats, oil, and other ingredients needed for preparing her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, meats, oil, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Benjamin F.

texts.en: Benjamin F. M. is a licensed dealer in patient medicines and also a student of Njala University Kowama campus Bo. Benjamin had been a leader of one of our successful solidarity groups. His group has a good credit history. He is married with four children. Three of his children are in primary school. His wife assists him greatly to sell at the shop when he is in college. Benjamin needs a loan to buy more stocks of medicines for his pharmacy. He intends to use the proceeds from this loan to pay his college fees and feed his family.

loans.use: pharmacy inventory

loans.name: David Kinuthia

texts.en:
David has been a farmer since 2009.  He is 38 years old, married to Loise Wanjiku, and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this will be his 2nd loan.  He paid his previous loan of 25,000 KES well and on time.  He plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy fertilizer and pay his casual workers.

David's future plan is to buy his own farming and harvesting machinery which will facilitate faster work. At the moment he has to hire out which is expensive. Through hard work he plans to buy his own harvesting machine.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay his casual workers.

loans.name: Siuola

texts.en:
Siuola S. is 26 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Siuola has 2 years of experience in this business.  Siuola needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Siuola joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Siuola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Baatarbold

texts.en: Baatarbold N. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Baganuur district, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His oldest son currently attends university, and his three teenaged children attend a local secondary school. His wife makes traditional Mongolian boots and sells them to supplement her family's income. He operates a small wooden products production business in his area. Baatarbold started his wood products business in 2001. He received a loan from Xacbank in 2008, and spent it to purchase a saw machine and started to produce home furniture. He has used the success of his business earnings to greatly improve his quality of life. His earnings have also enabled him to pay for his children's tuition fees and school supplies for his children. For the future, Baatarbold hopes to purchase new tools to help him to improve his product quality and to increase the variety of wood products. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to buy a new machine and raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 28-year-old married man with two children aged six and four. He is the head of a nuclear family and he lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for two years now and his major constraint is limited capital to invest. Stephen feels that his shop is under-stocked; he intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, and domestic items for selling in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, and domestic items to sell in his shop

loans.name: María Felicita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

La señora María tiene 53 años de edad, está casada hace 24 años y de esta relación tuvo tres hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y  profesionales, el menor aun esta en el colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la confección de  todo tipo de ropa, pero dice que le encanta hacer ropa para niños, ella comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su casa,  trabaja todos los días en sus obras y que aprovecha al máximo su tiempo para cumplir con sus contratos ya que esta es la base de su negocio.
 
Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace ya 11 años y está muy contenta ya que le han ayudado mucho. Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura y asi  mejorar su producción.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets in the San Alejo neighborhood in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province known for its beautiful beaches along its coasts popular with both national and international tourists.

María, 53, has been married for 24 years and produced three children in this marriage.  Two of them are already adult professionals and the youngest is still in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

For many years she has made all kinds of clothing but she says she really enjoys making children’s clothes.  She shares time between work and home.  She works every day on her projects and uses her time to the maximum in order to fill her contracts which are the base of her business.

She has been in the communal bank for 11 years and is very happy because they have helped her a lot.  The new loan will be used to buy fabric and other supplies for her dressmaking in order to improve production. 

Her dream is to have a large sewing workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet A. is a single woman with no children. Her business is located at a busy market called Jericho, in Nairobi, and the business is well known by the name Baraka Electronics and Phone Accessories. She sells electronics and phone accessories to the local people. She says that she has been in this business for three years, and before getting into the business, she was also employed. 

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is debtors who do not pay as per the agreement. However, she works very hard every day from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to boost her inventory in order to expand her business while meeting her customers demands. She hopes to grow her business and open another one. She sees herself importing a whole container from china or Dubai. She describes herself as beautiful, hardworking and smart.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of chargers, speakers, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Meaon Chreb Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village loan, and they selected Mrs. Meaon C. as village bank president. She is 35 years old, and lives in BoE. Krum Kraom village in Kandal province. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, to improve their families.

Mrs. Meaon C. is a fish seller in local market, where she earns a large profit to support her family, while her husband, Mr. Sopheap Lor, is a fisherman and farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband’s field is ready to grow rice, but she does not have enough rice seed to grow. So, to improve production, Mrs. Meaon C. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a washer, while the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed.

loans.name: Tawapaneh Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tawapaneh” group from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,800,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Aminata K. is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a businessman and they have four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school.  Aminata sells cooked rice, fish, meat and vegetables. She has been a businesswoman for 15 years now.  With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil, bags of rice, fish, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil, bags of rice, fish, margi, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov K. (in the photo), and his wife, Mrs. Sokhun Mann, have been married since 1996 and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and another is still too young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Pov K. and his wife are farmers. They grow lotus and rice on their farmland in the village where they live. Pov is requesting a loan in of US$500 to continue his farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Batochir

texts.en:
Batochir J. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent and fence. His two sons attend a local school. His wife operates a clothes trading business which was started in 2007 out of a rented shipping container in her town.

 Batochir manages a transportation business, transporting people and loads between local towns. He rents a bus to use for transportation. He has been engaged this business since 2008 and has gained significant experience as a driver.

 Batochir is a very talkative man and says, "My business goal is to buy a mini-bus for my business." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to repair his rent car and purchase more clothes for his wife's business.

loans.use: To repair his rented vehicle and purchase more clothing for his wife's business

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony K. is 32 years-old and married to Priscah Kiprop who produces an additional income of Kshs. 5,000.  They don't have children at the moment. He runs a retail shop and a posho (hammer) mill.

He has been in business for 11 years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 12,000.  He is borrowing a loan of Kshs 60,000 for a period of nine months.  With the loan, he plans to add stock to the retail shop and also to purchase maize for the posho mill.

Anthony plans to use the anticipated profit to purchase a matatu (share taxi).  This is his third loan and he paid his previous loans successfully. His hope and dream is have financial stability.

loans.use: To add stock to his retail shop and to buy maize for his mill.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 34 years old. Lovelyn is married and has two children aged 14 and 11. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She also raises pigs that she fattens and sells to the market.

Lovelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Lovelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán,  se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, Leslie de 5 años, Jennifer de 11 y José Benjamín de 14 años de edad.
Ella tiene una tienda en su propia casa, donde ofrece a sus vecinos productos necesarios en el hogar, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, pastas, condimentos, sodas, jugos y galletas. Pero Lorena quiere adquirir más mercadería y solicita un préstamo para esta compra, ya que productos como maíz, Arroz, Frijoles, jabón, sodas, entre otros, son muy demandados por sus clientes, por lo que previendo de esta demanda quiere mantener su inventario fuerte.
Su aspiración es mejorar su vivienda, instalar la energía eléctrica, agua potable, para que su familia tenga una mejor condición saludable para vivir, también estar al pendiente de las necesidades de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Lorena lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She sells basic consumer goods and lives with her husband and three children: José Benjamín (14), Jennifer (11) and Leslie (5).

Lorena runs a store from her own home where she offers her neighbours basic consumer goods including beans, rice, sugar, pasta, condiments, soft drinks, juice and biscuits. However, Lorena would like to acquire more merchandise and is requesting a loan to purchase products such as corn, rice, beans, ham and soft drinks, amongst others. Given that these products are in high demand from her customers, Lorena would like to keep up her inventory.  

Lorena aspires to improve her home by installing electricity and potable drinking water so that her family can have a healthier environment to live in. As well as these improvements, Lorena must also meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase corn, rice, beans, soap, soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Charisse

texts.en:
Charisse Q. is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 22 years old and married with two infant children. Charisse owns and operates a manufacturing business. Her main source of income comes from manufacturing and selling sandals and slippers to local businesses and community members. Charisse has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

Charisse joined HSPFI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase raw materials and expand her product offerings. Charisse is now requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase raw materials and manufacture additional products. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Charisse from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and manufacture products

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Alonso de 43 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Para ella la crianza de ganado es una actividad que ha ido aprendiendo a lo largo de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió este trabajo de sus padres, quienes se esforzaron mucho para darle una buena vida. Sus animales los lleva a vender a la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma, donde consigue unos buenos precios, ya que sus reses son las más grandes y fuertes de toda la feria, debido a los buenos cuidados que ella les brinda. Lleva 26 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es alimentar a sus animales, espera más adelante poder incrementar el numero de reses que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria, ya que le es muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de alcanzar sus metas. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, igual como hizo con sus anteriores créditos, ella es una socia muy alegre y querida en su banco comunal y espera poder seguir trabajando bien con todas sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una ternera para criarla y alimentarla y con lo que sobre comprará forraje para su ganado.
texts.en:
Wilma, 39, is a loving and hardworking mother.  She lives in her parent's house along with her husband Alonso, 43, and her 4 beloved children, who are the main motivation for all of her efforts.  For her, raising livestock is an activity that she has been learning throughout her life.  From the time that she was very young she learned this trade from her parents, who worked hard to give her a good life.  She takes her animals to sell in the livestock market in the city of Tarma.  There she gets good prices, since her cows are the biggest and strongest in the whole market as a result of the care that she gives them.  

She has been doing this type of work for 26 years, and what she likes most is feeding the animals.  In the future, she hopes to increase the number of cows that she has and in this way increase her income.  What she considers most difficult is transporting her livestock to the market, since this is very tiring, but she knows she has to do it and she is ready to work very hard to reach her goals.  This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has a strong desire to make her payments on time, just as she did with her previous loans.  She is a cheerful and well-liked member of her communal bank, and she hopes to continue to work well with all of the other members.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy a calf to raise and to feed, and with the rest of the money she will buy fodder for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Akoth O. is 33 years old, single and has three children aged between 9 and 14 years old. Her business is located at Mtopanga estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, including the Indian Ocean white beaches. 

Mary has a tailoring shop in which she makes clothes for the local people. She has been in this business for 10 years now and has three employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 30,000 KES to buy materials to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and open a second one in the future. She also hopes to give her children a quality education. She describes herself as jovial.

loans.use: to purchase materials to grow her business

loans.name: Humura Cb Group

texts.en:
Humura group is made up of 22 people. All the members of that group are very hardworking and they all have small scale businesses. Most of the group members have shops in which they sell several items which are commonly used at home such as salt,soap,sugar etc.

Farida is the group president, she has 4 children who are between the ages 7 to 23 years old. She is 43 years old and her husband is a driver. She sells charcoal and she is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal. With the profits she plans pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita D. T. is from the village of Damayuhan, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Lenita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lenita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish like kitob & bangse, in the local community. Lenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish & for working capital. Lenita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional fish, like sardines & milk fish. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Lenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en: Tsolmon is 25 years old and lives with her mother in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in someone else's backyard. Tsolmon and her mother both work at a Tsambagarav hotel as cooks. Besides her work there, she manages a door-to-door meal-selling business in her town. She is planning to continue her business in the future. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase food items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items to resell.

loans.name: Calisto

texts.pt:
Calisto nasceu no Distrito de Manduimba, Provincia de Cabo Delgado Norte de Moçambique tem 45 anos de idade, é solteiro e pai de 1 filho que esta frequentando 3ª classe. Vive numa casa alugada e responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ele.

Saiu de Cabo Delgado para a provincia de Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatorio. Trabalha como professor de sargentos na escola das forças de defesa de Moçambique, naõ possui nenhum empregado e recebe um salario de 23.435,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar alguma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de seus colegas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 27.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a sua casa e continuar com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Calisto was born in the district of Manduimba, state of Cabo Delgado Norte in Mozambique. He is 45 years old, single, and father of a 3rd grade child. He lives in a rented house, where he lives with his son and nephew, for whom he is responsible for.

He left Cabo Delgado and moved to the state of Maputo to do compulsory military service. He teaches sargeants at the School of defense force in Mozambique, doesn't have any employees and receives an income of 23.435,00mt/month (545,48€/month), which he uses to pay housing expenses, and still manages to save some in his bank account.

He never asked for any other loan. He got to know Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is first loan at Hluvuku, in the amount of 27.000,00mt ( 628,46€), with which he plans to buy construction materials (such as cement, sand, stone and others) to continue building his house.
He is confident that he will be able to pay it before deadline. After that, he plans to ask for another loan to finish his house and continue his education.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone and others).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
