Rose lives in  Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, five of whom are in school. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.   

Rose has operated a market stall business for 10 years, working 6 days a week. She has requested for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and hopes for her business are to see it grow big, to own a delivery van and to build her own rooming house .

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.   She makes a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling meat products.

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and medicines for her pigs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 55 years old and married with six adult-aged children. Samuel's wife works as a fulltime housewife. Samuel is a farmer working in the Philippines. Samuel has been growing rice for 10 years. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. In the future, Samuel hopes that his farming business improves so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Sinoun, 27 year old, is a grocery seller.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver and their income is $9 per day.  They have one child and he is one year old. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food and $15 on transportation.  She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a new motorbike for her husband for his motor taxi driving because the current motorbike is too old and needs a lot of repairs.  She wants to extend her grocery shop to sell more goods.  She also plans to buy a house because right now she stays with her mother, so she wants to get her own house for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's motorbike transport business.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
This is Norie, 44, a resident of Baseco Port Area, Manila, Philippines. He is single but works hard to sustain himself and to continually provide income for his everyday expenses, although he shares his income with his family. Norie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. Norie earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Aside from the store, he has a food stall where one can buy home-cooked meals. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. Norie earns a minimum of PHP 750 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. A portion of the loan will also be used to buy quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. Norie hopes to be able to expand soon and live a happy life. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loan

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products for his store

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr:
Akpene est une femme âgée de 44ans, elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle est mère de deux.
Akpene travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010.Elle vend du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffage. Elle achète aussi bien à Atakpamé qu’à Anié.Elle travaille avec un employé.
Akpene a requis  son  premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter du bois de chauffage et des sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en: Akpene is 44 years old. She is married to a driver and the mother of two children. She has been a merchant since 2010, selling charcoal and firewood. She gets her supplies both in Atakpamé and in Anié. She has hired an employee. Akpene came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy firewood and sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textbooks and a laptop computer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de publicidad, ella hace letreros, folletos, almanaques y afiches, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de publicidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como papeles, cartulinas y pegamentos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “CUSCO” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The associate is Señora Gladys.  She is 39 years of age and single with 2 children.  The associate alternates her daily activities with a publicity business.  She makes signs, pamphlets, almanacs and  posters.  She works from 8AM to 7PM.  By means of this business the associate raises her children.  The associate wants to grow and improve her publicity business.  She requests the loan to buy materials such as paper, posterboard and adhesives.  

 The associate is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as paper, posterboard and adhesives

loans.name: Corazon De Chocolate Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON DE CHOCOLATE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Remy. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gelatina y frescos, pintura en tela y goma eva, perfumes, tienda de barrio, puesto de tucumanas, venta de videos educativos, venta de juguetes.

La señora Remy,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por medio de un anuncio (volantes). En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio producción de artesanías en tela y de goma eva.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pintura y goma eva), que comprara de la Huyustus  y lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Corazón de Chocolate” (Chocolate Heart) Communal Bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center.  The group is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a governing board that is headed by Remy.  The members’ businesses are varied.  Among our businesses we have selling gelatin and soft drinks, painting on fabric and vinyl, perfumes, neighborhood store, a “tucumanas” (fried turnovers) stand, selling educational videos, and selling toys.

Remy points out that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer.  She joined by way of an advertisement (flyer).  She currently has a business producing handicrafts in fabric and vinyl.  This loan is to increase her capital (to buy paint and vinyl).  She will make her purchases in Huyustus, and she will sell them by order.

This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy paint for fabric and vinyl.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro  conviviente más de 5 años con la señora Victoria, tienen 2 hijos dependientes, viven en el pueblo de Mosoj Rancho hace 3 años atrás.

El señor Isidro realiza servicio de transporte con vehículo propio de la comunidad hacia Colomi (localidad del Departamento de Cochabamba ubicada a en la provincia Chapare), la esposa se dedica a la actividad agrícola y al cuidado de sus animales, ellos se apersonaron a  consultar sobre créditos y se les comento sobre la los créditos mediante Kiva que podían obtener.

Ellos necesitan dinero para comprar 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno (torillos para engorde), así poder mejorar más sus ingresos económicos y tener siempre un buen futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Isidro has lived with Señora Victoria for more than 5 years.  They have 2 dependent children and have lived in the town of Mosoj Rancho for more than 3 years.

Señor Isidro runs a transportation service.  With his own vehicle, he takes people from the community to Colomi (a neighborhood in Cochabamba Department, located in Chapare Province.)  His wife makes her living in agriculture; she raises animals.  They took it upon themselves to look into loans and were told about the Kiva loans that they could get.

They need the money to purchase 5 head of cattle (young bulls to fatten up) to be able to improve their financial earnings and always provide a good future for their children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos de 45 años de edad trabaja para lEl Hospital del Rama desde hace 18 años, desempeñandose como Guarda de seguridad. Esta solicitando  su 10mo. credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa para tener mejores condiciones, cabe señalar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para levantar una pared que se encontraba en mal estado.
texts.en: Marcos Tulio is 45 years old and has worked as a watchman at El Rama Hospital for the last 18 years. He is asking for his 10th loan to build a room in his house to improve his living conditions. It is worth mentioning that he used the last loan to erect a wall that was in a bad state of repair.

loans.use: to builld a room.

loans.name: Ngomango

texts.en:
Ngomango is a married man with four children, two of whom attend school. One is too young for school and the other one finished school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Ngomango has operated a goat meat selling business for the past ten years. His potential clients are the people at the market. He faces the major challenge of livestock lost or even death sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 35,000 he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of the short loan processing and acquiring time.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a widow and mother of two sons. Her husband's death was a very difficult time for her, but she never gave up and started her grocery business at home to raise her children. Now her sons are young and do work. They are involved in an embroidery and sewing business. 

Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son, who wants to buy another sewing machine and clothes for the further expansion of his business. He will also hire a worker, which will allow him to finish the orders on time and increase his sales and profits. He has vast experience in his business and Yasmeen is very confident that an investment will be a productive one for him. She wants him to marry soon and is hopeful that an improved business condition will help her make savings for that purpose.

Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Yasmeen".

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and clothes for an embroidery and sewing business

loans.name: Nadmidsuren

texts.en: Nadmidsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and her two kids are college students. She started her garment retailing business in 2003 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is stable and has many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching, she needs more warmer clothes to sell. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids joined a college, it is hard to pay fees; however, my husband and I will do everything [we] can to support them." She is requesting 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy winter clothes.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Последний кредит КИВА Людмила использовала для того, чтобы закупить женские колготки. Она неплохо поторговала, получила прибыль, смогла помочь родным в ремонте дома.  
В этот раз она решила воспользоваться кредитными услугами КИВА, потому что ей необходимы средства, чтобы пополнить сезонный товар.
Людмила очень трудолюбива, она трудится для того,чтобы содержать себя и помочь родне.
texts.en:
Ludmila has used her previous credit in order to stock up on women’s pantyhose. Her sales were decent; she earned some revenues and was able to help out her relatives with paying for house repairs.

This time she decided to ask for a Kiva loan because she needs financial means for expanding the assortment of seasonal goods.
Ludmila is very hard-working. She toils to support herself and help out her relatives.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of seasonal goods

loans.name: Ramazana

texts.en:
Ramazana is a 51-year-old farmer from the village of Chantlikure, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maisarat, his 21-year-old son and his daughter-in-law. Ramazana’s son has just married. 
Ramazana and Maisarat lead the agricultural activities of the family. They grow vegetables on a family-owned plot of land. The family also has beehives with bee colonies. They sell harvested honey locally. They also sell harvested fruits and vegetables locally. The family's total average monthly income is 600 GEL. 
Ramazana has requested credit to purchase a wedding gift for his son and daughter-in-law. Maisarat will assist him in selection of the gift.

loans.use: to purchase a wedding gift for his son and daughter-in law.

loans.name: Aba Ami

texts.fr: Dame Aba est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, de riz, d'huiles et de l'eau glacée à domicile. Très connue dans son quartier, elle s'approvisionne dans les machés de la ville. La cliente sollicite le concours de Finadev pour l'obtention d'un prêt afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges  personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Aba is married and the mother of five children.  She sells various grocery products such as rice, oil, and frozen water from her home.  Aba is well-known in her neighborhood.  She buys her products at various markets in town.  Aba is requesting a loan from Finadev in order to meet personal and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy 25 large jars of Mayonnaise, 100 bags containing 1kg. of rice, 100 bottles of oil and other grocery products.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo es de la ciudad de Carapeguá tiene 48 años, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia con su esposa Severina. Es macatero (vendedor ambulante), aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien empezó a incursionar en el ámbito de ventas desde muy pequeño.
Decidió dedicarse al rubro ya que cuenta con una experiencia y a esta le acompaña la necesidad de dar ingreso a su familia. El se define como un hombre trabajador, honesto,  responsable y emprendedor, que se esfuerza al máximo diariamente para poder darle a su familia lo mejor para que no tengan que pasar por privaciones.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de colchas, sobrecamas, sabanas, fundas,etc. los cuales son los principales productos que vende. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Alejo is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is 48 years old, married and has two children.  He lives in his own home with his wife Severina.  He is a macatero (street vendor).  He learned this trade from his father with whom he started dabbling in sales when he was very young.  He decided to dedicate himself to this trade since he has experience and he needed to provide his family with an income.  

He describes himself as a hard-working, honest, responsible and enterprising man who works hard every day to be able to give his family the best so that they do not have to experience hardship.  He needs the loan to purchase quilts, bedspreads, sheets and pillowcases as these are the main products he sells.  

He is grateful to Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: purchase quilts, bedspreads, sheets and pillowcases to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has eight children. He has received schooling through a scholarship. Francis sells charcoal at Asebu Brebia, which he has done  for some time now. His wife is a trader. 

Francis uses his income to pay his children’s school fees. Francis will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal. With the new profits, Francis hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for charcoal.

loans.name: Hifa'a

texts.en: Haifa'a is a 48 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Marka Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to buy a new furniture and to have electricity connected to her home. In the future she would like to buy a car.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old, married and has three children. She is in the business of selling clothes and has been in business for the past twelve years. She also practices farming. She used her previous loan to buy clothes for resale. Her business flourished and she successfully repaid her loan. She is a very hard working lady and describes her business as quite busy. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money for future purposes.
She hopes to be a very successful business lady and to open a boutique. She requires a loan of 32,298 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a housewife ,a 56 year old young lady living with her husband and children in Rawalpindi,Pakistan. Sakeena is responsible for the daily chores of the household while her husband is the bread winner for the family and is very hardworking and passionate man about his work.Her husband has been running a carry van vehicle from 5 long years now for someone else and it is very well known for its services ,so he decided to buy his van and run his business  but due do lack of the savings he had ,her husband is not able to buy the carry van  ,Therefore Sakeena applied so to help her husband. Sakeena is sure that her husband by mere his handwork would be able to return the loan amount.She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help  her husband  purchase carry van.

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
You can see in the picture the young woman who loves the animals. She is a very known woman in Khirdalan town.She is 43, married, has 4 children. She started this business 10 years ago.
 Maleyka borrowed the loan $500 to buy a calf. 
She requires a loan of $1000 to buy a cow in order to get milk and cheese.
She is a very hard worker. This business allows her to support to her family. She is very optimistic about the future of her business.
She is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region. She was settled in Khirdalan town. She has been engaged in this busines for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy 1 milch cow

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has two children. She makes and sells pillows. She obtains sponge materials from mattress-making industries and prepares pillow cases herself. Her pillows are so good that one cannot tell that they are hand made. Asha has been in this business for three years now.

She recently received an order from a nearby region of Morogoro after sending a sample of twenty pillows. What she can produce is only ten percent of what is needed. A loan of USD550 will help her meet the demand.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more varieties of beads

loans.name: Mehbare

texts.en: Mehbare N. owns and operates a small clothing stand in the Devechi Bazaar, in a town located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Mehbare has already successfully paid back two loans with Norwegian Microcredit. Her last loan was for $400. Mehare is looking for funding so that she can further invest in her business by increasing her inventory with better quality clothing.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Mr. Magno (37) is married to Sonia (28), and they have four children, three of whom are school-age and go to a public school. They have lived in the home of a relative for eight years, ever since they have been married.

Mr. Magno, is a native of the town of Mayor Otaño, 180 km from the city of Encarnación, where he moved 12 years ago in search of better work opportunities. He started out as an employee at a supermarket.

His wife, for the past 6 years, has had a grocery store, which she runs efficiently. Thanks to a little bit of capital they had, three years ago he decided to change jobs and he opened, in the same location as the grocery store, a business selling corn, which is going quite well.

The couple's project is to first consolidate their micro-enterprises, then start investing the earnings in a house of their own, a dream which the whole family yearns for.

Magno is soliciting financing of $300 for the purchase of corn on sale, an offer which he just received. Buying in large quantity and at this price makes it possible for him to compete better in the his market.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Señor Magno (37), está casado con Sonia (28), y tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres están en edad escolar y van a una escuela pública. Viven en la casa de un pariente desde hace ocho años, tiempo en que están casados.

El Señor Magno, oriundo de la colonia Mayor Otaño, distante a 180 Km. de la ciudad de Encarnación, a la cual se había mudado hace 12 años en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo. Empezando así como empleado de un Supermercado.

Su esposa, desde hace 6 años posee una despensa, el cual administra eficientemente. Gracias a un pequeño capital que poseía, hace tres años decidió cambiar de trabajo y abrió en el mismo local de la despensa, un negocio de ventas de maíz, el cual le esta yendo bastante bien.

El proyecto de la pareja es consolidar primero sus microempresas, para luego empezar a invertir las ganancias en una casa propia, sueño que anhela toda la familia.

Magno nos solicita la financiación de $ 300 para la compra de maíz en oferta que esta recibiendo en estos momentos. La compra en cantidad y al contado de estos productos hace que pueda competir mejor en el mercado en la que trabaja.

loans.use: to buy corn on sale and in bulk

loans.name: Sipau

texts.en: Sipau is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has never stopped looking for a business to support herself and her family. Currently, she grows vegetables in her garden with her husband. She brings her produce to the flea market in front of her house, and also brings her vegetables to the newly opened market at Fugalei. She typically earns $200 to $300 a week, and the money is spent to support her children’s education and her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Janu Kumari

texts.en: Janu Kumari R. lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. She lives in Bholdhoka of Lalitpur district. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and the younger son is in grade 5. Her daughter is studying in grade 4. Her husband, Mr. Shiva R., is a laborer in house construction work. Mrs. R. opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making ladies' dresses. She prefers to make popular dress styles like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. R. took a 4-month training course in tailoring. Now she seeks a loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work like cloth, string and a cutting machine.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam N., age 25, is single and has no children. He has stayed with his trade as a hair stylist for four years and employs three apprentices. With his income, he not only supports himself but also covers the cost of schooling for his younger brother, who is almost done with his secondary education. In addition, Mr. N. saves some of his income. With this loan, he intends to acquire four electric clippers and to renovate his salon in order to meet his customer expectations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Enyonam N. est célibataire sans enfant et âgé de 25 ans. Il détient le métier de la coiffure depuis 04 ans et a engagé 03 apprentis. Il supporte par ses revenus les frais scolaires de son petit frère qui en classe de première et subvient à ses propres besoins. De plus il épargne une partie de ses revenus. Par ce crédit, il prétend acquérir 04 tondeuses et aménager son salon de coiffure pour la satisfaction de la clientèle.

loans.use: To acquire 4 electric clippers and to renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Mrs. Dong S., 44, is married with five children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling palm sugar to a nearby market, while her husband is the one who is a palm sugar refiner. He has to get up very early in the morning to collect palm juice and start refining it. With this business activity, S. and her husband can collectively make around $4 per day of profit. Therefore, one of her children is a driver; another one is a bus-conductor; and the balance of their children are enrolled in school. S. and her husband would like to spend the rest of their time breeding pigs for additional profit, but they face a financial constraint. To do so, the couple would like to request for a loan to help them.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise for an addititional profit.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 45 years old and is married with four children. She is a market vendor who sells confections including caramel, sugar and chocolate. She also picks almond nuts and sells them wholesale. Fatima first applied to IMON  several years ago and she states that IMON helped her to develop her business and increase the income for her family. 

Fatima now requests 3,000.00 Somoni (US$875.00) for 12 months. She plans to increase her working capital and to purchase land in the center of the region to construct a private store. Fatima thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital and expanding of the business and constructing of the private store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells shoes, clothes and bags, a skill that she acquired in a year. She has been in business since 2005. Joy is 32 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is determined to support her husband, who earns a meager salary, in improving the prosperity of the family.

She is asking for a loan of $875 to buy more shoes, clothes and bags. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, clothes and bags for sale.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Sociales Group

texts.en:
Juana D. J. is a beautiful young Haitian woman, who moved to the Dominican Republic with her family in hopes of finding more opportunity and a better life for her children. She is a single mom, and lives with her two children (ages 3 and 8). Her 8 year old son attends school, but her youngest child spends every day with her, either at their house or working. With this loan Juana wants to buy a large supply of shampoo, conditioner, and other hair products to sell. She will start by selling these items on the streets, but eventually wants to have a small shop to run her business out of. Juana told us that when she isn’t working, she loves reading and going to the beach!

Esperanza wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for supporting this group of amazing women. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy hair products.

loans.name: Possisso

texts.fr:
Mr. Possisso K. was born June 3rd, 1983 in Patatoukou in Amou prefecture. Single, he is a carpenter and woodworker in Lomé’s Totsi neighborhood. In 2005, he opened his workshop called “AMEUBLEMENT KEVINPOSS.” Because of his work quality, he consistently wins construction contracts and makes a good income. Currently he is lacking certain work tools. This is his first loan and he is seeking to borrow 300,000 Francs CFA to buy a drill, a sharpener, and an electric generator. The plan to buy a generator is timely because there is a failure to provide electricity in the Totsi neighborhood.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Possisso est né le 03 juin 1983 à Patatoukou dans la préfecture d’Amou. Célibataire, il est un charpentier menuisier dans le quartier Totsi à Lomé. En 2005, il a ouvert son atelier « AMEUBLEUMENT KEVINPOSS ». Compte tenu de son travail bien fait, il gagne toujours des marchés de construction et en tire assez de revenus. Présentement, il manque de certains outils de travail. Il est à son premier crédit et sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter une perceuse, une meule et un groupe électrogène. La prévision d’achat du groupe électrogène vient a point nommé car il y a défaillance dans la fourniture de l’énergie électrique dans le quartier de Totsi.

loans.use: Purchase of a drill, a sharpener, and an electric generator

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
An affectionate mother, Juliana’s dearest wish is to be able to provide an excellent education for her two beloved children. The economic situation of Juliana’s family allowed her to finish only secondary school, but she always demonstrated great enthusiasm for improving herself and for persevering in life, and this is how, with effort and dedication, she succeeded in opening a “bodeguita”—a small store. Over a period of years, this little general store has become one of the busiest in town. Thanks to the success of her store and profits made by her husband, they were able to build a second and third floor to their house. Now they can rent out the rooms, and the money earned will partially cover the cost of their children’s education. Your support gives hope to this devoted mother. With the borrowed money, she will be able to increase the merchandise in her store and save toward her children’s university education.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Juliana es una madre muy cariñosa y humilde de corazón, las posibilidades económicas de su familia sólo le permitieron concluir sus estudios secundarios, pero siempre demostró gran entusiasmo por superarse y perseverar en la vida, es así que con esfuerzo y dedicación logró abrir su pequeña bodeguita que durante estos largos años le costo implementar.Esta tiendita con el transcurso de los años se convirtió en una de las bodeguitas más concurridas de su localidad, gracias a ello y a los beneficios que con esfuerzo consigue su esposo, pudieron construir la segunda y tercera planta de su vivienda, habitaciones que ahora se encuentran en alquiler, dinero con el que logran cubrir en parte la educación de sus hijosEl anhelo más grande que Juliana cobija en su corazón es poder brindarle estudios superiores a sus 2 amados hijos, esta diligente madre se encuentra esperanzada en tu apoyo, con el dinero solicitado podrá incrementar la mercadería de su tienda, y podrá tener más ahorros para solventar la universidad de sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise for her store, save money to pay university costs for her children

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr:
Mame Yacine S. is married with 6 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Santhiaba Mosquée for 5 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling cloth, perfume, incense, and home-made soap. She wants to continue her business in order to improve the living conditions and health of her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Mame Yacine S. est mariée avec 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 5ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des tissus, des parfums, de l’encens et du savon artisanal. Elle veut poursuivre son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of cloth, perfume, incense, and soap

Achat et revente de tissus, parfums, encens et savon.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene es productor de leche de vaca,  percibe un sueldo quincenal por la venta de la leche, además cultiva choclo, el cual comercializarÁ en el mes de octubre que es la temporada para la cosecha. 

Vive solo en casa propia (Palomar).
 
Con el monto del crédito adquirirá una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar sus ventas de leche.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro pero es apto para recibir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rene is a producer of cow's milk; he receives biweekly pay for milk sales. He also cultivates corn, which he will sell in October, the month of the harvest. He lives alone in his own house in Palomar, Bolivia. With loan proceeds he will buy a milk cow since he wishes to increase milk sales. This is his first loan with field partner IMPRO, but he is a good candidate to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
Naite A., 43, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in making traditional fans and cava bowls. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Naite's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She needs the loan to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: to assist her in buying materials and equipment used for her business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mr. N. Ny, a villager in Kouk Trob Village in Kadal Province, is an ice-cream seller who now wants to sells his product door-to-door. He is therefore requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for that purpose. His wife, Mrs. Nheab Na, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mr. N. Ny is 26 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest is only two years old. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice-cream door-to-door.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali M. is a 35-year-old married man with four children. All of his children are currently in school. 

M. is one of the few wholesale provision shop owners in his community. He has run this business for four years. M. buys his goods from Kumasi, a city, to stock his shop. 

Since many provision shop owners in his community buy from him, he wants more working capital to buy goods in bulk to be able to meet the increasing demand of his customers. M. belongs to a group called “Peace” in his community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk such as cartons of milk, bags of sugar, evaporated milk, etc.

loans.name: Nury

texts.en:
Nury M. lives in Khujand. She is married with three children. Nury trades in children's wear in the local bazaar, called Panjshanbe. She has worked with MicroInvest since 2008 and has shown herself to be an honest client. She has not had delays in her previous loan repayments so she is now taking a new larger loan.

Nury imports children's wear twice a month and has a good assortment. She is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 1500 STJ for one month. She will use the loan to import seasonal wear from Kyrgyz Republic. Nury thanks Kiva for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To import seasonal wear to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has been working as a carpenter for sixteen years. Ahmad has a lot of experience and is very good. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital but now he plans to expand his business. 

He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a new machine for his business. This is his second cycle and he paid the first on time.  His previous loan helped him expand his business and he would like to continue doing so.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for his business.

loans.name: Julia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Julia O. se ha dedicado a su actividad de venta de frutas  y verduras las que son comercializadas por ella misma en su propio tramo que ha logrado surtir mucho en el mercado.

Diariamente ella es visitada por varios clientes que le visitan con el propósito de obtener las frutas y verduras para su uso. Es importante destacar que hoy en día la señora Julia ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de estos perecederos. Es por este motivo que espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia O. has a stand in the central market of Chinandega, Nicaragua where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has done well with this venture. She is visited daily by clients who look to her for the fruits and vegetables they need. She has made a request to the local Nicaraguan agency Ceprodel for a loan to be used for the purchase of the perishable items she sells. She is hopeful that the loan will be made available to her so she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hieng T. is a farmer who lives in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a 55-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school.

Although they try hard, they still earn not enough income to support the family. In order to support the family, Mrs. Hieng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise, and she hopes to support the family well after she sells her cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda va cumplir 27 años de edad, hace 7 años vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, actualmente habitan en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 12 años produce papa, alverjas y maíz, en su mayoría, en chacras alquiladas, trata de sembrar en diferentes lugares y con temperaturas diversas para que sus cosechas sean alternadas. Su esposo es el encargado de realizar los trabajos más pesados, sobre todo en los meses de cosecha donde es indispensable su presencia. La siembra de papa le ha resultado muy buena gracias al buen precio del mercado, pero el maíz está en una mala temporada, los precios han bajado mucho, por ello decidió aguantar la cosecha hasta que mejore el precio. Asimismo, ya está preparando 2 chacras para sembrar alverjas, sembrará en distintas épocas para evitar que si bajan los precios recaiga en toda su producción. Hilda está muy feliz de ser campesina, y este trabajo le permite el sostenimiento de su familia. Es la secretaria de su banco comunal, y viene ejerciendo este cargo durante dos ciclos consecutivos, donde está demostrando mucha eficiencia. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad. El dinero que viene solicitando Hilda es para la compra de semillas de alverjas, asimismo los fertilizantes para complementar sus siembra.
texts.en:
Hilda will soon turn 27-years-old. For 7 years, she has lived with her partner and father of her 2 children. Currently they live in a rented house. For 12 years, she has produced potatoes, peas, and corn, mostly on rented plots of land. She trieds to plant in different places with diverse temperatures so her harvests can alternate. Her husband is in charge of carrying out the most difficult work; above all his presence during the harvest season is indispensable. Her potato harvest has yielded very good results thanks to the good market price, but corn is in a bad period because the prices have dropped a lot. This is why she has decided to postpone its harvest until the prices improve. This is why she is preparing 2 plots of land to plant peas. She will plant them in different stages to avoid having all of her production earn less money if prices fall. Hilda is very happy with being a farmer because this work allows them to support their family. She is the secretary of her communal bank, and she has had this position for two consecutive cycles. She is working with a lot of efficiency. This is her eighth loan with MFP. During this time she has not defaulted. The money that HIlda is requesting will go towards buying pea seeds and fertilizer to complement her plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Bazhan Group

texts.en: Bazhan S. A. is the group leader of the Bazhan group. There are four members in this group. Each member of the group has a business that will benefit from this loan. The money will be used to purchase materials for these local businesses. Bazhan’s loan will provide necessary materials for his book store. Shareifa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Gull Sherin will use the loan for his brother’s general store business. Maleha wants to take a loan for her cosmetics shop. They are all very happy with this opportunity to borrow money in Afghanistan. With this loan, they can collectively expand their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 34 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Salim has been working as a farmer.

Salim requested a loan of 1300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Salim has requested a loan.

Salim is speciA. because he has experience. His clients are people from his region. Salim decided on his business because he learned it since he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es: La familia de Hernán esta compuesta por 5 integrantes: él, su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Cuentan con casa propia. Hernán se dedica al transporte con su moto taxi, adicionalmente cuenta con una  vagoneta que también presta servicio de taxi los dos vehículos en la zona. La esposa cuenta con un  negocio dentro del mercado central de la localidad donde vende todo tipo de comidas  desde la mañana hasta la noche. El nivel de competencia es medio en sus actividades. El crédito será destinado para la compra de un equipo de gas para su vehiculo. Esta es su quinta operación con un cumplimiento excelente en todas ellas.
texts.en:
Hernán's family consists of five members: himself, his wife, and their three young children. They own their house. Hernán works in transportation with his motorcycle-taxi. He also has a minibus that provides taxi service and the two vehicles operate in their local area. His wife owns a business in the town's central market; she sells various types of food at all hours from morning until night. She has intermediate business skills. The loan will be used to buy a gas tank for Hernán's vehicle. This is his fifth loan cycle and he has an excellent record of loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gas tank

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.5 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.5 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz , d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba  et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2.5 group is made up of married women from the village of Fonfona, town of Koutiala, region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents- and sisters-in-law etc. Their average age is 45 and they have at least 6 children each. They mainly cultivate rice and peanuts.

Wishing to make their agricultural businesses more profitable, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.5 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four loans, they are now on their 5th rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut and rice seed, various minor materials, and intrants for their crops in the markets of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold in the market of M’pessoba and the surrounding markets, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele coming mostly from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.5 group expects to make a profit of 70,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seed, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is 55 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the Western Region and a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard working woman. Ama sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, and so forth in a store on the street. She has been in business for six years, and she wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
C. Phạm Thị (524030589) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three adult children.

C. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Ysabel es  conviviente, tiene 52 años, tres hijos mayores, que trabajan y son independientes.
Ysabel trabaja vendiendo de todo lo que sus clientes le piden, pero se presento la oportunidad de de trabajar  en  un centro de educación ocupacional, ella acepto aprendió  hacer panes, pasteles, y los vende 
Desde que Isabel esta en Finca, gracias a las charlas de negocio que recibe aprendió a administrar su economía y su negocio. 
Isabel necesita un préstamo de  800 soles,  para invertirlos en  ingredientes para hacer pasteles harina, azúcar 
El sueño de Isabel es  tener un negocio propio, una panadería.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of "Bancomunal Siempre Juntas." She is 52 years old. Ysabel lives with her partner and has 3 grown children that work and are independent. Ysabel works selling anything her clients order, but she was presented with the opportunity to work at a center for occupational education. She accepted and learned to make breads and cakes to sell. Thanks to the business education she has received since being at Finca, Isabel has learned to manage her finances and her business.

Isabel needs a loan of 800 soles to invest in ingredients to make cakes: wheat and sugar. Isabel's dream is to have her own business, a bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cake ingredients

loans.name: Zubairi's Group

texts.en:
G. Zubairi is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is a married man with eleven children and he also cares for his parents.

For ten years, Zubairi has been a businessman with a fish-selling business and also a secondhand clothes business in Iganga and Bugembe respectively. Both businesses have grown and he is able to make 20,000/= and 80,000/= as profits from the businesses. Zubairi needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes to sell and to buy more fish since an increased stock increases sales.

Zubairi is a friendly and a hardworking man and his goal is to have more businesses like rearing goats and poultry so that he could have more income; and for the goats, he plans to buy a plot where he will be able to keep them. He also strives to educate all his children.

loans.use: To buy more fish and used-clothes to increase his stock

loans.name: Khum

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mr. S. and his wife. They have one young child who is still not enrolled in school. The young couple earns a living by making furniture for sale. S. says that he currently faces difficulty transporting his finished products to sell because he doesn’t have a vehicle. He has decided to ask for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a trailer-motor in order to supply his business. In addition, he proposes to use this trailer to provide a taxi service. He dreams of opening a small shop to provide a tailoring service and he feels that this loan will bring his dream closer.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer-motor in order to transport his products to sell.

loans.name: Modesta Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Modesta Sánchez tiene la edad de 45 años madre soltera con cinco hijos viven en el barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, mujer pionera en el campo de la comercialización de ventas de ropa, trabaja por su propia cuenta, teniendo como planes mejorar sus condiciones de vida ofreciéndole a su familia mayores posibilidades de superación. Tiene su negocio desde hace nueve meses, lo inicio con pequeñas cantidades de productos en la trayectoria que tiene ha encontrado dificultades como que los clientes no le paga y llega ha tener pérdidas siendo de gran experiencia al saber a quien le venderá al créditos. Gracias a la institución ha crecido en su negocio por medio de los financiamientos el cual invertirá en la compra de nuevos y mayores cantidades de: ropas de hombre, damas y niños, compra de calzado, ropa interior y artículo de belleza, cosmético y perfumería obteniendo mayores clientelas que a su vez le generara utilidades. Cumpliendo con las perspectivas  en el ámbito laboral.

loans.use: Comprar ropa para dama y caballeros

loans.name: Isaura Isaias

texts.pt:
Isaura Isaías M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de dois filhos de 15 e 10 anos de idade, ambos vão a escola, estudou ate 6ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino e parou de estudar por motivos de gravidez pois teve que ir ao lar. Não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos filhos.

Em 1996 Isaura saiu da cidade de Maputo para Boane junto com o marido e filhos, por motivos da transferência do marido que e funcionário do ministério da defesa nacional. Vive na casa do serviço do marido no bairro militar.

Isaura é vendedora Ambulante de camarão, aprendeu a fazer o negocio em Boane com as amigas a 06 anos atrás, não tem empregado e chega a fazer 10 horas diárias, actualmente tem capacidade para adquirir camarão no valor de 10.000,00mt, quantidade que depois de vendida consegue um lucro de aproximadamente 5.000,00mt, com o qual, somando com o valor que marido da, sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum através de poupanças bancárias.

Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende investir na diversificação dos produtos no seu negócio adquirindo lulas e caranguejo. O seu maior desafio é de um dia poder adquirir um congelador maior que o que usa agora para poder conservar melhor os seus produtos e sonha em um dia construir uma barraca.

Conheceu a Hluvuku graças a mobilização feita pelos gestores da mesma, este é o segundo empréstimo da Isaura na instituição. Já se beneficiado de empréstimo no valor de 5.000,00mt que investiu no negocio, tendo reembolsado sem problemas e compromete-se a continuar a pagar bem para poder aceder a outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Isaura Isaías M. was born in Maputo, Mozambique. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of two. Her children are 15 and 10 years old and both in school. She studied through sixth grade in the old school system and stopped when she became pregnant. She takes care of her two children only.

In 1996 Isaura's husband, who works for the national ministry of defense, was transferred and he, Isaura, and their children left the city of Maputo for Boane. They live in her husband's barracks in the military area of the city.

Isaura is a mobile shrimp vendor. She learned how to conduct this business with friends six years ago. She does not have any employees and works ten-hour days. Now she can buy 10,000 MT (meticais)'s worth of shrimp, which after she sells it, earns her a profit of approximately 5,000 MT. This amount, plus the amount her husband earns, supports the family, and she is able to put some money in a savings account.

With the loan of 10,000 MT Isaura intends to invest in diversification of her products by purchasing squid and crab. Her largest challenge/goal is one day to buy a bigger freezer than her current one, so she can preserve her products better. Her dream is to construct a small home one day.

Isaura learned about Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) through its employees. This is her second loan with the institution. She previously received a loan of 5,000 MT, which she used to invest in her business and which she repaid successfully. She has committed to continuing to pay properly and be able to access future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell shrimp, squid, and crab

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta S. is from the village of Suagarland, Valencia City. She is 57 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Enriqueta sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Enriqueta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Enriqueta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enriqueta is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Patience and industriousness are the guiding values of Laila N.. She is already 38 years of age. She manages a mini food vending business, located along the highway of Sillawit,Cauayan, Isabela. She operates her business before lunchtime and until 4:00 in the afternoon. Her weekly net income is PHP 3,000. Many villagers or passengers of mini buses buy her cooked food. She sells also vegetables and sometimes fruit to have additional income.

Laila budgets their income, but still it is not enough to cover the school tuition for her two children, at the primary level. She decided to request a loan, amounting to PHP 5,000, from KIVA lenders. She will use the loan towards preparing additional food to cook and to purchase some fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that this loan will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor S. is a 40-year-old married man, living with his wife and eight children in Tuol Doun Kam village in Kandal province. Five of his children are enrolled in the local school, while the other children are too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Chea Sae, is pictured in the photograph with him.

He and his wife are farmers; more specifically, they own a plot of land, on which they cultivate rice and lotus. They face an obstacle with their rice-cultivation business in that they do not have sufficient capital to buy farming supplies for growing rice. Thus, Mr. Sor S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline (to pump water to support the rice field).

loans.use: To improve the business by purchasing rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Cesar S. U., Labora como responsable de mantenimiento y limpieza en el Mercado Israel Lewites, el tiene a su cargo un hijos, este se encuentran en edad escolar, es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido  4 créditos en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar S. U., works in cleaning and maintenance at the Israel Lewite Market (Mercado Israel Lewite). He has one school age son. He is single and has had loans with CEPRODEL for 3 years. In this period of time, he has invested 4 loans in making improvements to his home, with help from CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The requested loan is to invest in the purchase of materials for remodeling his home’s roof and to pay for the labor, in order to give his son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of construction materials and the labor costs

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Paz y Bien” se encuentra ubicada en la zona céntrica D. Huaycán, distrito D. Ate, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 10 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace cuatro meses, quienes realizan diversas actividad producción, comercio y servicio.
Reyna Del Carmen quien a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera con tres hijos D. 5,6 y 14 años, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, calzado y juguetes desD. hace 4 años; empezó a raíz D. que se desempeño como vendedora  en un centro comercial, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria Reyna logro comprar su terreno y artefactos para su casa,  cubre los gastos D. luz y agua; ya que el padre D. sus hijos le apoya con la alimentación, salud y educación.
El reciente préstamo Reyna lo utilizara en la compra D. mercadería para la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
The community bank "Paz y Bien" is located in the downtown area of Huaycan, a district of Ate, a suburb of Lima. It consists of 10 partners, working with EDAPROSPO. For the past four months, they have prospered in such work as production, trading and service. Reyna Del Carmen who has taken the role of president is 32 years old and is a single mother with three children of ages 5, 6 and 14 years. She has sold clothes, shoes and toys for the past 4 years. She began by being a saleswoman at the local shopping mall, and with the effort of her daily work, Reyna managed to buy her land and fixtures for her home, and in order to cover the cost of electricity and water, she started this business since the father of her children supported them with food, health and education. With the most recent loan, Reyna used it in to purchase merchandise for the Christmas holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes, shoes, etc. for the Christmas holiday season

loans.name: Myers L.

texts.en:
Myers is married to a nurse with two children. They also care for his wife’s two younger sisters. 

After a vigorous search job, he decided to go into business for himself. Over the past eight years, Myers's business has been growing gradually and he now owns a small liquor store that is located in centre part of the market.

Myers is looking for a loan to pay his children’s school fees and to get more stock for his store.

loans.use: To buy drinks and liquor

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza M. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Flordeliza is separated from her spouse and has two infant children. To make a living, Flordeliza provides beauty services like manicures and pedicures to local community members. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be the second loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides

loans.name: Beldad

texts.es:
Beldad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos menores, que aun depende de ella. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas regionales, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria en un puesto de ventas ubicada cerca a su casa, un lugar amplio y acondicionado para que los clientes se sientan satisfechos.

Lleva 08 años dedicándose a este negocio y hoy en día  cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta de comidas, donde ella los atiende con la amabilidad y carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado.

Con este crédito de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en litros, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Beldad, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener su Restaurant de venta de comida regional de la selva.

Dice: Estar contenta y tranquila con el nuevo producto que se ha implementado en los Bancos Comunales, siendo este el Seguro de Vida ante una muerte natural o un accidente que nadie esta libre, así  su familia no quedara sin los recursos para solventar los gastos que estos casos inesperados ocasionan.
texts.en:
Beldad, 45, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank, which is located in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has two, minor children, who still depend on her. She finished secondary school. She always knew that she cooked regional dishes with good flavor so she decided, upon her own initiative, to invest her first, 300 new sol, loan in a business selling prepared meals from a food stand near home. She equipped the site in such a way that her customers are comfortable and feel satisfied. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and has regular customers that come by her food stand daily to be taken care of with her characteristic kindness and charisma. She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy ingredients, like rice, sugar, cooking oil, chickens, and also some kitchen utensils to provide better customer service. She is ready for anything and feels strong to continue working to succeed. Beldad is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business. Her goal is to have a restaurant selling the regional dishes of the backcountry region. She states that she is happy and care-free with the new product that the Communal Bank has implemented, i.e. the Life Insurance Policy for natural or accidental death, from which no one is exempt, so that her family will not be without resources to cover costs such an unexpected occurrence entails.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals preparation.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is a young mother blessed with a young child who is not yet enrolled in school. She has a partner in her husband, who works driving a taxi for income. C. currently works as part of the massage staff in a club located in Siem Reap province, earning a specific salary of $90 per month. 

C. always finds it hard travelling to work because she doesn’t have a vehicle. She hopes to own a motorcycle but she has no money to buy one. Recently she was encouraged by her nearby neighbor to pursue a loan via HKL. So she decided to apply for a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a new motorcycle which will enable her to ride to her work location.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Camino Seguro Group

texts.es:
CARMEN, TIENE 47 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA, TIENE 3 HIJOS YA MAYORES D. EDAD. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "CAMINO SEGURO" JUNTO CON NUEVE PERSONAS MAS, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. SU GRUPO. ELLAS RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.APRECIAMOS A LA SRA. CARMEN SENTADA AL LADO DERECHO D. LA FOTOGRAFIA.

HACE TRES AÑOS, CARMEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CEVICHE EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILIO Y A LA VEZ REPARTE MENÚ A PEDIDO. 

ANTE LA NECESIDAD D. APOYAR A SUS HIJOS QUE ESTABAN ESTUDIANDO, INICIÓ A TRABAJAR REPARTIENDO MENÚ A LOS TRABAJADORES D. LA EMPRESA DOND. LABORABA SU HIJA Y POCO A POCO FUÉ AUMENTANDO SU CLIENTELA. Y LOS FINES D. SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CEVICHE.

CON EL INGRESO D. AMBOS NEGOCIOS PUED. CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR Y HA IDO AUMENTANDO SU CAPITAL, POR LO QUE EN ÉSTA OPORTUNIDAD EL CRÉDITO QUE HA SOLICITADO MÁS LO QUE HA PODIDO AHORRAR LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA APERTURA D. UNA BODEGA QUE INSTALARÁ EN SU CASA.
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, is single and has three adult children. She is a member of the “Camino Seguro” (Secure Path) group along with 9 other people who chose her has group president. They all resiD. in Comas district. Carmen can be seen seated on the right siD. of the photo. Three years ago, Carmen began to sell ceviche (marinated fish dish) from her home; she also prepares meals on order that she home delivers. In order to support her children, who were in school at the time, she started delivering meals to the employees of the firm where her daughter worked. Gradually, her customer base grew and she sells ceviche on weekends. With income from both businesses she is able to meet household expenses and she has been increasing her capital. On this occasion, she will use the funds from the loan plus some savings she has to set up a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in setting up a grocery store.

loans.name: Bebe Najeeba Group

texts.en:
Sohila is the group leader of the Bebe Najeeba group. She lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with three children who are 12, 8 and 4. She does embroidery work. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years and is quite famous for her work in the neighborhood. 

She needs the loan to purchase required materials for her business and to expand her business as well. She would like to say that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: To expand and progress her business

loans.name: Berenilda Edelmira

texts.es:
Berenilda es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector La Portada de la Sierra, en el distrito de San José, provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral en su vivienda, ella cría patos, pavos, gallinas y cuyes para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad para su familia ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como obrero de construcciín civil no son suficientes para solventar la economía familiar.

Berenilda ha ido esforzándose y su negocio ha crecido poco a poco, con las ganancias que ha venido percibiendo ella ha estado implementado una pequeña bodega en su casa con lo que espera percibir nuevas ganancias que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para seguir creciendo y expandiéndose como empresaria por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo.

Berenilda es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que gusta de mucho de trabajar arduamente para ayudarlos a progresar, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior para que se asegure un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Berelinda, age 38, lives with her husband and her son in the sector La Portada de la Sierra, in the district of San José of the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she was very young, Berelinda has been raising and selling barnyard fowl and small farm animals. She grows ducks, turkeys, chickens, and guinea pigs in order to later sell them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. This business is very useful for Berelinda's family since the income from her husband's job as a construction worker is not sufficient to cover family expenses. Berelinda has worked very hard, and little by little she was able to grow her business. With the profits received from the business, she has been setting up a small grocery shop in her house. She hopes that the shop will bring additional income that would allow her to improve the conditions for her family. Berelinda would like to expand her livestock business in order to keep moving forward and grow as an entrepreneur. This is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan in the amount of 1500 soles. She plans to invest the funds into the purchase of additional animals and balanced animal feed which would allow her to achieve her goals. Berelinda is a woman who is very devoted to her family; she enjoys working hard to help her family make progress. Her greatest wish is provide her son with an opportunity to go to college so that he could have a successful future.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small farm animals and animal feed to expand livestock business

location.town: Portada de la Sierra - San José - Pacasmayo - La L

loans.name: Jeanet

texts.es: LA SRTA. JEANET VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR DE SUS PAPAS , PRESTA SERVICIOS, COMO PELUQUERA Y OTROS. LA CLIENTE ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA  LO CUAL SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA APERTURAR SU PROPIO  SALON DE BELLEZA EN SU DOMICILIO Y COMPRAR LOS MATERIALES QUE NECESITA, ES SOLTERA, AHORRO YA ALGO DE DINERO CON EL DESEO DE ABRIR SU PROPIO SALON, Y EMPRENDER LE ESTA DANDO LA OPORTUNIDAD CON EL PRESTAMO OTORGADO, ES MUY TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PREOCUPADA POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE ES LA UNICA QUE MANTIENE EL HOGAR, OTRO DE US DESEOS ES DE SEGUIR ACTUALIZANDOSE EN EL CAMPO DE LA PELUQUERIA YA QUE SIEMPRE HAY NOVEDADES POR TEMPORADAS, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jeanet lives with her parents in their home. She provides hair styling and other related services. Her customers are low-income, humble and unassuming. She is asking for funds in order to open a beauty salon in her home and to buy the necessary supplies and materials she needs. She’s single and has already saved up some of the funds she needs to open her own salon and Emprender is giving her the opportunity with this loan. She is very hard-working, always watchful of her family’s wellbeing since she is the home’s only source of support. Another of her dreams is to continue updating her skills as a stylist because there are always new things each season. She is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Me gusta el negocio de la comida y quisiera seguir prosperando al tener mayor cantidad de materia								
prima. Gracias a ustedes esto podría ser posible, con su apoyo podre comprar mas productos para la 

elaboración de distintos platillos.

Dios bendiga su trabajo y a todas las personas detrás de esta noble empresa.
texts.en:
I like my business selling food and would like to continue developing it by purchasing a supply of staple ingredients. Thanks to you, this will be possible. With your help, I will be able to purchase what I need to make a variety of dishes. May God bless your work and everyone behind this noble organization.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marie-Josée

texts.fr: H. Marie-Josée est née le 1er mars 1963 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Marie-Josée vit avec son mari ADJAGBA Philippe, un brodeur. Marie-Josée à trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à la charge du couple. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Marie-Josée a fait les cours primaires. Depuis sept ans, Marie-Josée mène comme activité, la vente de viande d'agoutit à Allada, ce qui lui permet d'apporter une aide  à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales. Marie-Josée s'approvisionne à Houègbo au Bénin. Marie-José avait bénéficié d'un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but d'accroitre son capital et d'augmenter son stock de produits, pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Marie Josée sollicite un second prêt auprès de ALIDé. Marie-Josée envisage plus tard acquérir une parcelle et construire sa maison.
texts.en:
Marie-Josee H. was born on 1 March 1963 in Allada in the Atlantique Province. Marie-Josee lives with her husband Philip ADJAGBA, an embroiderer. Marie-Josee has three children who have attended school, two of which are at home. The couple works together to meet the needs of the family. Marie-Josee finished elementary school. For seven years, Marie-Josée has been selling agoutis meat in Allada, which allows her to help her husband meet the family needs. Marie-Josee gets her product at Houègbo in Benin. Marie-Jose got a first loan from ALIDé and it was fully repaid. Marie Josee is seeking a second loan from ALIDé to increase her capital and increase her inventory to better meet customer demand.
