In the future, Marie-Josee plans to acquire a plot of land and build a house.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the meat of 8 agoutis

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita C., 44, a resident of Dasmariñas, Philippines. She is married to Ponciano C., a serviceman, and the proud mother of a teenage boy, now on his last few years of college education for a Bachelor of Science in Nursing. It is truly a dream come true for Mercedita as she herself possesses a college diploma and believes it is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Mercedita operates a variety store where she sells not only groceries but LPG (Liquefied Petroleum Gas) for fuel and cosmetics from the popular direct selling brands. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) of cooking oil, or an egg. Juanita earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate. Mercedita’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedita dreams to be able to continue giving her son a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to be able to help her community by serving them through her business.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz G., 43 years old, is a married woman who supports her family with her machine shop business. She lives in Barangay Tangke, Medellin, Cebu Province with her 49-year-old husband, Teopisto, and their eight children who are from 6 to 23 years old with six of them currently going to school.

Paz has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her machine shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Paz is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her machine shop. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan which also amounted to Php 19,500, was paid off well within its term, helped her sustain her machine shop's operations. It was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Paz aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

Paz is shown in the accompanying picture amidst the many metal parts that are used in the normal course of operations of her machine shop.

 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her machine shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and bread, and she is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish and some tomatoes to sell. She is 47 years old and is widowed.  She has 7 children, and only 2 children out of the 7 go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish and some tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: kossi exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de produits génériques, il fait ce commerce depuis 2008, il exerce cette activité dans un petit cabine qu'il a nommé "Ets MAWULI".il est célibataire et  c'est grâce à ce commerce qu'il subvient à ses charges. il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un prêt qu'il a bien remboursé. Il sollicite un deuxième prêt pour se réapprovisionner en achetant divers produits génériques.
texts.en:
Kossi has a revenue-generating retail business involving generic products.  He has been working at it since 2008 and operates out of a small booth he has named "Ets MAWULI".  He is unmarried, and thanks to this business, he supports himself.  Kossi has already obtained a loan from WAGES that he has repaid.  He is requesting a second loan to stock up again by buying a variety of generic products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying generic products

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a hardworking farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been operating his mixed farm for the last 15 years. His main products are maize, beans, coffee, tea and sugarcane, which he sells to the local market and other institutions. He also earns income from his construction services.

Robinson has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will go towards the education of his children and the health of his family. He will also be able to improve the nutrition of his family since they will have enough milk for consumption.

Robinson is 38 years old and married with three children who are now between the ages of 6 and 13. All the children attend school.

His major challenges are lack of enough capital for expansion, diseases and lack of market. He is requesting more financial support to fight poverty and improve the living standards of the less fortunate.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosebell Anyango

texts.en:
Rosebell K., 34 years old and married to Christopher Atata, is the mother of six children, all in school They live in Migori town.

Rosebell sells used clothing in the open air market in Migori town. In this business for the last 10 years, she has created a huge clientèle, especially among those people who come to shop at the market. She makes an average of Kshs 30,000 per month. Rosebell is now applying for her fourth loan, having repaid her previous ones. She intends to use the money to buy some bales of used clothes to add to her stock.

Her future hopes include building a permanent structure for her business and ensuring that her children get the best education possible.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Bébé

texts.fr:
Commercante agee de 39 ans,Veuve et mere de 4 ans dont lâge varie entre 3 et 24 ans.Elle s'est lancée dans cette activite depuis l'an 2000,elle gere une chambre froide ou l'on trouve les differents produits dont ses clients ont besoin,ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille et toute la scolarite des ses enfants.Ses recettes journalières sont de 200000 à 300000.

Avec le financement qu'elle va recevoir elle compte satisfaire les besoins de ses potentiels clients, s'approvisionner en produits  de  qualite comme la viande fraiche, les differentes varietes de poulets frais et fumes, saucissons,aile de poulet et poissons qui sont tres demandes par ceux ci.

Pour l'élargissement de son activite, elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et très rigoureuse dans ses choix.
pour ses perspectives d'avenir , elle pense etre grossiste un jour, importer plus pour faire des grandes benefices .

Tres entreprenante, avec un fort esprit d'initiative elle pense aller loin tout en ameliorant les conditions de vie de sa famille .Elle fait preuve d'un bon temoignage dans son quartier.
texts.en:
This shopkeeper is a 39-year-old widow and mother of four children, ages 3 to 24. She started this business in 2000. She has a cold room where she stores the various products that her customers require. This activity allows her to support her family and pay for her children’s tuition. Her daily revenue varies from 200,000 to 300,000 francs. Her loan will enable her to meet the needs of potential customers. She will stock up on quality products such as fresh meat, a selection of fresh and smoked chicken, sausages, chicken wings and fish, which are in high demand. She will expand her business using good management skills and making rigorous choices. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and import more, thereby increasing her profits. A very enterprising woman with a strong sense of initiative, she expects to go far while improving her family’s living conditions. She enjoys a good reputation around her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cartons of chicken thighs, fish, meat, chicken wings

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

La señora Petra lleva en el Banco Comunal 15 años, es socia fundadora, le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido por parte de la institución y por la comunicación que existe con sus compañeras. Tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo tres hijos todos ya mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en un garaje.

Ella junto con un hermano tiene un gabinete de belleza en  la ciudad de Montecristi, trabaja desde las 9am hasta las 18h00, realizan una gran cantidad de trabajos y además venden productos de belleza y de dieta,  dice que les va muy bien porque su negocio está bien ubicado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear la mitad para su negocio para comprar tintes,  cremas, esmaltes, etc. Y el resto para poner unos rieles metálicos en el techo de su casa que es de madera y ya están apolillados y se pueden romper.
 
Su meta es tener su casa con una buena losa de hormigón y terminada por completo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas (United Women) meets in San Alejo, the beautiful capital of Portoviejo, Manabi province, known for its lovely beaches up and down the coast that are very popular with both international and national tourists alike.

Mrs. Petra has been in the communal bank for 15 years.  She is one of the founders and she likes the benefits that she receives from the institution as well as the understanding that exists among the members.  She is 57, and in a common law marriage.  She has 3 adult children, 2 that live with her and her husband works in a garage.

She and her brother have a beauty salon in the city of Montecristi.  She works from 9 am to 6 pm, taking care of many customers.  She also sells beauty and diet products and she says that the business is doing very well because of its good location.

She will use half of this loan to buy hair dyes, creams, nail polish, etc, and the rest will be used to purchase metal rails for the roof of her house.  The roof is made of wood and is infested with powder post beatles and it can fall.

Her dream is to have a complete house built on a concrete slab.

loans.use: To buy hair dye, creams, nail polish, etc and metal rails for her roof

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Sorie Kamara. He is married, and has three children who are 9, 10, and 16 years old. 

In 1991, Sorie established his wood and palm oil business. He began his business to generate income and facilitate his children's education. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business and is very hardworking. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Sorie requires a loan in order to buy seven trips of wood and 22 rubbers of palm oil.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  In the future, Sorie plans to build a house for his family and continue educating his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more items such as palm oil and wood for his stall

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.ar:
محمود عمره 41 سنة متزوج ولديه اربعة اولاد يعمل في مجال الادوات الصحية يعمل لحسابه الخاص يسعى لتطوير نفسه وعائلته من خلال تأمين  مدخول يساعد على العيش الكريم 
 يحب عائلته  وعمله له في مصلحته اكثر من 20 عام يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة ان يزيد مدخول مصلحته وشراء بضاعة جديدة للمصلحة بسب نقص المعدات اللازمة للعمل زبائنه 
من اصدقاءه ومحيطه  يريد التطور وتأمين عمل خاص به يتميز بألتزامه
texts.en: Mahmoud is a 41-year-old husband and father of four who is self-employed in the field of bathroom supplies and who hopes to further advance himself and his family by securing an income that will enable them to live in dignity. The applicant loves both his family and his work, which he has been involved in for more than twenty years. Through the loan to be provided by Al Majmoua, Mahmoud hopes to acquire new merchandise and equipment to better serve his customers (comprising his friends and other colleagues) with distinction.

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise and equipment.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old and is a father of 6, aged between 14 and 2.  He is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya.  He has been doing mixed farming, producing milk, eggs, and tomatoes.  All his products are sold locally.  He has been in farming for 8 years.

He has requested this loan of 31,200 KES to purchase a dairy cow and had acquired one previously.  He hopes the loan will make life better for the family by improving his income.  He plans to have 5 dairy cows in 5 years time.

George has no other source of income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena C. E. de 59 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a dos hijos, uno de los cuales trabaja como comerciante ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, quien siempre se ha esforzado por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus hijos por años dependieron únicamente de ella, María posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual se encuentra en su casa de habitación. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con la ilusión de mejorar su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de golosinas, pan, detergentes y otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas. Estas ganancias serán de gran beneficio para ella debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee para solventar sus gastos personales, tales como alimentación y vestuario.
texts.en: María Elena C. E. is 59 years old. She lives in the Ilopango municipality, where she lives together with her 2 children, one of whom works as a travelling salesman. María is a very hard-working person who has always strived to improve her family's situation, as for several years her children have depended solely on her. María has a shop selling grocery items, which is located in her home. She is seeking a loan from Integral with the plan of improving her business, purchasing a greater quantity of lollies, bread, detergents and other products, which are of necessity for the home and for people. These earnings will be of great benefit to María as they are the only source of income that she has to cover her personal costs, such as food and clothing.

loans.use: Purchase grocery products

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly C. is a married woman who lives in San Roque, Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig-fattening and dress-making businesses. Her husband Demetrio C., who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 14 children who are between 17 and 35 years old. 

Beverly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Beverly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to pay as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. Beverly C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund her business operations

loans.name: Paustine

texts.en:
Paustine C. is a 41-year-old single mother supporting four children: Duncan Kiprono 15, Edwin Kiplagat 11, Timothy Kipchumba 10, and Victor Kimutai two. She runs a busines selling milk and green vegetables and also maize farming. She has been in business for three years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 10,400. She is borrowing a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase milk, vegetable and maize seeds to plant, and ploughing.

This is Paustine's second loan, having repaid the first one well and on time. Her hope and dream is to be able to purchase a pick-up truck to expand her business and to have additional income for school fees and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 21 years old. Cheryl is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she is a dealer, selling cosmetics and beauty products from AVON and NATASHA in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like lotions and cosmetics. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like lotions and cosmetics

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín tiene 26 años, vive con su mama en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a L. venta D. animales, su padre le enseñó  a reconocer  a los animales en buen estado para garantizar una buena inversión y este conocimiento lo ha ido perfeccionando a lo largo D. los años. Actualmente tiene ovejas, y cada día los lleva a pastar en las alturas D. su pueblo, ya que hay diversas llanuras, llenas D. pastos. Cada fin D. semana los venD. directamente en L. feria ganadera, el ganado vacuno que adquiere lo venD. y revenD. inmediatamente. Considera que este negocio es rentable por lo que desea incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Es su crédito numero 2  con MFP, esta muy contento D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más animales.
texts.en: Efraín is 26 years old and lives with his mother in his own house. Since he was a child, he has sold animals. His father taught him to recognize healthy animals in order to guarantee a good investment. This knowledge he has perfected, as he has grown older. Actually, he has sheep and each day he brings the sheep to graze in the highlands above his village. There are many plains nearby, full of grass. Each weekend he sells the sheep himself at the cattle market. If he buys vicuña (a small, llama-like animal) he sells it immediately. He thinks this business is profitable, that is why he wishes to increase his working capital. This is his second loan with MFP. He is very happy to have financial support. He has always been responsible with his payments. Also, he is grateful to the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. He is grateful for the people that proviD. him with this loan that he is requesting, as it will be very helpful with his business. With this loan that he is requesting, he will buy more animals.

loans.use: He will buy more animals such as vacuña and sheep.

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Meraluna owns and operates a business raising livestock. Her main source of income comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Meraluna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Meraluna is pictured here with her youngest son.

Meraluna joined HSPFI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Meraluna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Meraluna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and supplies

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rufino Mercedes

texts.es: El Sr Z. labora como albañil  es acompañado, tiene cuatro persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia  la oportunidad de  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción de cinz, perlines, para reparación de techo ya que se encuenta en mala condicion, por el invierno que ya se acerca, gracia a dios existe esta microsfinanciera para poder tener un nivel del vida mejor para su familia, porque el salario no lo ajusta para esta condiciones y mejora de vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Z. works as a Bricklayer.   He has a life partner and four dependents.  This is his first CEPRODEL loan.  He expresses his thanks for this disbursement to improve his house buying building materials like: zinc metal sheeting and purlines to repair the roof that’s in bad condition due to the approaching winter.

Thank God that this microfinance institution exists so that his family can have a better standard of living because his salary is insufficient to meet these conditions and carry out these home improvements.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Beatriz Cecilia

texts.es:
Desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 p.m. la tienda de Beatriz Cecilia P. V. abre las puertas para sus vecinos que encuentran allí una amplia oferta de productos para la canasta familiar y aunque la jornada laboral de esta emprendedora es bastante larga afirma con gran seguridad que es esta dedicación la que le permite salir adelante con su hijo, pues el ser madre soltera la ha obligado a trabajar fuertemente para llevar los gastos del hogar. 

Beatriz necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas mejoras en su local y comprar más surtido con el fin de mejorar cada vez más su negocio y ampliarlo hasta convertirse en una tienda reconocida.
texts.en:
Beatriz Cecilia P. V. opens the doors of her store to her neighbors from 7am to 11pm and offers a wide range of everyday products. Even though the working day is long, this entrepreneur says with great certainty that her dedication allows her son to get ahead. Beatriz is a single mother who is obligated to work hard in order to cover the household expenses.

She needs a loan to make a few improvements to her store and buy more merchandise in hopes of improving her business each day. Beatriz also wants to expand her business so that it will become a well-known establishment.

loans.use: To make improvements to her store and purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Mekhak

texts.en: Mekhak A. is a minibus driver between three villages in the Syunik region. The bad roads badly affect the bus. To insure the bus runs safely, Mekhak needs to make some car repairs. Once that is done Mekhak is planning to expand his business by adding more villages to his service map. The additional income in Mekhak’s family with two children is really needed. Mekhak’s service will positively affect the village people, helping them reach their destinations safely, and on time.

loans.use: to pay for car repairs

loans.name: Zulfiya's Group

texts.en:
Zulfiya Abdurokhmonova, 39, is the leader of this group. She has resided in Aravan for her whole life, a town with a small population and very few employment opportunities. Eleven years ago, right after giving birth to her last son, she laid the foundation for the upcoming business initiative of farming and cattle breeding. Being inspired by more experienced entrepreneurs in the neighborhood, she gathered a small amount of money, saved by her and her husband, that became a potential investment in her business. 

Zulfiya’s children go to school, while her husband is employed in a local construction company. She enjoys inventing new techniques of cultivating land and effective methods of raising cattle. There’s a saying that a man should accomplish three main things in life: plant a tree, build a house and raise a son. Zulfiya’s husband has performed all three, mainly thanks to this family business that they’ve been running for eleven years already. 

Zulfiya hopes to add the acquired loan to her monthly income of about $44 in order to purchase cattle and food for it. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Shijirbaatar

texts.en:
Shijirbaatar B., 25, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughters haven't reached school age, so they stay home, and his wife, age 25, is a student. 

He manages an Internet and PC game business near his home. He started his business in 2006 after his graduation. At first he opened his PC game place with 10 computers installed with the help of his wife. Since then he has managed to stabilize his business and has built a strong customer base. 

He has been managing his business for four years and has gained much experience. His business has been quite successful, which has allowed him to buy a mini-truck which he uses in a coal-trading business during winter time. 

He is planning to expand his business and improve his working place in the future. He is an open-minded man who says, "I am planning to renew the processors of my business in order to attract more customers." 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase new processors for his PC game business and to buy a mini-bus in order to start a transportation business between Ulaanbaatar city and the countryside area of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase new processors for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Kirehe Kwetungura Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Annah B. is the leader of Kirehe Kwetungura group B in Kihihi. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Annah has had a retail shop in Kirehe for 6 years where she sells posho, beans, soap, jelly and so many other items. Her main customers are neighbors and people in the community. She is able to generate 120,000 UGX weekly. Annah also sells tea leaves since she has a tea plantation and it is from the tea sales that she got her capital. 

Annah is very hard-working and her dream is to have a wholesale shop and provide a high quality education for her children. Over the years, the loans have helped her to increase sales due to her ability to purchase more stock. Annah needs this loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.

loans.use: to restock her shop with more goods

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Shamim has a business of a small hotel that sells food, which she has had for eight years.         

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shamim hopes to pay for her house rent.  Shamim is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to gain new friends.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and resell.

loans.name: Frecil

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Frecil works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from vegetable farming.  Frecil is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production and vending business.

Frecil has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
This is Aurea, 50, a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Samson, a supervisor. She has three children; the oldest is in high school, while the other two are in grade school.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Aurea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Aurea earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Aurea hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 32-year-old. has three children, two of whom are in school,she has been in this business of selling fish for two years she request a loan from BRAC south sudan to expand her business.she will use her profits to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: She want more income to able her purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Kiira Womens Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Resty found her bearings in a Pub Business five years ago in Lugazi. Resty, who is a mother to four, was prior to this mostly inclined to subsistence farming.  She still regards the day she set forth in this business as a watershed moment. Watershed in the sense that she has been able to better her family's standard of living with earnings from her business transactions. Before this, she was mostly relying on a small income from food sales.  

The Pub business has been paying dividends though she says she still has a lot of leeway to make up if she is to notch up more success in this enterprise. The Pub business is highly competitive and one needs to restock constantly with a variety of hard and soft beverages to meet the growing demands of clients. Her business has the potential to make headway in leaps and bounds provided she stays focused.

This business is one of the most lucrative businesses in the country at the moment and Resty knows hard work and the further revamping of her services and facilities will help a lot. 

She carried out some refurbishment on her facilities late last year and the upshot was increased partiality to her services. That was, however, short lived as the operating costs shot up. Because she was paying more for rent, she was hard pressed in restocking with the best beverages that her clients ask for.  However, she managed to take that in her stride. Monthly she says her gross sales profits total up to Ugandan shillings 200,000. Resty says she is requesting this Kiva loan to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages like sodas and beers to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages like sodas and beer to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to develop his vetrinary clinic

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Elvis de 43 años y sus 02 queridos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. María mujer de arduas labores que cumplir, por ello se despierta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia para luego dirigirse a abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores, La tienda de abarrotes de María es una de las más visitadas por el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras sabiendo de la gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad lo encontraran en la tienda de María. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado comprará más provisiones para su tienda. Más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la más preferida y concurrida de su comunidad. Este será su segundo crédito y necesita el apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por ser parte de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mas mercaderías como sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, is a happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Elvis, 43, and their 2 dear children, to whom they want to give a better quality of life. Maria has a lot of hard work to do, so she gets up very early to make food for her family and then opens the doors to her business to await her first customers. Maria's grocery stO. is one of the most popular because of her charisma and friendliness that has made her preferred by many of her neighbors. They know that they will find everything they need at Maria's stO. because of her large variety of products. 

What she likes most about her job is chatting with her customers. She has been doing this for 10 years, and considers the most difficult aspect to be having to stay on her feet all day long. 

With the help of the requested loan she will buy mO. provisions for her stO.. Later she hopes that her business will grow and become the most popular in her community. This will be her 2nd loan and she needs the support of the lenders to move forward with her proposal. She promises to meet her payments punctually and is thankful to be part of her village bank. 

With the loan requested, she will buy mO. merchandise like sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned goods and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks for rice, sugar and noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Afandina

texts.fr:
Afandina est une femme agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est chauffeur. Elle a deux enfants,
Afandina travaille comme revendeuse de poissons fumés depuis 1981. Elle achète et revend ses poissons à ses clients dans la ville de Lomé. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite est son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Afandina, 43, is married to a driver. She has two children. 

Afandina has worked at selling smoked fish since 1981. She buys and re-sells her fish to her customers in the local market of Atikpodji. This is her second loan. She buys her merchandise in Lomé.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Jazmina

texts.es: Jazmina tiene 23 años, es una joven madre de familia que vive con su familia y su pequeño hijo en una casa arrendada. Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de animal porcino durante cinco años, en donde los adquiere cuando están pequeños y al cabo de un tiempo están grandes y gordos, ideales para la venta en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Jazmina se levanta cada mañana temprano para darles de comer y al día los alimenta 3 veces a fin de poder el peso que se requiere, ya que cuanto más grandes y gordos es más el precio que se paga por ellos. En adelante desea vender mayor cantidad de cerdos y para ello ampliará el espacio de su establo para poder acoger a todos. Es la tercera oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia de créditos que le ha permitido mejorar su economía e implementar su negocio de la cual esta muy agradecida. Con el dinero que solicita, incrementará su capital de trabajo ( osea comprar más cerdos).
texts.en: Jazmina is 23. She is a young mother who lives with her family and small child in a rented home. She has sold pigs for five years. She gets them when they are small, and once they are big and fat they are ideal for selling in the local livestock market. Jazmina gets up early every morning to feed her animals. She feeds them three times a day in order to get them to the required weight, because the bigger and fatter they are the better the price she gets for them. In the future she wants to sell more hogs, so she will expand her stable in order to be able to fit them all. This is her third loan with MFP and she says that she has had a good experience, as the loans have allowed her to improve her income and stock her business. For this she is very grateful. With the requested loan, she will increase her working capital (buying more hogs).

loans.use: to buy hogs.

loans.name: Amira Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Amira, la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa, la socia compra por fardos ropa americana desde la frontera de Chile con Perú y trae para la venta  todos los días sábados, la socia tiene un stand pequeño el cual alquila para exhibir su ropa, la socia desea invertir el crédito para el viaje y para comprar dos fardos de ropa surtida. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa americana por fardos.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Amira, 35, is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank located in San Jerónimo District in Cusco Province and Department.

She’s single and has two children.  She is a clothes merchant.  She buys bundles of American clothes on the border between Chile and Perú and brings them to sell every Saturday.  She rents a small stand to exhibit her clothes.  She wants to use the loan to invest in the trip and to buy two bundles of assorted clothes.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of bundles of American clothes.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and at the same time commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy bundles of Amercian clothes.

loans.name: Busakala West Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Busakala West Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Joseph is the group facilitator. He takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting twenty bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest nine bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, repair his home and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Busakala West Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Joseph is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Tim is a 56-year-old woman who resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has a life partner in her husband who is a fisherman in the  local area. They are blessed with six children, two are already married and live apart. 

Tim has been involved in a fish selling business for many years. She takes fish that are caught by her husband to sell through the village. She wants to expand this business successfully and maximize her profit but it mainly depends on her husband catching fish. Therefore, Tim has requested a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to buy fishing materials such as a machine boat, fishing net, poles, lines and hooks to support her husband’s daily work. She hopes that this loan will help her family establish a better standard of living. With the increase in income, she’ll provide her children better opportunities to join the university in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: buy a machine boat, fishing net, poles, lines and hooks

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 26 years old and is a married man with two children aged four and one.  Noel has been a fisherman for five years.  He earns about 10000 PHP through his business.  Noel plans to use his loan to purchase gasoine, plywood, paint, and other materials to renovate his fishing boat.  This will help him to continue earning a living from fishing.  Noel plans to save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gasoine, plywood, paint, and other materials to renovate his fishing boat.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras D. las Colinas” tiene 3 años D. formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, sus integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Ellas se encuentran muy conformes con el comité que lograron formar, ya que les ha sido D. mucha ayuda en los proyectos D. cada una.
La señora Nilda, se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo tipo, venD. desD. camisillas, hasta camisas, pantalones y otros. Por medio D. su sacrificio diario ha logrado ir creciendo D. a poco y abrirse camino en su mini proyecto. Gracias a sus ventas ella pueD. cubrir los gastos diaR. D. la casa y la manutención D. su familia.
Ya que su negocio le es D. mucha ayuda, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra D. remeras, shorts, camisillas, pantalones, polleras, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad D. productos que ofrece a su clientela.
texts.en: The committee "Mujeres Emprendedoras D. las Colinas", translates to "The enterprising women of Colinas".  The group was formed 3 years ago and works with the Paraguayan Foundation.  Its members work in various trades.  They follow the rules of the committee and each one has received support for their respective businesses.   Nilda works selling all kinds of women's clothing, from blouses to pants.    Through her daily sacrifice and hard work she has slowly grown her business.  Thanks to the income she generates from sales, she is able to cover her household costs and support her family.   She would like to continue to invest in her business, and part of this loan will be used to purchase shorts, blouses, pants, jackets and other variety of clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, pants, blouses and other women's clothing

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 and a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past eight years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge because of insecurity in her place of operation.

With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase a blow dryer machine, cosmetics, and threads for her salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer machine, cosmetics, and threads for her salon.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii SHG Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 25 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Joan was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Joan will educate her children and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie, 29, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Clarin in Misamis Occidental province in the Philippines.

Jovie plants, harvests and sells fruit to earn a living. She has done so for the past ten years and now earns 5,000 PHP a month.

Jovie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, Jovie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Los Angeles 2 Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inició gracias a una de las miembros, quien ya había formado parte de otro comité de la zona. La misma contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar su propio comité. Ellas agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya; ya que tendrán nuevas oportunidades  para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar.
La Sra. Zulma es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la costura,  lo que le permite tener un ingreso propio y así colaborar con los ingresos de su casa, es una persona responsable, y trabajadora. Ella nos comenta que siempre esta con mucho trabajo, lo cual la alegra mucho. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a las personas de su barrio también.
Zulma solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, lo cual la ayudará mucho, pues tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed thanks to one of the members, who had already been a member of another group in the area.  She reached out to her neighbors and friends in order to form her own communal bank.  They appreciate the opportunity that the Fundación  Paraguaya is providing them, since they will have new opportunities to start up better businesses, contribute income to their households, and in this way provide their children with a better life.

Zulma is one of the members.  She has a dressmaking business, which allows her to have her own income and in this way contribute to the income of her household.  She is a responsible and hardworking person.  She tells us that she always has a lot of work, and this makes her very happy.  One of her dreams is to be able to continue to grow her business, and in this way help out people in her neighborhood as well.

Zulma requests a loan to buy fabric and thread.  This will help her a lot, because she has a lot of orders and she would like to fill them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to use in her dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 49 years old. He lives in the village of Shilda (East Georgia) with his family: wife Nino and his 70 year old mother. The family earns their living through agricultural activities. In particular, the family has 2 milk cows and 40 sheep. Gela and Nino produce cheese and sell it to local dairy products retailers. Also, they sell lambs at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Gela has requested credit for purchasing 7-8 calves. He will grow them in order to have more milking cows. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. 

Gela plans to save proceeds from the increased income towards the renovation of the house. This will improve the family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves for expansion of the dairy farm.

loans.name: Kikonda S&c Group

texts.en: Jane is a member of Kikonda Savings and Credit where each member guarantees each other in order to access credit. Jane is aged 59, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She grows tea, irish potatoes and maize. She faces hardships of hailstorms, price fluctuations and few workers. She hopes to buy a car to facilitate the transportation of her goods to various markets. Jane needs a loan to buy fertilizers for her tea plantation in order to boost the output.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her tea plantation in order to boost the output

loans.name: Esmelda Esperanza

texts.es: Esmelda, tiene una edad de 23 años, quien realizó sus estudios hasta sexto grado ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando debido a que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirle apoyando. Ella se casó a temprana edad, tiene una hija, y se dedican como fuente de ingresos económicos al cultivo y siembra de café junto a su esposo. La tierra que trabajan juntos fue heredada la cual han trabajado por cuatro años cultivando café ubicado a cien metros de distancia de su casa de habitacion. Como meta Esmelda quiere poder comprar los abonos y demás insumos agrícolas con los que podrá dar la asistencia a sus plantas de café evitando de esta manera la contaminación en las mismas y a la larga la destrucción del producto y trabajo realizado pues tienen dos manzanas cultivadas de café del tipo 90 invirtiendo las ganancias en la compra de más terreno para seguir cosechando cada año y poder heredar a sus hijos en un futuro algo digno. Esmelda solicita crédito a COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, foliares y demás para ayuda para dar una asistencia de calidad a sus cultivos de café pagando al mismo tiempo la mano de obra para hacer un mejor uso en tiempo y aprovechamiento de los mismos.

loans.use: Para compra de insumos agricolas para asistir sus cultivos de café y pagar mano de obra calificada

loans.name: Kisa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Philip. He is 29 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. He is a Member of Kisa SGH which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
He operates a café where he sells things like tea, beans, rice and many more. He is borrowing a KIVA loan to buy more foodstuffs such as flour, cooking fats, rice, sugar and other items. This will enable him sell more and meet his customer’s demands hence more income. He says he will use the income to cater for his family’s basic needs such as food and clothing and pay education fees. 
Philip is happy to KIVA and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and meet customer's demands hence more income to cater for family's basic needs such as food and clothing and paying education fees for his chiildren

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a young woman, kind, responsible, and a very hard worker. She has a son for whom she wants to provide the best she can, and he is the reason why Adela works hard every day on her business, to provide him a better quality of life. Her business has become a family business since her husband and other members of her family have joined her, and they are in the production and sales of blocks of concrete.

Adela requires $200USD for the purchase of raw materials so that they will be able to increase production. She mentioned that during this holiday season the construction and remodelling of homes is at a peak making it an excellent time to sell large quantities of their product.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Adela es una mujer joven, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora; tiene un hijo en su familia al cual quiere ofrecerle lo mejor que ella tiene, por lo que todos los días Adela trabaja muy duro en su negocio para ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Su negocio consiste en la producción y venta de blocks de concreto, además su esposo trabaja en el mismo negocio por lo que este se ha convertido en un negocio familiar donde todos colaboran.

Adela necesita de $200 USD para la compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar su capacidad de producción, ella comenta que en esta época navideña la construcción y remodelación de casas es mayor, por lo que es una excelente temporada para vender grandes cantidades de su producto. Ella y su familia esperan tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita began selling fried foods and fruits when she was very young. She is a very hardworking woman with an enormous desire to get ahead. When she didn’t have what she needed to get by, she decided to begin her business and help out with the family expenses. Margarita has two children who are 10 and 14 years old and she wants to help them continue studying. She needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to buy inventory in order to increase her sales.

You can be a part of the growth of this business. You can make possible a better life for Margarita and her family. Your generosity and warmth will be a great help to this family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Margarita empezó desde muy joven con la venta de fritangas y frutas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y con enormes deseos de salir adelante, al no contar con los recursos necesarios ella decidió emprender su negocio y colaborar con el gasto familiar, Margarita tiene dos hijas, de 10 y 14 años de edad, y quiere ayudarlas a que continúen estudiando. Ella necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas y su utilidad.

Tú puedes formar parte del crecimiento de este negocio, puedes hacer posible una mejor vida para Margarita y su familia, tu generosidad y cariño será de gran ayuda para esta familia.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent A. is a 25-year old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband. She has also trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. Milicent runs this small business of selling bananas adjacent to her home. She has been in this business for the last 4 years .She attributes her success due to hard work, determination, and two previous KMET  loans. Her business income is able to pay for household expenses. Millicent is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase additional stock of raw bananas in bulk and also to buy ripe bananas in small quantities.

loans.use: To increase the stock of bananas for her business

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru:
Inoyat Y. is 39 years old, has a secondary-school education and is married with two children. For the last four years, while her husband is at work and her children are in school, she has sold men’s and children’s clothing.

She started her business by selling children’s clothing, but thanks to careful borrowing from MFI MicroInvest, was able to increase sales, add men’s clothing to her selection and double the value of her business. She has come to us for a loan of $125 to increase her product selection, and to open up a permanent location for her shop.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Ёкубова Иноят 39лет, образование среднее. Замужем имеет двоих детей. Муж работает, дети учатся в школе. Вот уже 4года занимается продажей мужской и детской одежды. Начала свою деятельность с продажи детской одежды. Постепенно после кредитования в «Микроинвест» увеличила товарооборот и добавила в свой ассортимент мужскую одежду. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить ассортимент и приобрести постоянную торговую точку.

loans.use: Increase product selection and open her own shop

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is engaged in selling plastic sandals wholesale. She started her business four years ago by buying the goods she sold on credit from a merchant. Most of her customers are poor retailers from the surrounding villages and Makeni Town. This purchasing on credit did not give Kadiatu much profit as she had to re-pay her loan on a daily basis.

Using her previous loan from SMT, Kadiatu was able to build up her own business capital. She is planning to be the sole wholesaler of plastic sandals in Makeni and capture retail customers from nearby districts and villages. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1050 to purchase goods directly from The Republic of Guinea.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes wholesale from a cheaper supplier

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
LUCY, a 32-year-old widow, supports her two children, ages 16 and 11, in order that they may attend school. Since 2005, Lucy walks from door to door every day selling various clothes, soaps, and toothpaste. At her home, she makes shirts, for which she gets a profit of around $4.50 per shirt. As her customers generally pay her for her products in small installments, it often takes around one week to collect the money for a single tube of toothpaste or bar of soap, costing 91 cents. For clothing, she often is paid at the end of each month, when her customers receive their salaries. Lucy diligently keeps track of all her customers and visits their homes and offices frequently in order to receive her payments.

Previously, Lucy took out a loan of about $91 which she used to buy her merchandise. Having paid this loan back successfully, she now hopes to take out a larger loan to increase her stock.

Lucy belongs to the group Tujikwamue (Swahili for “progressing from one stage to another”), which consists of 25 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 42 year old father of 6 who lives with his family of 8 (himself, his wife and their 6 children) in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. He sells cigarettes in the neighborhood. He is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise for his store so that he can earn enough to continue paying his children's school fees. Mohamad is determined to support his large family.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 31-year-old resident of the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh. He owns a bakery, and has applied for a loan to buy the provisions and supplies he needs to generate more revenues. This is the third time Hussein has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, and we know him to be a hard-working and energetic businessman.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Wida

texts.en: Wida is 37, married, and has two children. Everyday, she goes door-to-door to sell her sandals on credit, earning $4.00 a week. She will use this loan to add to her business capital.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
M. Muhamadi is 46 years old. He and his wife has two children. Muhamadi is a lawyer, currently working in the Environment Department. However, his salary is not sufficient to meet the expenses of the family. Muhamadi owns a farm in which he grows onions. He has been in business for 10 years. Muhamadi managed to make the business profitable generating a stable income for his family.

Muhamadi is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He's requesting $700 for a term of 12 months. Having proved himself as a reliable client Muhamadi promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tabia

texts.en: Tabia is 29 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 2 years old. Tabi  owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: asdfsdf

loans.name: Tanekasu Group

texts.en: Isatu K. is very grateful to Kiva for the loan of $175. Isatu is a group leader, and because of her honesty in repaying her loan on time, SMT, with her approval, recommended other group members for a Kiva loan. The group members sell foodstuffs in the market of Magburaka and have been managing their businesses for more than 3 years. The members use their income to supplement their families' income. They are grateful for the loan program and are requesting a loan of Le. 1,600,000 to increase their inventories.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of rice, onions, peanut butter, palm oil, chili pepper, and salt

loans.name: Pulaloa

texts.en:
Pulaloa T., 55, is married with 10 children. She has many years of experience in her business. She runs a bakery where she makes and sells donuts, pancakes and snacks. She sells to the local community and relatives. She also shops her goods around town 5 days per week.

Pulaloa has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Pulaloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will support her kids at school and her church contributions. Her husband also operates the business.

loans.use: To purchase new stock and equipment for her business, including: a new stove, a set of bowls, a set of chinese pots, cooking oil, sacks of flour, sugar, and baking powder

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta is a single mother, but now her children are all independent. She lives in the San Luis neighborhood in the city of Managua. Doña Vicenta is a woman who, aside from being a wage earner, she has a small business in her home. She sells school supplies and other seasonal items. She started this business with money from her past work, thinking about how to survive in case she was left without a job. Doña Vicenta is improving her home. She will use the loan to put ceramic on the floor of her living room and that way her home will be more confortable and she will see the fruits of her efforts reflected in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Vicenta es madre soltera, pero ya todos sus hijos son independientes a ella. Habita en el barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Managua. Doña Vicenta es una mujer que a parte de ser asalariada, tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación; se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y otros artículos propios de una temporada determinada, este negocio lo inició con dinero de la liquidación de su trabajo pasado, lo hizo pensando en una manera de poder sostener en vista de que se había quedado sin empleo. Doña Vicenta está mejorando su casa de habitación, el préstamo lo usará para poner cerámica al piso de la sala de su vivienda, y así poder ir haciendo su casa más cómoda y ver el fruto de su esfuerzo reflejado en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of Ceramic for the Floor of her Home

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Señora Isidora, socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de relojes, pilas, calculadoras y correas para relojes. El puesto de venta está ubicado en el Jr. Lima c-5, frente al mercado Nº  02 de la ciudad,  también recorre los distritos donde hay ferias y fiestas patronales de los pueblos más cercanos, buscando vender más y aumentar sus ganancias.

Con el préstamo de S/.  2,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará relojes en gran cantidad de diferentes marcas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños, también correas de diferentes colores y tamaños, además comprará accesorios para relojes como brazaletes, pilas de toda marca y calculadoras, etc. para surtir mas el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades y exigencias de los clientes.

Tiene 51 años y 1 hijo, el cual aún dependen de ella. Es una mujer decidida, positiva y muy trabajadora. Está contenta porque apoya en la economía de su hogar y su meta es tener un local con vitrinas para mostrar sus productos y evitar el polvo.
texts.en:
Isidora, a member of the Community Bank 'Nuestra Senora de la Paz' (Our Lady of Peace), lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. For 8 years she has sold watches, batteries, calculators and watch straps. Her stall is in the Jr. Lima c-5 in front of the market No 2 of the city, and she also goes round the districts where there are different fetes and saints' festivals in the nearest towns, looking to sell more and increase her earnings.

With the loan of $2000 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will bulk buy watches of different makes and models for women, men and kids. She will also buy different colored watch straps of different sizes as well as buying accessories for watches like bracelets, all makes of battery and calculators etc to stock out her business more and meet the needs and demands of her clients.

She is 51 years old and has 1 son who depends on her. She is a very dedicated, positive and hard working woman. She is happy because she can help out with her home's finances, and her aim is to have a store with windows to show off her products and avoid dust.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bulk buy different makes and models of watch for men and women/Compra de relojes en cantidad en diferentes modelos y marcas para caballeros y damas.

loans.name: Karomatullo

texts.en: M. Karomatullo is 42 years old. He is married with four children. Karomatullo is selling food stuff like cookies, preserved food, tea, soft drinks and different kinds of detergent in the market. He has been in this business already for 18 years. Karomatullo is very polite and his trading place is very popular with the locals. This business generates the main income for the family. Karomatullo requests 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 10 months to keep growing his business and increase the variety of products that he offers. This purchase will enable him to increase his sales and to earn more and improve his family's living condition. Karomatullo thanks everyone for supports and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: to purchase the foodstuff to enlarge the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Karleta's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Karleta V.. She is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Karleta is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. She has 2 children and they go to school. Each week, Karleta makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Karleta is joined in her small group by R. Akongo, Judita I., Dudu J., and Ihiju P.. R. Akongo has a business selling bed sheets at the market and wants to expand her business. Judita I. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Dudu J. operates a business selling simsim and wants to expand the business. Ihiju P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expanding their small businesses

loans.name: Tania Doris

texts.en:
Tania is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank. She is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband; they are currently expecting their first child. Tania and her husband bake bread in her in-laws’ oven in the Santa Elena neighborhood. The couple has 6 employees, four of whom work at night and two of whom work during the day. The couple uses their car to transport the bread to different neighborhood stores to sell.

Tania needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy flour and lard. Tania dreams of owning her own bakery, of buying another larger car, and of expanding the business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Tania es conviviente, tiene 24 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Tania junto a su esposo se dedican a L. elaboración D. panes, actividad que realizan en el horno D. sus suegros que se ubica en el barrio D. Santa Elena, cuentan con L. ayuda D. 6 personas, 4 personas durante L. noche y 2 durante el día, sus productos los comercializan en las diferentes tiendas D. su barrio, para lo cual cuentan con un carro.

Tania necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. harina, manteca. Tania sueña con tener una panadería propia, comprar otro carro granD. y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy flour and lard

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Oeurn Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of thirteen members is located in Aleng village in Kampong Chhnang province, and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sam Oeurn P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer. She owns a small store in her house and she now has a lot of customers so demand is high. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more good-quality groceries for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Phoeng Samnang, is a fried Chinese noodle seller. Mrs. Sam Oeurn P. is 36 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a driver while the others are attending the local school.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eleven members have end-of-term loan and the rest of have monthly payment loans. The EoT-loan members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more good-quality groceries for her inventory

loans.name: Nogiomwan

texts.en:
Nogiomwan I. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in the business of selling clothes, bags and shoes for a long time.

She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell so she can expand her business. She says thanks to everyone who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Delia es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Delia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que queda a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Delia compra tuna en su comunidad y luego lo vende en la ciudad de Lima. Además Delia vende comida y bebidas los días domingos en el estadio de su pueblo.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tuna.
Los sueños de Delia son mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Delia is a partner with Banco Comunal Estrella (Star Community Bank). She is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Delia lives in the community of Huayllapampa, 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Delia buys tuna (a type of local fruit) in her community and then she sells it in the city of Lima. Moreover, Delia sells food and drinks on Sundays in the stadium in her town. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325) that she will invest in the purchase of tuna. Delia's dreams are to improve her business and buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tuna (a type of local fruit)

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mr. O. is 39 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. He is single and lives with his mother who raises piglets in the pigpen behind their house. O. has been a local farmer since 1990 and he is a responsible son and neighbor. He has earned a suitable income, for he always harvests three times a year; he also helps out with his mother's pig-raising.

O. is recently facing a difficulty with transportation. So he decided to take a loan of US$ 250 to buy a motorbike for his business and his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his business and his family

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
La sra. Blanca; es socia del banco comunal, ella tiene 68 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, todos ellos casados y con familia propia, excepto su hijo D. 26 años que aún los acompaña. Ella vive en av. Baja 285 en el cercado D. Cusco.

La socia Blanca, comparte entre sus labores del hogar, la administración D. su panadería, que está ubicada en su casa, ella también tiene sus terrenos D. cultivo, ella normalmente siembra, maíz, trigo, cebada; Nuestra socia desea el préstamo para comprar insumos (harina, levadura, entre otros) para la panadería, ella también comprará abono para fertilizar sus tierras.

La sra. Blanca está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado, y se compromete a pagar el préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Communal Bank. She is 68 years old, married and has seven children. They are married and have their own families, except for a 26 years old son, who still lives with her. She lives on Av. Baja 285 in Cusco.

Blanca takes care of her home and bakery located at her house. She also has land and plants corn, wheat and barley.
