The client would like the loan to buy baking ingredients like flour and yeast. She will also buy fertilizer for her land. She appreciates the support given to her and is committed to repay the loan within the agreed time.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients and fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thương  40  tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi b ò. Hiện tại đây vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư mua th êm b ò v ề nu ôi.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi T. is 40 years old. She has 3 children, one of them is still going to school. In 2006, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to have funds investing in raising cows. Currently this is the main source of income for her family, which is about 2,000,000 VND per month (or 117 USD per month). This time she wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 525 USD) to buy more cows for her farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Lanie B., 58, lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occiedental where she and her husband, a farmer, have two children. In order to help her husband while at home, she decided to raise pigs for an additional source of income. She also buys and sells goods such as root crops, vegetables and anything else just to earn a living.

Lanie became a micro entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. This co-op teaches women how to develop their own businesses to support their spouses’ incomes. She has thus far been able to obtain several loans and now is requesting Php 20,000 to buy feed and piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her endeavours.

loans.use: To buy piglets & feed.

loans.name: Rong

texts.en: Rong R. is thirty-two years old and is a construction worker who earns a daily income of $4. He lives with his two young children and his wife, Chheoun Kosal, who is twenty-nine and an accomplished, experienced seamstress and tailor. To improve their standard of living, Rong has decided to take out a loan to buy more fabric for his wife's business, which will generate a higher daily income for the family. He hopes he will be able to open a tailor shop near the market in his own province. He would also like to build a new modern house, and help his children further their education as teachers. (This picture is of Rong's wife.)

loans.use: To buy more fabric for his wife's tailoring business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a woman from the mountainous city of Antipolo in the Province of Rizal, Philippines. She is 47 years old and married to Nandito Lumerio, a carpenter and a hired construction worker. They were blessed with 3 daughters. The eldest daughter Jesamin is 23-year-old and a college graduate. The youngest daughter Joymay is 12-year-old and in elementary grade.

In 2006, Josefina joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap,Inc.) an MFI in the Philippines and a Kiva partner. During her previous loans, she tried a general store but she realizes that there are many general stores now going up on their village. Then she decided to try retailing assorted goods such as smoked and dried fish, among many others.

Now in her 6th loan, she is requesting the amount of 35,000 Philippine Pesos to be used as additional capital in her primary business, retail. Now, she will be retailing, fishes, rice and dried fish. She is hopeful that the business will bring them enough profit so they can sustain the needs of her family.

Not having a house of their own, she dreams of building a safer and more durable house on her own lot. As for her business, she dreams of having a rickshaw someday to be used in the easy transportation of her goods for retail.

loans.use: To buy fish and rice for resale

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna started her fish sales 20 years ago in the community where she lives. She takes delivery of fish from the Kumasi and Yeji. She believes this will help her get affordable prices. Susanna has a store in the community market where she sells the fish. Her smoked fish tastes very good, attracting customer to buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that (customers) travels from the surrounding communities to buy her fish. They buy from her both the fresh ones and the smoked ones. She is now 45 years old, married and the mother of seven children. Currently six are in school and one is learning hairdressing. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish to upgrade her inventory. Susanna belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame neme Boafo’ which means God is my helper.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
N. Florence is the leader of Peace group in Mukono. She is a business-oriented lady with a strong drive to succeed. She has a business selling all kinds of beer, wine, spirits and sodas to her customers. She is grateful that, for the three years she has been in business, people are catching on thereby enabling her to make enough profits and savings for future developments.

She started getting loans 1 and a half years ago and she has been able to buy a plot of land that she is currently using for farming, but in future she will construct a family house. She needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more crates of beer, wine and spirits for sale. She hopes to one day have a large bar and be able to sell more drinks.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more drinks.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 43 years old and married with three children. He lives in Zambezi, near the city of Nairobi, and operates a business near the bus terminal where there are many people and different business activities. He has been in the grocery business for the last six years.His customers are mainly passerbys and travelers. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing done by KADET staff.  Before KADET, he had never borrowed funds from other sources before. He has already taken out and paid back two loans with KADET.  With this third loan, Peter will be adding more stock to his grocery business.  His long term goal is to venture into dairy farming to supplement his grocery business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his grocery business

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan M., 52, and her husband, Mr. Toem Chab, 60, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married in 1977 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Four of them were married and live out side the family home. 
 
Yan has been selling grocery for 20 years. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. Her husband is a farmer. Yan is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase motorized hand tiller for her husband to farm.

loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.es:
Jessica es una persona emprendedora y jovial, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de una niña, ella se dedica a la venta de madera (tablas) de la especie bolaina, junto a su esposo desarrollan esta actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en el puerto de la ciudad de Pucallpa, pues es allí donde compran la madera y lo asierran para venderla. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza” desde hace seis año. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, el cual invirtió en la compra de repuestos para la máquina de aserrio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 soles, comprará tucos de bolaina (maderas). La meta de Jessica es tener una tienda de abarrotes y bebidas en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Jessica is a cheerful young entrepreneur. The 33 year old is married with a daughter, and works selling wood (planks) along with her husband. Their business is located in the port of Pucallpa, where they buy and saw the wood to sell it. She's been a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Senora de la Esperanza" for the past 6 years. The first loan she took was in the amount of 300 soles, money that she used to buy spare parts for her sawing machine. With this new loan of $1,050, Jessica will buy more wood and grow her business. Her goal is to make enough money so one day she can own a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie- 33 years old and married to Ariel, a welder.  They were blessed with two children: Mariel- 11 years old, grade 6 and Lady Maica- 6 years old, grade 1. They are presently residing in the village of Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi- urban and plain area which is five to seven kilometers from the city proper of Cauayan. 

Melanie manages a village store.  She sells grocery items like fruits, vegetables and other basic commodities. Her weekly net income is PHP 1,000.00. She now wanted to avail a loan of PHP15,000.00 that she can use to purchase more stocks.  She said that "determination and self- esteem are the most important in dealing a productive business".

loans.use: Additional capital in her retail store

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Minh Thị G. is 52 years old. She lives in Phuc Tho village with her husband and three children. She is farming, breeding pigs and poultry. She has gotten loans from the Microfund organization for three years and repaid on time. She is a group leader. She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy food for pigs and poultry. 
 There are five other Fund participants in her group:
 Mùi Thị Nguyễn is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry.
 Tần Thị Đào is 49 years old. She sells brooms at the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND.
 Mai Thị Vũ is 46 years old. She is a mason. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy pigs to raise.
 Tứ Thị Nguyễn is 41 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy materials to make brooms.
 Bổng Thị Nguyễn is 47 years old. She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs and poultry

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos,  ya que se conocen bien, son muy solidarios entre los mienbros del grupo. Su grupo se llama "EL PORVENIR", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada D. la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora  Lidia  ,ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 2 hijas  pero que actualmente vive sola es separada D. su esposo,  su actividad es la venta D. sal, el cual reparte a todas las zonas D. Cochabamba. Como tesorera esta la socia Irma   quien es muy responsable, es soltera no tiene hijos, trabaja vendiendio lenceria en las diferentes ferias,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital. Como secretaria  esta la  socia  Alejandrina  quien tiene el negocio D. venta D. comida en la puerta D. su casa ya que es la parada D. los Taxi trufis a pueblos cercanos, ella es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo,  el credito lo utiliza para capital.
texts.en:
This is a group that is very responsible for their payments, is already well-known, and which has much solidarity among the members. The group is called “El Porvenir “ (The Future) and is in their second loan cycle with the “Banco D. Empredimiento” (Bank of Entrepreneurship). The board is maD. up as follows: as president, Lidia, who is very responsible and is the leader of the group. She has 2 daughters, but she currently lives alone as she is separated from her husband. Her business activity is the selling of salt, which covers all areas of Cochabamba. As treasurer is Irma, who is very responsible and is single with no children. She works selling lingerie at different markets. As secretary is Alejandrina, who has a business selling food from her house, which is near the stop for collective taxis (taxis in which several persons share the fare) to nearby villages. She is divorced and has one son. The loan will used to increase capital.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital

loans.name: Patriciah

texts.en:
Patriciah is 27 years old and lives in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She is married to a clerk on the town council and they have one school-age child. Patriciah works as a green grocer. She sells greens and fruits to residents in her area and has been in business for two years. Her loan is for Kes. 20,000 and she will use the funds to buy more fruits and greens.

She describes herself as outgoing and funny.  She hopes to become a teacher and grow her grocery business so she can serve the entire town.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle D. is from the village of Brgy. Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of  products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Annabelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting her first loan, in the amount of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Comité “San Miguel” se formó con la unión varias vecinas de la ciudad de Guarambaré. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, la costura, preparación de comidas rápidas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.  Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
1
Pablina A..
Venta de frutas

texts.en:
The "San Miguel" Group was formed through the union of many neighbors in the city of Guarambaré. All the members of the group carry out independent activities, for example, sales, sewing, fast food preparation. The members formed a very tight-knit group capable of collaborating on activities that strengthen their camaraderie. All members of the group are mothers devoted to different activities with the goal of strengthening the economic stability of their household.

1) Pablina A., fruit sales; 2) Maximina B., food storage; 3) Maria C. A., fruit sales; 4) Melitona T., clothing sales; 5) Lucia R., fruit sales; 6) Lidia A., sales of inner & outerwear; 7) Isidora Albarenga, clothing sales; 8) Fidelina V. A., fruit sales; 9) Gabriela A., fruit sales; 10) Cristina Dora T., charcoal sales; 11) Lorenza V. de A., food sales; 12) Dionicia A. de Gill, event coverage; 13) Berta P., clothing sales; 14) Angela A. Davalos, fruit sales; 15) Elizabeth V. de Ortiz, clothing sales; 16) Clotilde A., fruit sales; 17) Martha B. Aquino, street vending (kiosk); 18) Juana M., food sales; 19) Elisa R., fruit sales; 20) Olga A., cosmetic sales.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The funds obtained by the group are invested in the small business of each of the group's members. The members invest in accordance with the needs which each has in her undertaking. The women who are in sales invest by purchasing merchandise, such as fruit, vegetables, rice, charcoal, clothes, etc.; those who are in sewing have invested the loan by purchasing raw material: threads, fabrics, needles and in some cases, machine repair, etc.

loans.name: Qoriccoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa y esta conformado por 11 socios. 

Nuestros socios alteran sus actividades del hogar con sus pequeños negocios como: Valentina vende menudencia de res y  Marisol confecciona de vestidos a pedido del cliente. 

Los demás socios se dedican a brindar servicios por ejemplo, Flora hace servicio de llamadas en la calle, Miguel trabaja como albañil, Julia es enfermera, Maria Pilar es cocinera,  Jhon cesar es guía de turismo y Carmen Irene es auxiliar técnico de contabilidad.

Nuestra socia Giovanna tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta Jora (La chicha de jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América, y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.). Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y he ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Giovanna requiere el préstamo para comprar más maíz.

Los socios que tienen negocios requieren el préstamo para comprar productos como menudencia y telas y los que brindan servicios para el gasto familiar como por ejemplo la educación de sus hijos.       

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Qoriccoyllor” communal bank and they live in the city of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The group meets every 30 days in the main office of the Asociación Arawia [Kiva Field Partner] and it is made up of 11 members. Our members alternate their diverse domestic activities with small businesses, such as: Valentina sells beef giblets and Marisol makes dresses to her client’s specifications. The other members work in services, for example: Flora provides street-side cell phone services, Miguel works as a bricklayer, Julia is a nurse, Maria Pilar is a cook, Jhon is a tour guide, and Carmen Irene is an accounting technical assistant. Our member Giovanna is 30 years old and she lives with her partner and has two children. She sells jora (jora chica is an ancestral beverage in Peru and America- its main ingredient is jora, which is fermented corn). She has been in this line of work for several years and it has gone well for her because of the effort she puts into her work. Giovanna needs the loan to buy more corn. The members who have businesses need the loan to buy products such as giblets and fabrics, and those who work in services need it for family expenses, like their children’s education. The members value and appreciate the loan granted to them through this program and they are committed to making their repayments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members who have businesses need the loan to buy products such as giblets and fabrics, and those who work in services need it for family expenses, like their children’s education.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn L., 31 years old, is a fish vendor. She has a boat, which her husband uses to catch fish. She has three children. Her eldest child is 10 years old. She also sells crabs. She wants to improve her family's economic situation. She wants to re-apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fishing materials and fish to resell.

loans.use: Obtain fish to resell and buy fishing nets

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Lainez es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a trabajar en un centro de labores donde reúne sus múltiples esfuerzos porque anhela mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que ha estado dañada pero que hoy en día ha tomado la decisión de iniciar a mejorarla para brindarle a su familia y en especial a sus hijos un techo seguro done puedan vivir en armonía en el departamento de Chinandega.
Es esta la razón por la que ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, clavos, alfajillas y clavadores para invertirlo en su vivienda y así llevar a cabo la obra que tanto anhela.
texts.en:
Ana Lainez is a hardworking woman who works at a work site where she fulfills her varied endeavors because she desires to improve the conditions of her home, which has been damaged. Today she has taken the decision to start the improvements, so as to provide her family and especially her children with a secure roof where they can live in harmony in the Chinandega department. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as corrugated metal roofing, nails, lumber and nail spikers (nail guns) to invest in her home and in this way finish the work that she so strongly desires.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel C. is from the village of Kadingilan, Bukidnon. He is a 25 year-old single man. Romel owns and operates a  taxi business for local community members. He's been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Romel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase materials that he needed to provide his service. He is requesting a new, second loan of 8000 PHP to further invest in expanding the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his taxi business.

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario 5 Group

texts.en:
Alberto is the coordinator of his group, Desrrollo Comunitario 5 (Community Development), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Alberto’s group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home there in a simple structure with his long-term partner.

Alberto is excited to be taking his eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling coconuts by purchasing more coconuts to sell.

Alberto will use the profits to invest in his home by replacing the wooden walls with block and in his long term ambition of having a truck to haul his coconuts with. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely G. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family selling meat in the local market. She lives in Omilis, Cauayan, Negros Occidental with her husband and their four children, who are 3 – 16 years old with three of them currently going to school. Fely has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her local meat market business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Fely is now borrowing 17,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her buy and sell meat business. This will be her 17th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Fely aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rizalina's Group

texts.en:
Rizalina G. is from the village of Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Rizalina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Rizalina is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Rizalina owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Rizalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rizalina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children who attend school. She owns her house and has no piped water or electricity. Her husband is a driver and she has a kiosk where she sells vegetables and clothes. She has been in this business for five years and was previously operating a retail shop. She now sells her products from home. Her other source of income is from renting houses.
With her 20,000 KES loan, Rose wants to purchase tomatoes, cabbage, kale, baby and women's clothes. Her greatest challenge is the rainy season when business is very slow. In the future, she hopes to expand her rental business by constructing more rooms for rent. Rose wanted to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because she liked that they are a cooperative and treat their clients well.

loans.use: To purcahse tomatoes, cabbage, kale, baby and women's clothes

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Srey C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Mab Mao, is a fisherman who can earn a small income to support his family's living. This couple has three children; one is a student in the local school while the other two are too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Martina De Los A

texts.es: Martina de los Ángeles tiene 58 años. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos. Su actividad económica es una librería, hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio. Fue por iniciativa propia que inicio este negocio, desde ese momento se ha sacrificado por mantener este medio de vida, ya que a su edad no puede obtener trabajo fácilmente. Ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación durante los años. Sus resultados han sido favorables para que siga con su librería. Solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, marcadores, reglas y artículos de oficinas. El sueño de esta Señora es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Martina de los Ángeles is 58 years old. This is not the first experience that she has with funding. Her business is a bookstore and she has been in this business for more than 17 years. It was through her own initiative that this business was started. From that moment, she has sacrificed herself to maintain this means of life, since she can’t obtain work easily at her age. She has worked with effort and dedication throughout the years. Her outcomes have been favorable for her to continue with her bookstore. She is requesting this loan for working capital for the purchase of notebooks, pencils, erasers, markers, rulers and office supplies. The dream of this woman is to continue with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar lives in Multan, the city of shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan. She is a very supportive woman. Besides carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife and being a good mother, she also supports her husband financially with her domestic sewing business. She fulfills orders from her neighbors to sew clothes. She charges reasonable fees for her sewing, which keeps her customers returning. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) which she will invest in her sewing business. The loan will help her buy an electric sewing machine. She thinks that in this way she will be able to fulfill the bigger orders on time.

Note: "Parveen Akhtar is doing her domestic work in this picture and Haleema, another group member, is showing her clothes for her clothing selling business".

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina E. C. es casada tiene 44 años de edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel de primario, tiene 3 hijos. Rufina vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona de Caico de la provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Rufina y su esposo se dedican a la producción de leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero de la zona, para su posterior recojo por parte de PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Rufina es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella su esposo y sus hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado de las mismas, actividad en la que participa toda la familia.   

La señora Rufina solicita el crédito para la adquisición de un lote de terreno que le servirá para el posterior sembradío de forraje en general, con lo cual pueda mantener la producción de leche de manera que no bajen sus ingresos y estos se mantengan estables. El ideal que tiene la señora Rufina es que por lo menos todos sus hijos terminen la colegiatura y posteriormente alcanzar alguna profesión.
texts.en:
Rufina E. C. is 44, married with three children and only has a grade school education. Rufina lives with her husband in the Caico area of Quillacollo province in the department of Cochabamba. Rufina and her husband make a living by producing raw milk. They deliver their all their product to a dairy cooperative which is then gathered by PIL ANDINA. Their living conditions are modest, with just basic services. They raise their cattle on this same property. Rufina is very hard working, and her husband and children get up early every day to milk the cows and then they all spend the rest of the day caring for the cattle. Rufina is requesting the loan to purchase a plot of land that could be planted for grazing. This will help keep up the milk production as well as maintaining their income stable. Rufina's dream is to see at least two of her children finish high school and go on to a career.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of land for planting

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl es casado, tiene dos  hijos,  todos  en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de verduras y comestibles por las colonias, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. 

Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. 
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl is married and has two school age children. He sells vegetables and food in different neighborhoods. Since his business is increasing, he is able to generate a good income.

With the help of his wife, Raúl is able to move forward with great sacrifice and effort. Today he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with several loyal customers thanks to his friendly personality. Raúl has demonstrated that he is a responsible individual who is honest in all of his commitments.

He is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris vive en la ciudad del Cusco y está casada con Donato. Fruto de esta unión tienen dos hijos hermosos. Hace dos años atrás Beatriz se las ingenio para abrir un pequeño negocio  de venta de ropa y venta de herramientas. El negocio consiste en comprar mercadería de diferentes ciudades como de Lima, Tacna y Desaguadero.  Una vez comprado la mercadería, Doris lleva a vender a las ciudades de Quillabamba y Puerto Maldonado. Doris vende  a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y a bajos costos y por ese motivo sus clientes se van contentos y después vuelen. Los clientes de Doris le dicen de cariño  “CASERA”.  

Actualmente,  ella y su esposo trabajan en diferentes negocios. Al principio tenían poco capital pero necesitaban más dinero, entonces se les presento la oportunidad de pertenecer  a la Asociación Arariwa quien les presta dinero. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Doris espera recibir $600 USD. Por el momento, su negocio de venta de ropa y herramientas esta modestamente equipado con mercadería surtida, pero quiere aumentar el capital del negocio. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones y polos.      

Doris participa en el banco comunal “El Amanecer”, y sus compañeras le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos
texts.en:
Doris lives in the city of Cusco and is married to Donato. They have two beautiful children. Two years ago, Doris figured a way to open a small business selling clothing and tools. She buys merchandise from different cities, such as Lima, Tacna, and Desaguadero. Once the merchandise is purchased, Doris takes it to sell in the cities of Quillabamba and Puerto Maldonado. Doris sells her customers good-quality products at low prices; they leave happy and then return again. Doris’ customers affectionately call her “Casera” ["Homebody"]. Currently she and her husband work in different businesses. At first they had little capital and needed more money. Then they were presented with the opportunity to belong to the Asociación Arariwa, which lends money. With her next loan Doris expects to receive $600.00. For the moment, her business selling clothing and tools is modestly stocked with merchandise, but she wants to increase capital for the business. She would like to use the money from the loan to buy clothing such as pants and polo shirts. Doris participates in the “El Amanecer” [The Dawn] communal bank and her fellow members have reaffirmed their trust in her for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing such as pants and polo shirts

loans.name: 080505-Hoang Thinh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Khanh H. T., 28, lives in the town of H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa. Khanh is the leader of a 8-member loan group. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 080505-H. Thinh-H. Hoa.

Khanh is married and has two young children. To making a living, Khanh operates a family member's business raising livestock. The main source of income comes from raising cattL. for saL..  Khanh has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Khanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Khanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,274,400 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  H. T. Hien is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in raising livestock.

2.  N. T. My is a 65-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,442,600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  H. T. Huong is a 22-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  L. T. Loan is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,124,000 VND loan to support her her business raising livestock.

5.  H. T. Toi is a 30-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6.  H. T. Ai is a 60-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

7.  H. T. Lai is a 42-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Thanh Hoa Fund Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Khanh H. T. (39) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa-Thanh Hoa.  Khanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 080505-H. Thinh-H. Hoa (080505-H. Thinh-H. Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Khanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Khanh kiếm được khoảng 1,200,000 VND.  Vào 2008, Khanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Khanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,274,400 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  H. T. Hien (44) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  N. T. My (34) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  H. T. Huong (45) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  L. T. Loan (46) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2124000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  H. T. Toi (47) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6.  H. T. Ai (30) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

7.  H. T. Lai (40) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Duxon Heriberto

texts.es:
Duxon de 40 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. 

Hace 7 años atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había y necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia, poco a poco vendiendo legumbres y surtiendo con aceites, arroz, bebidas su pequeño local pudo tener su tienda. Ahora trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo atendiendo en las tardes la tienda. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería ya que la quiere variar con las artículos. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su tienda con artículos de bazar.
texts.en:
Duxon is 40 years old and has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in a suburban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil, a zone characterized by its mountainous roads. He started his store seven years ago because there were no others in his sector and he needed to generate an income for his family. Little by little he began selling beans, and later added cooking oil, rice, and drinks. With this, he was able to establish his store. Now he works with his wife's help, tending the store in the evenings. He wants to buy paper goods with the money from this loan, in order to stock the store with a greater variety of goods. In the future he wants to have his store well stocked with paper goods.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paper goods

loans.name: La Cuesta Group

texts.es:
el grupo La Cuesta esta ubicado en la aldea que lleva su mismo nombre, esta formado por cuatro pèrsonas dos hombres y dos mujeres todos vecinos que se dedican a diferentes actividades que les generan ingresos para salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Jacinto F. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado y  tiene 5 hijos, algunos le ayudan con el ganado que el tiene y cultivo de maiz, el señor Jacinto tiene ingresos que son de la venta de cuajada, leche, molino de
moler maiz, Jacinto vive comodamente y es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta. el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en la compra de toretes para la venta ya que el tiene una pequeña pesa en donde destaza reses y las comercializa en mercados de la region.
 
la sra. Santos Dominga V. Reyes tiene 38 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos que 
dependen de ella, Santos tiene casa propia y un vehiculo que le sirve para transportar el producto
que ella vende que son verduras, todos los dias sale a vender la verdura que compra en Tegucigalpa y la vende en San Lorenzo y caserios, va tres veces por semana y se tarda dos dias en vender lo que trae de verduras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras.
 
don Juan Maria F. C. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos que dependen de el, Juan  
se dedica a la cria y venta de ganado y tambien a la venta de leche y cuajada desde hace hace varios años.
don juan es una persona muy solidaria y seria dedicada a su familia y a su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un torete.
su mayor sueño es tener mucho ganado y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

la sra. Jessica Yolibeth C. M. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene dos hijos que
dependen de ella, su marido es policia preventivo sus ingresos familiares provienen de la compra venta de verduras que compra en Tegucigalpa y la vende en Nacaome y San Lorenzo,  va dos veces por semana y vende su producto en su vehiculo,  tiene a una persona que maneja el carro y ella atiende al cliente que va a comprar, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de mas verduras para asi obtener mas ganancias y suplir las nececidades de su familia.
texts.en:
The group “La Cuesta” is located in the village that has the same name. It is comprised of 4 individuals – two men and two women who are neighbors and have different business from which they earn income and use to get ahead. Below are more details on their different businesses:

Jacinto F. is 49 years old, married, and has 5 children. Some of his children help him with his cattle and with his corn crops. Jacinto receives income from selling curd, milk, and corn mills. He lives comfortably and is a very hardworking and honest person. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of young bulls to sell since he has a small weight where he cuts beef and sells them in the markets of the region.

Santos Dominga V. Reyes is 38 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has three children who are her dependents. Santos has her own house and a vehicle that she uses to transport the vegetables that she sells. Every day, she goes out to sell the vegetables that she first purchases in Tegucigalpa and then sells in San Lorenzo and neighborhoods. She goes to Tegucigalpa three times each week and it takes two days to sell the vegetables that she brings. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables.

Juan Maria F. C. is 44 years old, married, and has five children who are his dependents. He works raising and selling cattle as well as selling milk and curd. He has been doing so for several years. Juan is a very supportive and reliable person, dedicated to his family and his business. He will use the loan to purchase a young bull. His biggest dream is to have a lot of cattle and be assured of the well being of his family.

Jessica Yolibeth C. M. is 29 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has two children who are her dependents. Her husband is a policeman. Her family income comes from the purchase and sale of vegetables that she first buys in Tegucigalpa and then sells in Nacaome and San Lorenzo. She goes to Tegucigalpa twice a week and sells her products from her vehicle. She has a person that drives the car and she attends to the customers. She has been in this business for the past 2 years. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more vegetables so that she can have more earnings and meet her family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, cattle, milk, beans, corn, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, corn and wheat flour, salt, and soaps.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie E. is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Lurugan, a part of Valencia City in Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Angie runs a specialized retail store from which she buys and sells silver-plated jewelry like bracelets and necklaces to the local community. Angie has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Angie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Martha Otembo

texts.en:
Martha O. is a 23 year-old unmarried woman from Luanda area which is not far from Vihiga town. She lives alone but supports her siblings and parents from the income she earns from her business.

Martha has a clothes store that she has had for the past three years.  From it, she earns an income of Kshs 14,000 per month. She is applying for her second loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd. after successfully completing the first one. She intends to use the money to buy five bails of new clothes to add to her stock. The profits made will basically be used to pay school fees for her siblings and to expand her capital base.

Her dream is to see her business expand and to purchase a textile machine.

loans.use: Buy  five  bails of clothes

loans.name: Nuriym's Group

texts.en: Nuriym B. is the leader of the group. She is 40, divorced and has three daughters. The first daughter is a seller in a store, the second is at school and the youngest daughter is preschool age (under 7). Nuriyim works as a seller in a store, too, and she is also engaged in cattle breeding. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to build a new house. Mairamkul T., 52, is the treasurer of the group. She has a son who is 12 and studies at school. In order to earn money, Mairamkul sells apples and pears at the market. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase apples and pears for sale. Gulnura K., 26, is married. Her husband works as an inspector in the Tax Department. Together they are bringing up two daughters. Gulnura hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase clothes for her daughters. Aigul T., 22, is married and has a newborn son. Aigul and her husband are farmers. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase potatoes and coal for the winter season. b>====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a resident and a farmer in Nyamira Town in Western Kenya, producing tea, bananas, maize, tomatoes, and cabbages for the last 7 years.  His produce are always sold locally.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He believes his business can grow and enable him to venture into the public transport business in the future.  He also says the loan will improve his income and also help in educating his child with the income generated.

Caleb's main challenge remains the poor road network and drought.  He appreciates the loan advances from the company.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Piñon, Samboan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a videoke business. Her husband Eric G., who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have 5 children who are between 9 and 25 years old. One child already has a family, 3 are working and 1 is currently going to school. 

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, with which she intends to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and put up an additional business(poultry). 

Gina G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Daisy Mei

texts.en:
Daisy Mei R. is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Daisy Mei is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy Mei makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like sandwiches and banana cues in the local community. Daisy Mei is just starting this business.

In 2010, Daisy Mei joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy Mei has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Daisy Mei is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This will be Daisy Mei's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Josè Gumercindo

texts.es:
Josè Gumercindo R. M.  tiene 52 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre junto a su compañera y sus hijos en el cantón de Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Josè Gumercindo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Josè Gumercindo R. M. is 52 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 3 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

José Gumercindo is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and makes his sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

José Gumercindo is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his rice, banana, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve his family's quality of life.

José Gumercindo likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Aynudin

texts.ru: Курбонов Айнудин житель района Восе. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование средне - специальное, товаровед. По специальности не работает. Он занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Уже три года он занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы и овощей. То есть на полученный кредит он намерен закупить семена.
texts.en: Aynudin K., 41, lives in Vose with his wife and two children. Although Aynudin received training as a commodities expert, he works in crop production. He owns a plot of land where he grows wheat and vegetables. Having been in this business for three years, he is applying for a loan that he would use for for buying seeds for planting vegetables and wheat.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice and Corey, co-owners of an art gallery, clothing and accessories shop in San Francisco’s Lower Haight neighborhood, pride themselves on providing a space for local artists to shine. “We are really proud of the people we’ve been able to bring together,” says Janice. Since the store’s founding in 2006, Lower Haters has developed a dedicated following of artists, designers, friends, and fans. 
 
Marketing and finding new customers is Lower Haters’ biggest challenge, according to Janice, but once people have visited they usually come back. All of the items found in Lower Haters are designed by local artists, so “people feel connected to every piece in here. The artists often stop by the store, and we end up becoming a big family.” 
 
Janice and Corey further foster that sense of community by actively participating in the neighborhood merchant’s association, the Lower Haight Art Walk, and by transforming Lower Haters once a month for their late-night art receptions. In addition, they have begun hosting trunk shows where vendors are able to set up their own booths right in the shop, and interact directly with their customers. 
 
Janice and Corey now want to add silk-screening to the list of services that they can offer. Up-and-coming artists, who may not be able to afford the higher cost of small run printing services offered by other companies, will be able to bring their designs to print at Lower Haters. Printed t-shirts will be sold directly in the store, or made for concerts and other promotional events. 
 
But despite Lower Haters’ success and the new business that silk-screening will attract, Janice and Corey were unable to secure a small business loan from a traditional bank. With a $5,000 loan from Opportunity Fund, their local microlender, Janice and Corey will be able to purchase a used silkscreen machine and begin operating it at their store. They are excited about the collaborations this new equipment will allow them to pursue. 
 
To find out more about Lower Haters and shop online, visit: http://lowerhater.com

loans.use: To purchase a used, commercial screen printing machine

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth Z. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Jeneth is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jeneth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Jeneth has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeneth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeneth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jeneth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages & canned goods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jeneth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
JUAN CARLOS P. SANCHEZ, ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO OPERARIO, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE UN NIÑO, Y ESTE ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON JUAN CARLOS  ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA Y HIERRO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN MURO EN LA PARTE DELANTERA DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA BRINDARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos P. S.is from Managua. He works as a machine operator and is a father to one school-aged child who depends on him financially. 

Juan Carlos went to the Ceprodel office to request a loan to improve his home. He plans to purchase building materials including sand, cement, stone and iron to build a wall at the back of his house. These home improvements will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Tomas Andres

texts.es:
El señor Tomas C. tiene 32 años, vive en la compañía Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es muy activo, se dedica a la compra y empaquetamiento de especias, condimentos y plantas medicinales en general. Esta actividad lo está realizando desde el año 1997, pues le había ayudado un amigo al principio y luego con el apoyo de sus padres había montado su propio negocio. Hoy día cuenta con mucha clientela y tiene visión de crecimiento.
Él tiene varios créditos cancelados con buen promedio de pagos y según comentó su demanda había crecido pero no tiene la capacidad suficiente para abastecer el mercado, razón por la cual solicita el apoyo crediticio.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene casa propia y su expectativa se orienta en mejorar su calidad de vida  y por ende la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas C. is 32 years old and lives in Potrero in the city of Carapeguá. He is very active and works selling and packaging spices, condiments, and medicinal plants. He has done this work since 1997 after a friend helped him get started and his parents later helped him start his own business. He currently has a lot of customers and foresees a lot of growth.

He has repaid many loans at a good rate and shared that his demand has been increasing but he does not have enough merchandise to meet demand and for this reason is asking for loan support. Thanks to his hard work he already has his own house and expects to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Buy anise, dill, borage, and other spices and medicinal plants

loans.name: Janyl

texts.en:
Janyl J. is 51, widowed, and has three children.  She has been working as a doctor's assistant at the local hospital for the last thirty years and is known as a very open-hearted and responsible person. Unfortunately, salaries of medical personnel are low, so in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, she decided to start her land-cultivating and cattle-breeding business. 

She has been engaged in this business since 2000 and has managed to develop a farm with two horses, seventeen sheep, three goats and one milk cow. In 2007, she obtained her first loan of 10,000 KGS and successfully repaid it without any delays. 

Now Janyl has applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS to purchase calves and sheep. With the income, she plans to broaden her farm by purchasing a plot of land for constructing a barn for her cattle. 
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz C. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Luz is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Luz owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling school supplies like chalk boards, pens, sharpeners and also different products like lighters, sunglasses and combs in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Luz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like stationery and toys. This will be the third loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like stationery and toys

loans.name: Magid

texts.en:
Magid is a 35-year-old single man living in Dahieh. Since 1993, he has owned a grocery store. He is a hard worker who is beloved by all his neighbors and friends, many of whom are his customers. 

Magid is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua to add summer products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell and increase his business capital. He will also use his loan to fully repay a loan on his new car. Magid hopes to expand his business in the future and he is also planning to start his own small family.

loans.use: to add summer products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice and to pay for preparing his fields

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, 62, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia – an area known for palm products. Ros is a farmer, earning $1.50 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning $4 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $90 US on food and $10 US on other expenses. 

Ros is requesting a loan of $1200 US to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the family's farming. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Maria Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Maria Lourdes is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell and ingredients for her food production business.

Maria Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell and ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng, 47 year old, is a cake seller. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $7 per day. They have six children; three are studying and the other three are working as laborers. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $40 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy farmland to have a field. She wants to get a small shop to sell groceries at home and repair her house. More than that, she hopes to send all of her family to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy farmland to have a field

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. She has four children and her children go to school.

She has four cows. Her main income is milk sales.

She is requesting a loan for two more cows. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan has 20 years of experience working in selling beauty products and cosmetics to locA. customers. She works on a freelance basis. Asmahan is a 51-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three children, one of whom is still attending school. With her requested loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l., she will invest in expanding her inventory selection. 

Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their children while also helping to supplement their household incomes. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her inventory selection.

loans.name: Yelba Merari

texts.es: Yelba Merari tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de calzado. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de este medio de vida. Ha salido adelante  con el gran esfuerzo de trabajo a pesar de ser una actividad muy humilde ha logrado obtener lo necesario. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de  zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, sandalias, chinelas para baños, calzado para niños entre otros. Espera en un futuro llegar en transformar su pequeño local en una gran tienda.
texts.en:
Yelba Merari is 26 years old and earns her living by selling shoes. She has been in this business for more than four years. Yelba is an enterprising woman who enjoys her work. She has been able to get ahead by working hard. Even though this is a modest business, Yelba has been able to earn what she needs.

This loan will be used to buy slippers, sports shoes, sandals, flip-flops, children’s shoes, and other items. In the future, she hopes to transform her small shop into a large store.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sports shoes, sandals, flip-flops, children’s shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 65 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is widowed and has two children. 

To earn a living, Esmeralda has a business selling livestock. She earns about 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Esmeralda has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock meat for her wholesale business. 

Esmeralda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Esmeralda would like to continue her business to supplement her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock meat for her wholesale business

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una emprendedora que desde hace dos años decidió crear su propio negocio desde su casa, una tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos productos de la canasta familiar, la tienda está ubicada en su propia casa lo que le permite estar pendiente del hogar y de sus hijos. 

Gloria necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos de aseo personal, los cuales son de gran demanda por parte de sus clientes, así mejorará sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria is an entrepreneur who two years ago decided to create her own business from her house, a shop in which she offers her neighbors basic necessities. The store is located in her own house, which permits her to take care of her home and her children.

Gloria needs a loan to buy toiletries, which are in great demand by her customers. Thus she will improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy personal toiletries for her store.

loans.name: El Arca De La Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Arca D. L. Fe” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran comercio ambulante, preparación D. colaciones, preparación D. comida rápida y negocios particulares. Todos ellos pertenecientes a L. ciudad D. Chillán. 
Ivon integrante del Banco comunal quien en L. foto se encuentra en L. segunda fiL., en el quinto lugar D. derecha a izquierda, su cabello lo usa largo y usa una chaqueta color negro.
ElL. se dedica al comercio ambulante desD. hace 3 años, compra fierros en el campo y posteriormente los venD. en una empresa metalúrgica. L. carga diaria D. venta D. fierro es D. 1.500 kilos, comenta que le va muy bien y que trabaja junto a su marido.
Con el crédito arreglará su camioneta que es el medio D. transporte para el traslado D. fierros. Ya que estuvo 2 meses sin poder trabajar debido al mal estado en que se encontraba su vehículo. 
Sus metas son expandir su negocio y comprar otro vehículo para concretar éste proyecto, ya que también quiere agregar venta D. bebestibles y comestibles. 
Ivon vive junto a su marido e hijo D. 5 años D. edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia, para esto debe postular al subsidio habitacional. 
ElL. está muy contenta y agradecida D. los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que comenta que el crédito le permitió comenzar en su negocio y volver a invertir.
Ivon se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece, ya que tienen disponibilidad D. trabajar en equipo y están comprometidos cada uno D. los emprendedores con sus negocios. 
Chillán es una comuna D. L. zona centro sur D. Chile. Su nombre significa “silL. del sol” en mapudungun, idioma D. nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna D. L. Patria” o “Tierra D. Artistas”, debido a que en L. ciudad han nacido destacados personajes D. L. historia D. Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
