texts.en:
This communal bank is called El Arca D. L. Fe.  It is maD. up of 18 enterprising individuals who work in different fields, among which are commerce, small meal preparation, fast food preparation, and private businesses.  They are all residents of the City of Chillán.

Ivon is the communal bank member who is fifth from the left in the second row.  She wears her hair long and has on a black jacket.

She has been in commerce for three years.  She buys scrap metal in the field then sells it to a metallurgical business.  Her daily load of metal sold is 1,500 kilos. She notes that her business is going well and that she works with her husband.

With his loan she will repair her truck, which is her means of transporting the scrap metal.  She has already had to go two months with working because her vehicle is in bad condition.

Her goals are to expand her business and to buy another vehicle to make this happen since she also wants to begin selling food and beverages.

Ivon lives with her husband and her 5 year-old son.  Her personal dream is to own her own home.  For this to happen she will have to make a proposal to the housing subsidy.

She is very happy with and thankful for the services Fondo Esperanza offers, as the financing allowed her to begin her business and to reinvest in it.

Ivon is very comfortable with the communal bank group she belongs to since they are available to work together and each and every one of the entrepreneurs is dedicated to his or her business.

Chillán is a town in the central region of Chile.  It's name means "sun chair" in Mapundungun, the language of our native people, the Mapuches.

Chillán is known as the "cradle of the country" or the "land of the artists" because important figures in Chilean history, such as the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau, were born here.

loans.use: to fix her truck, which is her means of transporting metal.  She has always been unable to work for two months because her vehicle is in bad condition.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Raquel; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz y también vende jora en el mercado de Anta, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, jora y negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y productos de belleza como lápiz labiales, perfumes y cremas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Raquel is a member of the Communal Bank “Amanecer Anteña” which is located in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

She is 30 years old and single. Raquel divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling corn. She also sells corn kernels at the market in Anta. In addition, Raquel has a business selling beauty products. Through these businesses, she is able to help her children move forward. Raquel wants to expand her businesses of selling corn, corn kernels, and beauty products. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy corn and beauty products such as lip pencils, perfumes, and crèmes in bulk.

Raquel is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn and beauty products such as lip pencils, perfumes, and crèmes in bulk.

loans.name: Wake Up Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wake Up SHG Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Wake Up SHG Group. She takes care of ten children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting eleven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest one and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Wake Up SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Beatrice is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela has run her hog raising business for two years. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. Her family lives within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. Tarcela wakes up early in the morning to feed her piglets. After feeding her raised hogs, Tarcela will sell vegetables to increase her income. She believes that she can overcome all her difficulties in running her business and provide for the needs of her family. 

Tarcela would like to request for additional capital amounting to P7,000 to buy feed for her piglets. This amount would really a great help most especially in providing the necessary vitamins and feed maintenance of her raised piglets. In this way, she could sell them for a  greater price, allowing her to send her children into a higher level of education. She hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years old and a married woman. She has three children and one is in school. She has had a business selling breads in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, aged 46, is a married woman.  She is a persevering, tenacious, enterprising woman who wants to progress more each day. She sells different vegetables in a stand in the community where she works all day with help from her children. 

Lolita has requested a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy other vegetables such as squash, beans and tomatoes for additional income and also to have more to offer to the people in the community.

Lolita’s main dream is to provide her children with an education. She is very grateful for the loan because it will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy squash, beans and tomatoes for her business

loans.name: Xinia Maria

texts.es:
Xinia Maria tiene 35 años, y vive con sus tres hijos. Xinia es dueña de un restaurante, donde ella vende comidas rapidas, casados (un plato tipico costaricense, donde se sirve arroz y fijoles con algun tipo de carne), y menu a la carta.

Xinia inicio su negocio hace 6 meses. Ella establecio su restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina y quiere crecer como negociante. Ella trabaja 7 dias a la semana, se levanta a las 4 am a preparar los alimentos para la venta. Xinia labora alrededor de 18 horas continuas diariamente en su negocio. Ella ha crecido mucho en lo personal, ya que paso de ser empleada, a ser dueña y administradora. Gracias a eso ella ha podido brindarle una mejor educacion a sus hijos.

Xinia ha solicitado un prestamo a Fundacion Mujer para la compra de nuevo equipo para su negocio, tal como un pequeño congelador, baño maria, y utencilios de cocina. En un futuro Xinia desea oder tener su propia infrastructura para dejar de pagar alguiler. Xinia sabe que esta en una industria competitiva, pero tambien sabe que puede superar la competencia brindando mejor atencion al cliente, y precios competitivos.
texts.en:
Xinia Maria is 35 years old and lives with her 3 children. Xinia is the owner of a restaurant where she sells fast food, casados (a typical Costa Rican dish of rice and beans with some type of meat), and an à la carte menu.
Xinia started her business 6 months ago. She established her restaurant because she likes the kitchen and wants to grow as a business woman. She works 7 days a week. She gets up at 4 AM to prepare the food for sale. Xinia works about18 continuous hours daily in her business. She has grown a lot personally, since going from being employed to being owner and manager. Thanks to that, she has been able to provide a better education for her children.
Xinia has requested a loan from Fundación Mujer (Woman Foundation) in order to buy new equipment for her business such as a small freezer, a double boiler, and kitchen utensils. In the future Xinia wants to be able to have her own infrastructure so she can stop paying rent. Xinia knows that she is in a competitive industry, but also knows that she can surpass the competition providing better customer service and competitive prices.

loans.use: To buy equipment such as a freezer, a double boiler, and kitchen utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Emmily is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She runs a cosmetics shop to support her family. She also has a farming business to supplement her income. Emmily employs one person to assist her in managing her business. 
Emmily has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy hair braids and to renovate her business premises. In the next five years, Emmily wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Jayjay

texts.en: Jayjay  is 39 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has three children between 8 and 18, all of them are attending school and living with her sister.  For the past 18 years she has been selling  red oil (palm oil), pepper and rice in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper and rice for her business.  She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil), pepper and rice for her business

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en: Theopiste aged 27 years old has three children.  One of her kids goes to school.  She has been running the business of selling kid's clothes for eight years. She has requested this loan to buy more clothes to sell.  She plans to use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more kids cloths to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 27 years old and a farmer from the village of Chantliskure, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Irene and two little children. Omar earns a living through agriculture. He has a greenhouse, where cucumbers are grown during the whole year. Harvested cucumbers are sold at the local market. In addition, Omar has sheep. He sells lambs at the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris.

Omar requested a loan to pay the rent for the land where his greenhouses are located. In addition, part of the loan will be used for purchasing polyethylene for covering the greenhouse, as the old cover is already torn and needs to be changed. Omar will get a better harvest as the new cover will keep the correct temperature in the greenhouse. He will sell the harvested cucumbers for a convenient price and get a good income. Omar will use part of the income for purchasing additional sheep and the biggest part of the income will be used for purchasing household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay rent for land and purchase polyethylene cover for greenhouse

loans.name: Chachita

texts.es:
Chachita es una mujer de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Chachita no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de corte y confección, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca d Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Chachita trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, Chachita trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto con su negocio y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Chachita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, así también desea comprar materiales de construcción para ponerle piso de concreto a su negocio, así pues ella espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y junto a su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Chachita is a 57 year old woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and four children. She loves them very much and they are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly woman, hardworking and enthusiastic, who along with her husband devotes all her efforts to raising the family. Unfortunately Chachita was not able to study for the profession of dressmaking, since from a very young age she had to work to help her parents. In her free time she likes to watch educational programs on television and sometimes she cooks the tasty “Pachamanca de Chancho” (pork and other ingredients such as potatoes, cassava, corn, and beans, cooked on hot stones buried in the ground and seasoned with herbs).

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, day after day Chachita works in her little business of selling groceries and drinks. Chachita works from the early morning hours working for approximately twelve hours. She feels happy with her business and believes that it is going well because of the friendly treatment she gives her clients. 

Chachita is very grateful for the Kiva loans, and thanks to the assistance given to her she can buy merchandise for her business. She also wants to buy building supplies in order to put in a concrete floor in her business. She hopes to continue working and striving in order to achieve her big dream of expanding her business and she and her family hope to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store and construction materials in order to put in a concrete floor

loans.name: Pioneras De Huascar Group

texts.es: La alcancía comunal “Pioneras de Huáscar” fue creada hace más de 5 años por personas deseosas de triunfar en la vida y ahora lo conforman 5 personas muy responsables que decidieron trabajar en conjunto para lograr sus objetivos, está representada por su presidenta la Sra. Angélica de 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Tiene como negocio la venta de todo tipo de lácteos y quesos al por mayor y menor desde hace algunos años. Es por ello que el préstamo lo utilizara para comprar al por mayor diferentes tipos de lácteos y quesos para atender los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes. Ella se encuentra contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de kiva. En la foto grupal la Sra. Angélica se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.

loans.use: COMPRA DE LACTEOS Y QUESOS

loans.name: Adila

texts.en:
Adila is 55 year-old mother of 3 children. 2 of her children are students. 

Adila, who is the only supporter of her family, runs her own business since 1996. She started up her business with selling medication. With this small retail business and only $300 in working capital she could hardly earn enough money to support her family. 

In 2003 she opened her own pharmacy. She increased her capital within a very little time. She bought more medicines for her store and made necessary remodeling.  

Adila is now requesting a $500 loan to expand her stock of medicines, which will increase her income to meet the increasing needs of her family.  Adila is willing to repay her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expand her business and to buy other sort of drugs

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana works selling home electronics and plastics in the provinces. She started her business with the help of her spouse, who provided $200. At the beginning she only sold basins, buckets, and small utensils for everyday use. Now she also offers clothing, shoes, and wallets.

Roxana will use the loan to invest in sheets, curtains, and children's school shoes. She has faith that with these new products her business will grow.

Roxana is married and 21 years old. She depends on her business to get by, along with her husband. Roxana hopes that this loan will permit her to save toward the construction of a home.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer.)

Roxana se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y plásticos en provincias. Ella empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito 200 dólares. Al principio solo vendía lavacaras, baldes y pequeños utensilios de uso diario. Ahora continúa ofreciendo este producto junto con ropa, zapatos y carteras.

Roxana usara el préstamo para invertir en sabanas y toldos y zapatos escolares .Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio va a crecer.

Roxana esta casada tiene 21 años. Ella depende de su negocio para seguir adelante junto con su esposo. Roxana tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para construir su vivienda.

loans.use: Roxana will use the loan to invest in sheets, curtains, and children's school shoes.

loans.name: Brenda Patricia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Brenda Patricia. I am a merchant and I own a small grocery store at my home. This allows me to have income and to take care of my family. This is important to me, and I've been involved in this for several years now.

At the moment, my sales volume has grown and I need to better stock my business so I can offer a better variety of products to my customers. This way, I can increase my sales and my income. This will allow me to create a better living standard for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Brenda Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitacion, la que me permite obtener ingresos y cuidar de mi familia, situacion que para mi es muy importante. tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, actualmente el volumen de venta es mayor y necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente y de esa forma mejorar las ventas y por ende los ingreos. logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: To buy margarine, sugar, beans, rice, bathroom tissue, diary, corn, bread, and vegetables.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam N. is 65 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and two children. She sells duck eggs in a market and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Their combined income is 12 dollars a day. Mrs. Sam N. would like to purchase additional ducks to expand her business in food production.

loans.use: To purchase ducks

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O., an LAPO client, sells drugs and treats patients. She lives with her husband and five children in Uromi of Edo State and has been an LAPO client for over two years. Grace hopes to receive a loan of US $475 so that she can buy more drugs for resale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sales

loans.name: Nkwanzi Peace

texts.en:
Nkwanzi Peace has a very well-stocked business on a very busy road between Kampala and Entebbe in the village of Zana. Actually, she has three businesses under one roof. In her small storefront she has a boutique women’s clothing business, a housewares business and a video rental business. She carefully displays her items in a very orderly way in her limited space. She is very hardworking and has a lot of traffic at her location.

Eventually Nkwanzi Peace hopes to be able to sell her domestic wares wholesale to other shops. These consist mostly of plastic laundry baskets, glassware and pitchers. She works hard so that she can pay school fees for her children and eventually buy a plot of land and build a small house. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more of the domestic products, as they sell the fastest.

loans.use: To purchase more domestic products for her store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is single and owns a family printing business in downtown Izyum. Alexander is very creative and full of ideas. He has had rich experiences working in this business. Moreover, he is very enthusiastic about his own small enterprise and has a good attitude. Alexander sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. He has now been in this business for the past three years. Presently, his monthly net profit is about $300.

Alexander would like to get a loan of $1200 to purchase some necessary printing equipment. He believes that financial assistance will support him in his endeavors. He is determined to work to make his entrepreneurial dreams a reality, understanding that real success and wealth takes time. Alexander is hoping to generate additional profits and organize his wedding which is coming up in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase printing equipment

loans.name: Mikumi A Group

texts.en:
Grace, age 38, is married with 5 children (ages 22, 17, 15, 15, and 11). She owns a kiosk which she began 6 years ago. Her business is open from 7am to 10pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $36.

In the past, Grace took out 2 previous loans with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her kiosk business. She now hopes for a new loan to increase the same business and to open a food stand. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling various foods and clothes, working at kiosks, and tailoring.

In the picture, Grace is second from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Butimba C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jalia N.. She is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to start a clothing business. Jalia is 32 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Jalia makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Jalia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to increase her stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Jalia is joined in her small group by Edtih T. and Catherine Natawadiika. Edtih T. has a poultry business and wants to increase her stock. Catherine Natawadiika is currently operating a bar and hotel business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge.

loans.use: To start up a clothing business

loans.name: Ismatov

texts.ru:
A. Ismatov is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife works as a seamstress and sews kimono to order. A. himself works as a cashier at the local hospital. Recently A. purchased a plot of a land for gardening, but without fencing around it. He needs 1000 somoni to build a fence around his plot. A. feels that it will be more economical for him to take out a loan to build the fence and pay it back monthly using his salary.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Исматов Абдурахмон, возрост 47 лет имеет 3 детей ,жена портниха на дому шьет кимано по заказу.Сам Абдурахмон работает в областной больнице кассиром.Недавно Абдурахмон купил дачный участок ,но без ограждения.Ему для этого необходимо 1000 сомони.Абдурахмон считает что ему выгодней взяв кредит решить свою проблему, и каждый месяц погашать сумму со своей зарплаты.

loans.use: Fencing for a gardening plot

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1970, in Tchaoudjo in Togo, Ms. Latifa A. is married and the mother of three. She is an energetic woman and professionally manages her fashion boutique "Intellect Couture" that she created in 1990. She still includes the sale of pagnes (colorful print fabrics) and sewing-related items in her primary business. The first loan of 300,000 francs CFA that she obtained enabled her to acquire an extra sewing machine and an overcasting (stitching) machine. After having repaid her first loan without incident, she is requesting at present a loan of 400,000 francs CFA to buy 25 bolts of pagnes, 10 rolls of cloth, and a dozen rolls of decorative lace.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 31 décembre 1970 à Tchaoudjo au Togo, Madame A. Latifa est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est une femme dynamique et gère avec professionnalisme son atelier de couture « INTELLECT COUTURE » qu’elle a crée depuis 1990. Elle associe toujours la vente de pagne et des produits de mercerie à son activité principale. Le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu d’un montant de 300.000FCFA lui a permis d’acquérir une machine à coudre supplémentaire et une machine de surfilage. Après un bon remboursement de son premier crédit, Madame A. Latifa sollicite à présent un crédit de 400.000 FCFA pour acheter vingt cinq (25) pièces de pagne, dix huit (18) rouleaux de tissus et douze (12) rouleaux de guipures.

loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.es:
Nicasio is married and has 2 kids. He began his business because he didn’t have any other resources to rely on. Every single time he tried to look for work, people rejected him, making it difficult. That’s why he decided to open up his own business. He owns a store to help his family. He started his store at his home and has been doing it for 6 years now. He started with fruits, candy, and then slowly increased his merchandise. Now he has a greater variety of everything. His business has increased constantly. He likes his job because he’s his own boss.

He needs a loan of $300 and he will pay it in about 6 months. This credit will help restock more merchandise. It’ll be possible with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Nicasio es casado y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 18 años. Inició el negocio porque no cuenta con estudios por lo que le cerraban las puertas de los trabajos constantemente siendo muy difícil que lo contrataran, por esa razón se propuso abrir su propio negocio y así lo hizo. Puso una tiendita de abarrotes para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Comenzó hace mas de 6 años con el negocio lo inicio en su propia casa solo con mercancía de frituras y dulces y después poco a poco fue surtiendo de tal manera que ahora ya tiene mas variedad para que la gente que vive por allí lo busque y compre su mercancía. su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo y le gusta este trabajo porque es su propio jefe y tomo las decisiones que mejor le parecen para hacer crecer su tiendita y con esto mis ingresos.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses. Este crédito le servirá para poder surtir más mercancía. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.
